1.description: I think it's great.  They did a nice job with place.  The bathrooms are immaculate.  Sports, music, pool table, dancing.  If they don't have the drink you want they will go out and get it for you.  A good watering whole option in the neighborhood.  I'm looking forward to when the kitchen opens up.

2.description: Good Time Sports Bar is now open! Just checked it out this weekend. It's upstairs and a big space. They did a really nice job with the re-model. There's a pool table, dance floor, lots of tables and a big bar area. The bar tender when I was there was really nice and welcoming. Free parking in the back. They are building a restaurant downstairs where Taurus used to be and will have food in about a month. Really awesome addition to the neighborhood and 35th.

0.description: I am so happy that this place is open. The owner is amazing. The atmosphere is welcoming. The space is open and without obstructed views of all the tvs. I am thrilled to spend my cash in my neighborhood. I do not have to Uber to South Loop or West Loop or River North to grab a good drink at a good sports bar.

3.description: One word: YUMMY!!!! I kept seeing Loni Loo's canides mention online and saw they were being sold at Litehouse Whole Food Grill in Hyde Park. I tried them and I was hooked :) There declious pecan/pretzel clusters covered in either white, milk, or dark chocolate. I got one of each and they were delicious!!! For those that live farther there also sold online at loniloos.com. These candies would be perfect for any occasion and a great gift for the holidays coming up. I'm a fan!

1.description: OMG!!! BEST CANDIES IN THE WORLDI bought a large order of Loni Loo's for my office and they went so fast I barely got a few for myself. The packaging was really nice and unique...and the order was ready almost immediately. The candies came in white, dark, and (my fav) milk chocolate...and the candies are so good I have to give myself a prep talk to stop eating them all up at once!!!My coworkers are all looking forward to our next batch and I'll definitely be sending some packages out to clients this year as gifts. Thank you Loni Loo's!!!

2.description: BITE SIZE BLESSINGS!!!!! Each candy  is delightful and delicious. No matter where you are or what your doing one bite of this candy and you begin to have a moment of pure bliss. This candy is truly the best kept secret in town!

5.description: These brilliantly crafted treats are to die for!!!  They are beyond delicious and leave your mouthwatering craving more!!!  Perfect treats and snacks for any occasion year round...I highly recommend trying!!!!

6.description: These homemade candies are delectable and affordable; the chocolate is always so rich!  My favorite are the WHITE chocolate candies.  I also love the cute packaging- each candy is wrapped and sealed with the cute Loni Loo's logo!  I hear  the owner is from New Orleans, so you know it has to be PHENOMENAL!  Those New Orleanians know good food!

0.description: Wow is all I can say about these candies.  I ordered a large batch of Loni Loo's chocolates for my officemates, and I only was able to get one for myself, they ate them ALL!!  These candies are so deelish, the perfect mix of sweet and salty with some crunchiness to boot.  I am going to order another order and this time I am only bringing in a few to work, these things are addictive.  If you are a fan of chocolate candies e.g. Turtles, truffles, etc you will really like these. On another note, I always like to support small businesses, and this is a small business with great customer service, quick shipping, and a great product.  I highly recommend Loni Loo's to anyone for a yummy treat at home, to share with your coworkers, or as a gift for someone.

4.description: Addictive, delicious, and just the right size for a treat without being too much.  I love every one of the choices, dark, milk and white.  I wish I had some more right this moment.  Such a perfect mix of smooth and crispy, with nuts too! Yum!

1.description: I'm not sure what type of diseased chicken they use here but I only had a granola bar and water for breakfast, picked up some wings for lunch and shortly after my stomach was very upset, the chicken didn't taste fresh and I don't mean it wasn't freshly cooked but maybe it's been sitting in the freezer for a few months idk but my stomach was very dissatisfied  I should've went to the one on 51st n cottage but I was being lazy... Never again

2.description: The chicken is not that bad its good and fresh. Only thing that is a BIG problem is the hanging out in front of the doors. Hello that keeps people away. The prices are OK. I've only had the chicken wings. It is very clean in side and plenty of sweet cakes and pies. Maybe you can check them out but if its lots of things going on in the front of this place I just keep it moving.

0.description: I was surprised at how good this chicken is. Make sure to get the lemon pepper seasoning. Get the mild sauce to go with it. It's really good! This will be on my list of places to eat when I visit Chicago.

1.description: Place is no longer there.

2.description: I ordered from China Chef because it is very inexpensive-- the lowest priced place I have found that delivers to the South Loop.  However, the food sucks.  I thought it was very difficult to screw up Chinese food but they have succeeded.  The egg rolls are overly salty (I mean come on it's an egg roll how hard is that!), the crab rangoon has pink imitation crab in it, the Moo Shu pancakes that they give you are not homemade but are rather just white wanton wrappers,  the food is overly greasy in general.  I do not recommend you try this place even to save a buck.

0.description: Moon Palace's phone was disconnected so we ordered from China Chef instead as we were craving chinese takeout and they deliver! The hot and sour soup was pretty good, but thick and not as good as Moon Palace. The food was quite tasty (hunan chicken and hunan beef) but those w/ allergies beware...there were no nuts or sesame in my dish but something gave me a reaction - I assume they cooked it in the same wok as something w/ sesame or maybe used sesame oil....also, "brown rice" at this place is greasy, soy sauce drenched white rice....not real brown rice.

3.description: Ok, I tried, I really tired to love my neighborhood Walgreens, but the relationship is over.  Unfriendly, unhelpful employees in the pharmacy and forever long waits in line that staff appear to be entirely cavalier about. You can save that "Be well," I'll be better off shopping elsewhere.

1.description: Getting slower, they are open 24 hours and you may just need that to get your script. The post office is faster.

2.description: I stopped by this store this morning the cashier was talking to the the guy behind me. then she did a Price check for him now he hanging out on the side of me. (Not). After I said excuse me he was mad but how rude are you to talk at the counter when someone else is at the counter at that time. This store is getting a little bit higher on their pricing to.Oh yeahShe didn't even tell me to be well.

9.description: Nicely remodeled store. Staff are as friendly as they get for a drug store. Great to have in the neighborhood. Pretty busy but the line moves quickly and they are smart about calling in extra staff when needed.

10.description: This 5 stars is ONLY for their fresh baked goods, NOT for the rest of the store.  It is true that checkout lines can be very slow.  BUTThey carry a small collection of really amazing cake slices and cookies from Chicago and even Indiana bakeries that you can't find unless you go to each bakery.   They are located at the end of the aisle right next to the photo department, and you could easily miss it if you don't know to look.  Case in point:  Angelica's Bakery: German Chocolate Cake, a big packaged slice for $2.99 or 2 for $5.  Delicious!  moist, yummy, flavorful.Mrs. Winters Cakes: "Lunchroom Butter Cookies" big and yummy.  $2.99 for a package of 4, or 2 packages for $5.  Taste great w/a hot cup of tea, IMO.  My husband says these cookies taste very similar to cookies that were made in his childhood school lunchroom on the south side of Chicago.Heaven Sent bakery in Gary Indiana: Butter Pecan cookies.  Located in the cookie aisle.  $6.99 for a white paper bag, smaller cookies, crazy delicious.  So worth it.  I even wrote a yelp review for the bakery we're so in love with these cookies.  yelp.com/biz/heaven-sent…

4.description: I hate that the service is so slow. The lines be long as hell and they have the audacity to only have 1 or 2 lines open. The staff will sometimes be right near the cash registers but will continue on into their break room. The line is long as hell and they see that but they keep going into the break room instead of opening a register up to get the line down. This never happens at the Walgreens in the Caucasian neighborhoods or the Latino neighborhoods. Even the Walgreens in China Town doesn't have this problem.

6.description: The line is always crazy long. Some of the employees have very poor customer service skills, others are extremely friendly and helpful. I never know what I'm going to get.  Produce is good. Pharmacy service is even better.  It would be really nice if they could fix that security device by the door.  It seems to think that everyone is stealing. Tad bit annoying.Have a good day and be well.

12.description: Long lines and sub par customer service

5.description: This is one of slowest Walgreens I've ever been in. There is alway a long line and not enough worker to check the public out. I hate when I have to go in there

11.description: The Good: 1. Open 24 Hours2. If milk consumption is high in your family then this is the place you get Dean's milk atleast a $ less than Jewel Osco3. Usually u will find security folks roaming around this place in late night.Bad:1. Takes awful long at the register2. Pharmacy will ask you to come 2-3 hours late for a prescription and even after then you will have to wait for atleast half hour before you actually get it.

8.description: I'm from Bronzeville originally, and I am extremely pleased to see that our Walgreens has been remodeled just like the fancy ones downtown, which I have frequented as well.  This Walgreens does what every other Walgreens does, essentially.  The pharmacy could be better at communicating, however.  I was never contacted after my script had been filled, I checked in by chance and it was there.  The quick print photo machine does not operate as efficiently as it should and the lines move very slowly.  It always seems to be short staffed.  But the staff is accommodating and friendly.     I greatly appreciate that this Walgreens came up with many of the other ones.

0.description: Very SLOW. Lines are abnormally long. I only use this Walgreens because it is close by. People there can be friendly sometimes. But the service is still slow. One time, I waiting on line for 20-30 to just pick up something from pharmacy. Another time I waited for 20 minutes to buy a bag of chips and a bottle of soda. Only 2-3 cashiers are opened at a time, even when it's really busy. What I do like is that it's big, bright, and somewhat organized. I can always find my way and things I need easily. Hope to see they speed things up a little though.

7.description: I stopped by this store on Christmas Eve early in the morning before work around 0500 hours. I live two blocks from here and I come in here so much because its always open. Last week I stopped by the store to purchase discounted wrapping paper and two gift cards for Whole Foods and Home Depot. This particular morning on Christmas Eve, I decided to go back there and buy another gift card. I have always been aware that customers can't use a credit card to purchase Visa, American Express, Mastercard debit cards, and other major credit card gift cards, but I have always been able to use a credit card to purchase gift cards for Old Navy, Whole Foods, Macy.s, I Tunes, Facebook, Dunkin Doughnuts, Starbucks and etc. Since someone at work had given me a gift, this was the perfect opportunity to give them a gift card especially those that do not require a 5.95 cent extra charge for the card. The young lady at the counter insisted that I had no knowledge of what I spoke on. She told me (without going a get a manager) that you can't use a credit card to buy a gift card. I told her "no, you can't use a credit card to purchase a major credit card gift card" and then I asked her to check. She insisted that those were the rules and I told her "well ok, thanks you" and walked out.I then took my money to another pharmacy. I purchased a Macy.s gift card. I paid with my credit card Visa and that was that. Then I went to Jewel Food Store. I purchased another Victoria Secret gift card. I paid with my Visa, walked out the store and that was that. What is really funny is online, you can use your credit card to buy any gift card you want, from any store you want except you can't purchase Visa, American Express, Mastercard, and any other major credit card gift card. Why Walgreens staff are not all aware of this is a mystery to me, but it should not be different for one store and then another procedure for another store. Everybody should be on the same page. I was pissed off, it was bitter cold in Chicago and good thing the competition was open 24 hours too. They had no problem taking my money.

28.description: I waited in line for about 20mins while listening to the Manager reprimand an employee... in front a huge line of people...it was horrible. The poor employee was so embarrassed that she tuned out the manager ( I would do the same)....Once I received my coffee there was another hug line by the sugar and creamer station... Just bad.

1.description: the workers at this Starbucks are LAZY AND SO SLOW! SLOW SLOW SLOW, I would go to a different Starbucks but this is the only one in my area, there is always a line and I don't have time to stand around for 20 minutes before work.Oh, and 90% of the time I go there, there is a black bum waiting outside to ask you for money, I've told the Starbucks employees about it but I just got a blank stare, "duhh we can't do anything about it"terrible customer service and parking sucks here too, it's either pay to park on the crowded street or get a ticket around the corner where it's "permit parking only"

39.description: This is the go-to Starbucks for pre-pre and post-post White Sox games refreshment.  You know, before the pre and post game refreshment. And, of course, before the early, mid and late during game refreshments.It is a small and cozy one, but my only qualm is with the storefront's design - it's kind of a long, narrow store, so it seems like there should be two doors for entrance/exit, but there's just one, so there can be cramped walking areas (maybe they should have gotten some design help from IIT across the street there....)Be prepared for the mad crush before and after games - throngs of people in the black and white - ALMOST as cool as Raiders fans.  Almost.....Also conveniently located across the street from the IIT parking lot, which everybody knows is the easiest in-and-out parking for the best price near US Cellular Field.

9.description: The morning staff at this particular Starbucks is terrible. Most are lazy and rude. I'm sure glad I don't have to visit this location often - not how I want to start my day.

29.description: This Starbucks is like the rest of them. Very quick and accurate with the orders. They always get it right. I never have to put more than a quarter in the parking meter when visiting this Starbucks. Love it!

23.description: Nice little Starbucks.  However during da weekday mornings there are over 10 high school kids sitting in here and not buying anything cussing and say racial things.  Two employees walked by and said nothing at all.

5.description: Stopped in here after finishing up my morning run.  While I loved the neighborhood vibe, I have to say I was glad I wasn't in a hurry, as the barista was deep in baseball conversation with a group that looked like a local group for 6 am.  I enjoyed listening to their banter as I waited for my coffee, clearly evident I was in Cub country.  Lots of great table space, seems like a good location for setting up with a computer and getting work done if that is on your Starbucks checklist.

31.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.When I lived on the IIT campus for a summer, this Starbucks was a godsend.  This is not a neighborhood that I really want to go around exploring, and this store was right there.  Yet for all of the perks of easy access, these guys lose points for having a very small store with limited work space.  I would more often than not get a drink and leave to enjoy it elsewhere.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status (which I think is worth it even under the new company rules).  By doing so you get a free drink or food item after you've racked up 12 "gold stars" (items purchased).

25.description: This is great iteration of Starbucks. The line typically moves quickly, orders are accurate, and you can usually find a seat to sit in if you want to stay awhile. The only thing that drives me crazy is the paid street parking until 10pm (except on Sunday).

12.description: Frequently crowded, but I guess it's mostly IIT students using the free WIFI, because the people behind the counter have zero interest in selling you anything...or even acknowledging your existence.

37.description: Caffeinated beverages within walking distance!Working at IIT, we don't get many choices for coffeehouse coffee during the day - it's great to have another daytime option for meetings, breakfast, lunch, and/or breaks that's off-campus and close!  Everyone who has served me has been polite and efficient.  They make coming to work in the morning a little more perky!

21.description: I love the staff here. They get slammed by the IIT, Shimer and VanderCook student/staff/faculty crowd, as well as CPD, Sox fans on their way to the park, and high school students from the neighborhood. The entire staff, at all hours of the day, is on point, friendly and possibly even having a good time. Keep it up, 35th & State people!

16.description: Slow, slow, slow, slow.  Fully staffed but so slow.  No manager? Manager who doesn't know how to lead and motivate? 9 people standing around waiting for drinks.   Line out the door.  Wish this was my Starbucks I'd make a mint!

17.description: It's not a starbuck, its a coffee shop in da hood, I can barely understand the employee's hood rat accent, what's up with the attitude, you are the fat one speaking the disgusting dialect, oh, you can keep my coffee and my money, they will never see me again.

10.description: It is quite unfortunate a Fortune 500 company cannot find the proper resources to update information regarding store changes made in 2014. The store employees say the changes to their hours of operation have been in effect for almost a year yet the website, Google, Yelp, etc. all state incorrect hours. Starbucks is a place where people study, conduct business & schedule meetings based on hours of operation- they make & schedule plans using this accessible information in advance, as we did. We scheduled a meeting, picked this Starbucks location based on the location of everyone involved and once we got everyone there, we were told they were closing @ 9pm, although every resource we checked says 5:00am - 10:00pm. It sounds great to have new hours on one window facing the State street side of the building. That doesn't really help someone entering from the 35th street side of the building since the hours aren't also on the main entrance doors. I would rather have given my business to someplace else or at least to another location had I been able to plan in advance- to my disappointment I was not given that opportunity, just like many other customers who were walking in @ 8:45 & 9pm.

11.description: It's so unfortunate that there is one Starbucks in the city of Chicago that just can't get it right and live up to the brand....it's this one. I'm not going to rate the availability of parking because it's busy in the area so what do you expect. But this is solely on the drinks and food. I've been here several times because I live in Bronzeville and I drive pass quite often. I have NEVER had a standard Starbucks drink from here. They are always off with their drinks. How do you mess up your signature drink like a frappe? It's water downed and taste so artificial. They cannot make a Green tea lemonade and Lord knows what else. You will wait forever for your drink and it's not crowded. Myself and two other people were inside and I literally went to the restroom,  came out, briefly read a few articles in the paper they had on the table and my drink was still not ready. My drink is finally ready,  but wait my cheese Danish was forgotten about by the barista so I had to wait an additional five minutes for that. You can get a parking ticket waiting for your drink in this place. Luckily I didn't get one, but I will definitely not be going back to this location. I would suggest the Hyde Park location on 55th Woodlawn. The best Starbucks I've been to on the south side of Chicago.

26.description: By far my favorite Starbucks so far, although the brand new one on 53rd is going to most likely win out on that battle just because of proximity. The staff here is always extremely friendly. It's also a great place for people watching and getting work done. Probably more people watching then work but hey the work eventually gets done! My drinks have always been perfect. They even have some outdoor seating which is nice during the summer months. Can't believe I've taken so long to review this place. It really is great.

27.description: Starbucks is Starbucks and is it really necessary to review a Starbucks?  Yes, if they are a Starbucks that is selling La Boulange bakery treats like this Starbucks!  I know a lot of people don't like them, but I do!  They have reduced fat loaf cakes, croissants and pastries.  We devoured a cute little Pumpkin Cheese Cream Loaf Cake served warm, which was very nice.  I will have to cling to this yummy memory, cause I'm sure it's going to be a long time before I visit another Starbucks that has a La Boulange Bakery.

35.description: Starbucks, you're my savior.  This place is right in between my school and Sox Park, which means they've got me covered at all times.  I love it!  We regularly go on "Starbucks runs" at work and they've always got our caffeine fix.  Sometimes you just can't drink teacher lounge coffee, you know?  This location is pretty spacious and I've always been able to find street parking right outside.  Free Wifi (with your Sbux card) and plenty of seating in case you want to come in and do work.  I think they're starting to get to know all of us because some of the employees have memorized my drink order.  I love it!  I don't know what I would do if this Starbucks wasn't in the area.  The employees are really nice and there's never a line.  Located across from IIT's campus in case you don't want to drink IIT coffee during the day.

8.description: The worst and slowest Starbucks that I've ever been to. I've been here when there are only 3 customers besides myself and have still waited over 10 minutes for a drink. I find that unacceptable, and bewildering. I avoid this location at all costs.

0.description: Holiday specials buy one get one free between the hours of 3-5 p.m. it's great! It's a hop happening Starbucks and I get my hot caramel latte' it was delicious.

38.description: This is an attractive and well-run Starbucks. I love it when the Magic Johnson-owned (or invested, I guess) units run leagues around the 100% company-run stores. The staff is great and the store has a wide range of seating choices. There's a Jimmy Johns, a FedExOffice (formerly Kinkos), and a National City Bank branch on the same block, right across from IIT and katty-corner to the Green Line's "35/Bronzeville/IIT" station. The Red Line's "35/Sox" station is a couple of blocks away, as is the I-80/94 Dan Ryan Expressway.

20.description: It's not a starbuck, its a coffee shop in da hood, I can barely understand the employee's hood rat accent, what's up with the attitude, you are the fat one speaking the disgusting dialect, oh, you can keep my coffee and my money, they will never see me again.

19.description: I waited in line for about 20mins while listening to the Manager reprimand an employee... in front a huge line of people...it was horrible. The poor employee was so embarrassed that she tuned out the manager ( I would do the same)....Once I received my coffee there was another hug line by the sugar and creamer station... Just bad.

33.description: Amazing kindness from these folks! Every so often I wake up on a Saturday to discover I am out of coffee. An ouch to folks like myself who depend on it. I stumble forward out to walk the dogs and try to manage two dogs with no caffeine. And now enter the kind folks at this location who see me look lovingly and longingly into their doors with two big dogs and come out to take my order for my needed caffeine fix. Thank you! You are all saints to my Saturday morning!

2.description: Been to many Starbucks locations throughout the US and in Europe, but this one stands out in a negative way.  So much so, this is my only Starbucks review, period.  On numerous occasions, I've experienced the overall staff to be inattentive and work in 1 speed: SLOW.  It really shouldn't take 10 minutes to get a black coffee.Avoid if possible.

34.description: I would just like to say a thank you to star bucks in da hood.

32.description: Dear manager of this starbucks,    You are my favorite starbucks. Ever. I've been to Starbucks(es) around the world and you guys never cease to put a smile on my face. Your huge line every morning always moves quickly even though everyone must be tired/stressed out from the crowds, the homeless people, the non-homeless people...Your baristas are always friendly and fast. I just want to ring that bell forever!    Once, I even told you guys my boyfriend broke up with me. I don't even know why I did that. You guys remembered and asked me how I was doing when I came in and told me someone better will come along. That made my mornings (and sometimes, days).  Thank you for caring!     You guys are amazing. I almost wished I still worked in that area so I can come in.- your biggest fan.

18.description: Besides the Greektown location, this is my other favorite when it comes to studying! When I'm on campus, I love coming here to get work down before or after my classes while sipping on a drink. The chairs and booths are super comfy and there are an abundance of outlets, which is great considering my old computer dies whenever it gets unplugged! The only con is that there isn't free parking and it is one of the busiest Starbucks locations I've ever been to. Other than that, everything else is just hunky dory.

13.description: I have been to this location several times and have never had a consistent experience. Sometimes I get people behind the counter that care, know what they are doing and deliver that exceptional Starbucks experience. Other times I get people who obviously don't like their job, have no sense of what customer service is, and need more training on how to make their drinks. I have had Frapps with way, way to much milk and not enough mocha. I have had people at the register act curt and rude. I have had service that is at a snails pace with no explanation for it. If they could just get everyone on the same page to deliver acceptable customer service, and have pride in making the drinks right, this Starbucks would be a lot better. But as of now, this Starbucks needs a lot of work done before they get there. I usually just get an iced coffee, because it is summer and that is a drink that cannot be messed up.

4.description: Inconsistent!!!On the weekends the employees on duty have zero personality and are too laid back. I've come here on weekday mornings and they get you in and out pretty quick and are pleasant.  On this Saturday there were 3 people in front of me and it took 15 minutes

24.description: Great location not far from my sons school. I stopped in here to pass some time while waiting on him. I'm sure I will be back... Been here some time ago it was good then also.

6.description: This Starbucks is in a convenient location, right outside of IIT. They have outdoor and indoor seating and ample street parking outside. It can get really busy and feel cramped but it depends on the time of day you go. Overall, cozy and quaint place to get coffee

22.description: I went to this starbucks in the afternoon and they were extremely slow and unfriendly.  The cashier who handles money put his filthy finger in my cup to grab it and hand it to the barista...disgusting!  Maybe I'll try it again in the morning.

15.description: Came back because it's the only Starbucks remotely close to me. I was 3rd in line. The man in front of me WALKED OUT after waiting so long. We all watched the 3 employees scurry around in slow motion. 1 was on bar, the others kind of just lolly gagging. Nobody was dedicated to the register or greeting customers. I finally get helped with a greeting of "whatchu havin". Never do you get a friendly greeting here. Never a thank you. Never a You're welcome. Never a smile.

40.description: My one-bedroom condo, which is for sale for the low price of $200,000 is above this brand-spanking new Starbucks. My condo is new too--only 3 months old. The Starbucks has wireless and good service. It is part of a collaboration between Magic Johnson and the Starbucks company. What I love about this Starbucks is the way it makes the hallways outside my (your?) condo smell like freshly brewed coffee. It is almost as good as being downwind from Blommer's Chocolate Factory. This neighborhood is up-and-coming, and this Starbucks (and the lovely, sunny, large) one-bedroom condo that I am selling for cheap, is conveniently situated between the 35th and Bronzeville green line stop (across the street) and the Sox-35th red line stop (2 blocks). Unlike the Starbucks, the condo, which has a balcony, comes with a parking space. Buy this new condo, which is across the street from Illinois Institute of Technology, and you will still be able to afford Starbucks coffee every day.

7.description: This Starbucks is close to IIT and US Cellular Field. It's the only Starbucks in the Bridgeport area, and that's a bit sad. I like to study at coffee shops, but this place is much smaller than other Starbucks I've visited. There are a couple of tables in the shop, but it feels cramp and crowded. There are plenty of outlets though, which I will never complain about. The service is good, and nothing out of the ordinary. Wifi is standard Starbucks wifi. It's pay for parking just outside the Starbucks, but there are free spots a couple of blocks down. There are better coffee shops in the area.

36.description: Standard Sbux. Roomier than most downtown locales. Also close to Sox Park, which is a plus for post games, or keeping warm before the gates open.Now, only if they served coffee flavored coffee.....

30.description: Besides the Greektown location, this is my other favorite when it comes to studying! When I'm on campus, I love coming here to get work down before or after my classes while sipping on a drink. The chairs and booths are super comfy and there are an abundance of outlets, which is great considering my old computer dies whenever it gets unplugged! The only con is that there isn't free parking and it is one of the busiest Starbucks locations I've ever been to. Other than that, everything else is just hunky dory.

3.description: If this location wasn't conveniently located in my neighborhood, I would never go here. In different occasions, I have experienced very slow service (many times) and closed during business hours after I paid money for the meter. Maybe this isn't worth mentioning but I'm just also surprised at the fact that they actually gave me less iced coffee for ordering an iced coffee with less ice. I guess it's fair but out of the hundreds of times I've been to Starbucks all over the city and other places, I've never actually gotten less coffee for ordering less ice. Ever.

14.description: Although this is closer to my garage I tend to venture to the more busier location on Roosevelt. I am so glad my partner choose this spot today b/c it was refreshing! This location reminded me why I don't mind paying the extra couple of bucks for coffee. Each one of the employees were awake, upbeat & attentive! As the customers came in everyone was greeted & not one of those stale "they make me say hello" type greetings. It was warm & welcoming (even though they didn't know my name). The Starbucks tunes were playing as a nice backdrop. Loud enough to be heard & be able to vibe to in the cozy corner; but not so loud as to add on to the clamor of the morning rush. I didn't get every crew member's name but Cory, Tia & the remainder of the morning crew....you guys ROCK! Thanks for giving me a jumpstart & lifted spirits this morning. Needless to say I will be back

0.description: This is by far the worst BR I have been to. First let me start by the chaotic morning rush. The cashiers and other staff behind the counter have absolutely NO personality. I would not even call the people who work here baristas. In my opinion no matter what time of the day you visit this location the service is substandard. During non-peek hours I have to yell for a counter server to come into the front to serve me. It is usually one person behind the counter so they have to service all of the traffic for Dunkin and BR. If you ask them to go easy on the sugar because I do not want to develop diabetes they lay it on thick. Pretty much you will always have a nice sugary layer at the bottom of your ice coffee or tea. The freezers are always locked with a giant pad lock when I come here. Which I have to wait for the only counter person to walk around and open it. That really does not leave any opportunity to browse their selections. The bathroom is always locked which I understand why. The annoying part of normal experience here is the noise created by the neighborhood regular customers. If you are planning to study this may not be the location for you. I would like to note the recent renovations are fantastic.

12.description: Finally a White Castle!  These are tasty little burgers!  Melt in your mouth, not in your hand.  I took the pickles off, and some of the onions.  But the meet, cheese and bun are great.  It's like the Harold and Kumar movie :)

7.description: Come On!White Castle is awesome, as good as my local Krystals.I wish they had seating inside.However, they did not complain while we ate inside the front door.They have tasty chocolate shakes.

19.description: So, I been dying to try this for years.  As every has since seeing Harold & Kumar.  The only thing in LA we have is the 8 pack of frozen sliders at the market.So, being in Chicago, and looking to try some of this, I go online and find that there is a White Castle a few blocks from where the White Sox play, and I was gonna see a game there, so it was perfect.  On the corner of 35th and King.  When I am driving down there, I find out that King was short for Martin Luther King.  Now really, isn't MLK all about peace?  Why is it that everywhere I have been, no matter what city, MLK street is always where the most dangerous crap occurs?  Anyway, I digress, but not really.So, I see the White Castle, and can drive thru or eat in.  Shoot, I am halfway across the country and first time eating fresh White Castle, I have to go in and see what it's like.  Wow!So, I believe the following is only for this branch, because I went to other places later and it didn't have the same set up.  I walk in through one door, and can't open the other door till that one closes, ok, whatever, it closes and i open the other to get in.  I walk to the line and notice people are looking at me.  Can they tell I'm from LA?  Nope, I'm the only non-black in the spot, and I guess they think I'm lost?  I dunno.  Well, I ignore it and get to the front of the line.  In front of me isn't your ordinary counter.  It is like a bank now.  There is glass in front of me, Bulletproof glass with a lil steel hold with slits in it that I talk to the cashier through.  WTF?!?!  Sweet!!!!!  So I order my meal, I didnt know what I want, but there's people behind me and they are look for a reason, so I just order a basic combo.  Now to get my food, there is a lil maze of bulletproof glass that I have to fish my food out of.  Hahah, sweet.  Got my 4 sliders, fries, and fruit punch.  What the heck, let's eat in.  I sit down and am asked for money, I give my change, 4 cents.  He said he can't do anything with that.  I said sorry.  He got mad, I said sorry again.  Some lady told him to back off from across the room.  I stay and eat.  I stay and eat because I have already had a bite of this lil square piece of perfection.  Nice soft toasty bread, yummy beef, onion bits, and pickle.  I can't be bothered at all.  I finish my meal, and leave through one door, let it close, smile at the camera, then other door.  I guess this is how they capture criminals?Now, I later find out that not all White Castles are like this.  In fact, it was the only one of the 5 i visited that are.  So, if you wanna feel more relaxed and safe, you can go to an uptown one.  But if you want some people asking for money, 6 video cameras, bulletproof glass, and a little holding room with the 2 doors, come for the full experience.

1.description: This is my first bad review. I was hunger on my way on a long ride so I went straight to this location just to get 2 cheeseburger sliders and a medium fry. I enjoyed my fries but when I bit into my cheeseburger, I realized it was cold so I looked at it and it was uncooked! I went to grab the other one and that one was uncooked as well. Luckily I was too far away to come back for an exchange or refund. I'm so disappointed, I only took one bite they better hope I don't get food poisoning.

2.description: We don't have White Castle where we live, so we always try to come here when in Chicago. We're hooked on the fish nibblers! They're so good that they don't need any sauce. Just a little salt is all you need.The sliders are good, just like Krystal's, although my wife insists WC is better. I can't tell much of a difference. What I do know is that Krystal doesn't have those nibblers. If they did, I'd be all set!The staff are friendly, and the service is fast. I'll look forward to coming back here.

9.description: After a five hour flight from Los Angeles, my friends and I were starving.  To satisfy the craving, we could only think of one thing:  White Castle.Upon arriving in this location in the South Loop, we noticed that the entrance was locked for security.  We were able to proceed with the order once we were buzzed in.  One slider is a reasonable sixty cents.  I placed my order of four sliders and fries to a kind lady that was safely positioned behind thick bulletproof glass.  Good to know that White Castle invests in the safety of their employees.As we awaited our order, we noticed why these security measures were necessary.   I busted my camera and proudly took pictures of our delicacies; however, my friends questioned the wisdom of doing so.  The burger reminds me of the regular burgers that we can get at McDonalds.  The difference being that they sell sliders and their burgers aren't loaded with mustard.  The buns were wet from the grease of the burger and steam.  Their fries taste like frozen fries that we could get at supermarkets.  5 stars for burgers with quality that can only be topped by the dollar menu at McDonalds and for security rivaled only by prison.  On a serious note....Don't come here at night.  There's a reason there's bulletproof glass.  Do your homework and, if you really want white castle...go somewhere else.

6.description: I have to be in the mood to eat WC (don't know what that mood is lol) but when I do have the WC mood, I visit this location because it's on my way home in the Bronzeville area. I have never been dissatisfied with my food; however I cannot say the same for customer service. I have ordered through drive-thru and have not been inside. The drive-thru always had trash on the path and falling out the trash bin. Back to the customer service...the employees seem to always appear unhappy and never say "Thank You" or "Have a nice day." They always have a mad face or the expression of ugh. I receive my receipt they are silent, I receive my food they are silent. One time I felt awkward in my own car waiting for my food because of how the drive-thru employee face looked and her refusal to say a word to me. I don't think she restated my food total, hmmm. Like I have stated, I have not been dissatisfied with my food, just the poor customer service so I have to give 3 stars.

18.description: As White Castles go, this is one of the better ones on this side of town. I've never had any problems here with the food or the service, though I've heard that sometimes homeless people may walk up to your car & try to hit you up for money. (But times are tough for everyone; that's why I'm eating at White Castle!)

10.description: Yeah, I'm new to the area.  Hellllo, Bronzeville!Thankfully, I'm no longer working in the non-diversified North Shore.  (By the loving grace of God, I should say.)  But, after three years working up there, I knew all the lunch spots.  Time to explore what this 'hood has to offer, huh?Today, I just wanted some fries. I thought stopping into WC would be a prime choice.  When you walk in, you'll notice that the cashiers are shielded behind some bullet-proof glass.  Really?  It's dangerous?  Surprising as this was probably the friendliest service I've ever gotten at a WC.  No, really.  (Have you BEEN to the one on Ridge?)  AND - it was sweet gesture that the cashier came out to my table and handed me a coupon book (since she couldn't find it when I was paying).  Too sweet. I'm diggin' this 'hood already.

13.description: why the hell am i rating white castle?  i give it a 1.  white castle has the distinction of being the only 1 that i will continue to patronize.  so i guess that counts for something.

16.description: After seeing the A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas I had to make a stop at White Castle and get a crave case. No wait and exactly what I needed to end the perfect night **** for the friendly and quick service

17.description: Late night food at it's best?!?!?!

15.description: Over the years I have eaten a lot of White Castle. In fact their food sometimes brings back childhood memories because in my old hood we lived just a few blocks away from one. It was our favorite place to cool off in the summer time because they always had the A/C set to ice cold.Anyway, This location does the food right. Sliders are done perfectly. I also have a fondness for the "Fish Nibblers" and they always get them perfect as well. They are also speedy, I have never been stuck waiting more than five minutes at this location., so they are well trained and well staffed. Though I have to admit, this location scares the hell out of me. Bullet proof glass does that to a person. Also the staff isn't really welcoming, but i guess working behind bullet proof glass all the time would do that to a person as well.  So I always just grab my food to go, and like the old saying goes "Make like a shepherd and get the flock out of here."

0.description: I mean, it's White Castle. There isn't that many in NJ and there's a ton while we were vacationing in Chicago. I usually just get the chicken slider and the burger slider. It's nice when you're drunk! :) Also plus - all locations in Chicago are 24 hours!

5.description: Wow, how hard is it to redeem a coupon. Wanted $3 off order over $10, got a $2 off sack 10, after a lengthy wait. Clueless Manager, feel sorry for staff with so little training. The food still great,

11.description: I'm from the West Coast where you can only find White Castle in the freezer section of a grocery store. I had the hamburger in frozen-then-microwaved form once before when a Chicagan-turned-Californian friend hosted a Midwest Fest. The slider was unimpressive so I had to try to the real thing from the real place.Fast forward... I'm at one of Chicago's White Castle joints and order a jalapeno cheeseburger because I'm a sucker for spicy and cheesy. While I'm waiting for my slider to be prepared, I notice a sign warning customers can't stay for longer than 45 minutes in the restaurant. Talk about "you don't have to go home, but you can't stay here." It's just as well because I had to catch a White Sox game that night and ended up eating the slider while waiting for the bus to head to the Cell.The jalapeno cheeseburger turns out to be two steamed slider buns hugging a thin, grayish-brown meat patty topped with grilled, diced onions and a slice of cheese. While "hot and steamy" would be great adjectives to describe any scenario, I can't say I like my slider bun or meat patty tasting steamed. As for the jalapeno cheese, it tasted like a cross between pepper jack cheese and jalapeno cheese poppers. You can taste the jalapeno-ness, but it lacked in any spiciness.In the end, I'm just left wondering, "Wait, am I missing something about the White Castle hype?" Maybe it's because White Castle has been around long enough that it just becomes ingrained in Midwest culture. Or maybe it's because I wasn't starving and/or stoned. Either way, while I've had better fast food burgers, a place like this can't be that bad if its sliders are cheaper than dollar menu items and you can get cheese sauce with your fries.

8.description: One of the most terrible customer service experiences I've ever encountered. From the homeless men outside and inside the restaurant selling DVDs, to the excruciatingly lackluster staff, this is absolutely the most terrible White Castles this side of Chicago. The food, the shrimp bites in particular, are the only highlight of this place.

3.description: I stopped by White Castle tonight and ordered two double cheeseburgers and an order of onion rings. I brought the food home and fixed me a plate and when I started eating the food was absolutely horrible! The onion rings tasted like they had been sitting in grease and warmed over, the hamburgers were mushy and I couldn't eat any of it. I tried to eat a couple of the onion rings and they tasted so horrible until I threw them in the garbage. I will never go there again!

14.description: When it comes to White Castle, the method of judgment that I prefer is examining the quality and speediness of a Crave Case.  After all, the Crave Case is one of the biggest selling points of White Castle and is prominent in much of their advertising (that doesn't have to do with chicken rings - and with all of the judgment of McDonald's in activist campaigns asking where on a chicken you can find the McNuggets, nobody's bothering to ask where on a chicken you'll find rings) - so why not make the true test for this location be their "signature dish"?This time, there were two of us tackling the beast.  And we tempted fate by getting cheeseburgers, though we well knew the risks of 15 tiny cheeseburgers each.This location, however, is located on MLK.  And yes, it seems that whenever I'm in this neck of the woods, I tend to be one of the only white people (if not the only) in the vicinity.  Considering Chicago is just a giant "melting pot", we certainly still have a lot of areas that have not fully melded into this racial amalgam - and we CELEBRATE most of them with names like "Chinatown" or "Ukranian Village" or "Greektown".  Since any attempt to create a similar name for this area would be racially-insensitive, I will simply have to say that this neighborhood features a two-block stretch containing three fried chicken locations and an extra location with just chicken wings - and leave it at that.Because of those issues, the entryway is practically an airlock.  The employees are all behind thick bulletproof glass.  There are surveillance cameras everywhere.It's hard to say whether this level of security makes me feel safe (because it's all there) or unsafe (because it could be needed, and it's only there to protect the EMPLOYEES, not the CUSTOMERS).  Actually, it's not hard to say.  It feels unsafe.  Walking the streets and feeling like the only white person is not a bad experience in the least, but accentuate it with bulletproof glass and surveillance cameras and stereotypes become more prominent and the world around you gets a little scarier.No offense to White Castle, but we obtained said Crave Case and got the hell out of Dodge.Thankfully it was a short trip to the spot of mass consumption.  My friend shamed me by failing to eat his designated 15 cheeseburgers, so I had to pick up his slack and muscle down his leftovers for a total of 18.5 cheeseburgers (it shows a level of closeness and intimacy to eat a friend's half-eaten food, no?) and quite a full belly.Take-out trips to White Castle now involve building monuments out of cardboard burger containers, as fitting one empty container inside another creates a solid building block that can be used to make Towers of Gluttony.So yes, the speed and taste of these cheeseburgers was spot-on, but for scaring the crap out of me and my buddy and forcing us to flee to a safer location to gorge ourselves, I can't award anything higher than 3 stars.

4.description: This place sucks. I ordered online on the app and it told me my order would be ready at 4:33 and that I can come thru the drive thru so when I got there I waited for 10 mins for the girl to even take my order meanwhile two ghetto females were in the parking lot arguing with the police present because  they were racing to get into the drive thru and apparently someone hit the other while they were being petty. Any who the girl finally takes my order and I tell her I ordered a crave case online and she replied she was looking it up and found my order then she says "u say u ordered the crave case" I said yea she replied what about it? ... I'm thinking wtf do u think I'm here to pick it up???????? Did she think I was just riding through the neighborhood checking up on the crave cases at the local White Castle? I'm so done.... I kno I lack hella punctuation marks but u catch my drift lol

58.description: My first time at Huetiful Salon was March 31st and my stylist was Tasheara.  Tasheara was very knowledgeable about the products used in my hair for she informed me of everything she was putting in my hair as she was doing it. She was very pleasant and warming and easy to talk to. The environment was nice and quiet and I will be going back for another service.

56.description: Daria did my hair for my 21st birthday and she did a fabulous job! The entire staff is considerate of your hair needs and preferences, and they value healthy hair over everything. I got a trim and she was NOT scissor happy. Price was excellent for the service. Perfect salon and I will be back!

29.description: First, let me say lakia, the stylist I was referred to was incredibly pleasant and professional. However, it is highly unlikely that I will return. In booking the appointment I called the salon and asked for a stylist referral based on the style I was interested in. It was all down hill after that. The schedulicity system that they use is full of glitches. I called to confirm as I never received a confirmation, and the text reminders didn't ever come through. When I arrived I explained what I wanted and was then informed I should have booked a "level 2"; confused I asked why wouldn't the person who I initially spoke with explain what I should have booked. I was then shown that the schedulicity descriptions are different from the huetiful site descriptions and that what I wanted was going to be $35.00 more. 4 hours later my hair is soft but I don't love the style. Considering they pride themselves on time management I was disappointed.Addendum- I HATE how my hair turned out. I left the salon trying to be optimistic, but this style is not even close to the example I provided. Other huetiful loyalists saw my hair this evening and were shocked that this is what 4 hours produced.

42.description: I am so happy I tried this place out. Scheduling online wasn't difficult..as a first timer, i based my stylist selection of the yelp reviews .I am so used to walking into some salons and huffing and puffing before putting on a fake smiling face when i am called 20-30mins after my appt time...none needed here...I had all genuine smiles. I was greeted and the stylist came very soon after. The salon has a very lovely atmosphere and ambiance. My Stylist was Dominique. Very lovely lady and has an awesome personality. Answered all questions I had...and goes through each process. I would definitely recommend the salon and also Dominique!. I have very thick natural hair and have had ppl ask whether I relaxed my hair...she also does natural hair styles. Two thumbs up!

23.description: They are very professional and I love how they don't over book so your appointment is your appointment and you are out when you're supposed to be out. I have gotten both straight styles and wash and go and loved them both!

47.description: From a Chicagoan moved to Texas, I came back home to visit family and friends.I decided to make a appointment here for my daughter we are naturals. We received the Nano smoothing treatment, flat iron and trim. Its so hard to get a good beautician or a good salon in Austin TX for naturals. So Friday came and the location was so easy to find. As soon as we walked in the salon I noticed the Décor was really nice and modern. The staff welcomed us at the front door, they were very kind and friendly. Our stylist was Nina Christmas. Every time she did something to my daughters hair she explained it thoroughly. The products she used smelled wonderful, and the shampoo made my daughters hair feel like it had conditioner in It. It made her hair really soft and easy to detangle. My experience here was like no other salon I have ever been to, and believe me I have had my shares of salons. Nina shared her knowledge about some  products and hair care. I highly recommend getting your hair done here so you can experience what it feels like to have someone pamper your natural locs, and for a great price that wont break your pockets. We even had the pleasure of meeting the CEO who also thanked us for coming in the salon. So people 10 stars for Customer Service

8.description: So this is my first time at the salon. I live nearby and figured I would give it a try and it has great ratings so what the heck. My normal stylist is in oak brook il so for the sake of saving time I tried this salon. I made a same day appointment with a 7:30pm appt time. It is currently 9:08pm and my hair has only been washed and is beginning to air dry by its self. I'm getting upset because the time online stated 1.5 hours for a blowout. Now if the salon is going to charge clients for being late there should be some compensation for the client if it's been almost 2 hours sitting in a chair waiting. Who knows what time I will get out of here considering my natural hair still needs to be blow dried and flat ironed. I'm not saying the salon is bad perhaps it's just my stylist I chose who has poor time management. I'll provide an update review once the final product is done -_- My hopes are pretty low right now though.As an update to my prior review the end result was subpar. Today I put my hair in a bun because it was not wearable to wear straight :/ I think I may give the sailing another try but for sure with a more experienced stylist maybe like creative director whose listed on their website.

31.description: The salon is nice, my appointment started a little early, but $105 and nearly 4hrs later and I wasn't happy at all with the results. I chose style option #3 and the normal hydrating treatment, a pretty standard roller set on my medium length/short hair. Not sure what went wrong but I wound up with a very tight rod set that was not cute. There's nothing worse than dropping money like that at a salon and leaving with a hood on.  Also, my hair is dry, probably due to the amount of setting lotion that was used. So much for the miracle steaming everyone raves about. I'm hoping once I wash my hair it will feel better. Not planning on returning, a shame since I did so much research on this place before booking.

34.description: See Monique! My sister referred me. I went to get the blow out on the first visit and Bantu knots on the second visit. (My hair is Shoulder length.) I brought my 4 year old today who looked absolutely adorable in her Bantu knots. My sister had a beautiful wash n go. The last style she had was a fly short cut that was blown out. It really looked like something you would see in a magazine. We go to Monique because she really is well-versed in proper hair care, so talented, and very friendly. Monique gets you in and out within 2 hours. Definitely worth the price!The salon is peaceful.  Pretty much a Spa-like feel. I can usually find parking within 1 block. But I definitely try to arrive early! Thanks Huetiful!

16.description: I went to Huetiful Salon out of desperation. We were taking family holiday pictures and both my regular hairstylist and my regular back up stylist were unavailable. I do not typically try new hair salons unless they have been recommended to me by trusted friends, but the reviews I read on Yelp made me think that Huetiful would be a good choice. The experience overall was pleasant. The stylist was very nice, and the salon was clean and well cared for. However, to say that I was extremely disappointed with the results would be an understatement. While my hair looked fine when I left the salon, as I got outside I noticed that my hair smelled burnt. So much so, that a checkout girl at the store I stopped at commented, "What's burning?". Um, that would be my hair.Over the next week, I noticed a large number of strands falling out of my hair when I combed or brushed it. Alarmed, I went to my regular stylist. Sure enough, she found a large section of my hair had been burned so badly that the hairs were breaking off and falling out. I currently have an area about 1.5-2 inches in diameter where my hair is completely broken off, fuzz patch city. Thanks to my visit to Huetiful, I now have to rock a combover until the hair grows back. Needless to say, I won't be returning.

13.description: I visited Huetiful the Saturday before Thanksgiving and had my hair treated, blown out, flat ironed and cut by Kyra Allen. Prior to booking my appointment at Huetiful, I literally followed their Instagram page and took mental notes of the stylist who produced outcomes that I was going for. Huetiful's salon booking website makes you select your stylist first but there aren't any descriptions of their work nor are there any pictures of some of the styles and treatments the stylists have provide. This is where following their social media accounts were especially helpful. I have really thick 4c natural hair so I knew I wanted a stylist who could flat iron my hair and have the style last more than one day. I'm happy I was able to get an appointment with Kyra. Kyra was ready for me at the start f my appointment. She started off by talking to me about my hair. She asked me what I liked about my hair, the last time I shampooed and the last time I had a trim. We then moved to the shampoo section where she first clarified my hair, then used a moisturizing shampoo, then applied a deep treatment which contained peppermint oil, then sat me under Huetiful's industrialized steamer for an entire 25 minutes. She then blew out my hair, flat ironed it and gave me a cut (since my last trim was 2 years ago!)My hair was shinny, it had movement, and it just flowed effortlessly. I was able to keep my natural hair straight for 4 whole weeks, even while attending bootcamp and yoga classes, something I never did previously.The only reason why I docked Huetiful one star is because I noticed the salon was a little unkempt and some of the furniture had rips/were dirty with stains. One important note: the difference between style option 1, 2 and three is the amount of time allocated for a stylist to do your hair. I initially booked style option 1, but while Kyra was flat ironing my hair she realized she would need more time and I would actually be a style option 2.All in all, I am happy I was finally able to visit the Huetiful Salon Chicago and let me tell you, it is an epicenter of healthy hair practices.

11.description: Today was my first visit to Huetiful and I was thoroughly impressed. I was seen right on time by my stylist, Daria, and she patiently listened to all my concerns, about my hair, calmed my fears, and gave me tips and tricks throughout. Even before my visit, Daria texted me to ask about expectations and questions. She gave me a wonderful shampoo and then put me under the steamer. She then gently blow dried and flat-ironed my hair to perfection, while we had a really interesting conversation. Even though she mentioned other services and products, I didn't feel forced to purchase anything. In the 10 years I've been natural, I've never straightened my hair, so I was anxious but it came out beautifully. I also felt I came out with knowledge I didn't come in with. The owner came over to greet and talk to me about their new programs and services and was very pleasant. The salon was quiet with nice calm music playing, the beauticians were polite and nice, and the vibe was really cool. I will DEFINITELY be back! So glad to have such a nice salon on the Southside.

39.description: A great experience. My hair feels great. I gained some great advice about future hair care. I plan on recommending to all my friends with natural hair.  Thanks, Huetiful!

37.description: I was told my language was offensive, like I was a child the manager tells me to watch my language in front of the other customers like I was 3 years old! Really they have nasty wash bowl seats, wall panels that can't hold the correct electrical current and the seating is uncomfortable! And also nasty seats at the dryers AND PRODUCTS that itch my scalp! Over priced services and a manager who doesn't conduct herself as a business person! So really I can spend my money at a safer place!

0.description: I think I've found "the" salon to help me care for my natural curls!!!! I've visited twice and had services completed by 3 stylists, both experiences have been wonderful.....great service, knowledgable stylists, and ON TIME!! They only have street parking, which can get tricky at certain times. Fortunately, I was able to grab a spot on both visits. My reasons for 4 stars is that their greystone isn't labeled well at all, so I had a hard time finding it the first time. It's in the same building as a coffee shop, but the coffee shop is the only business with signage out front. The next reason is that they don't have someone answering the phone. When you try to call, it just goes to voicemail sometimes and sometimes the phone just rings. There was some scheduling questions about my initial appointment with Nina and it was very annoying to have to play phone tag with the receptionist because whenever I returned her call I couldn't leave a message or speak with anyone.So, on to my experience once I was there. I've had a shampoo and blowout by Nina, devacut by Monique, and partial highlights by Raquel. ALL of these stylists were very friendly, professional, and very knowledgeable about hair care! Nina turned my shampooing session into an educational experience that I LOVED. She gave me a towel to dry my hands and let me "touch and feel" my hair at the different steps of shampooing. She also explained the ingredients of each shampoo and why she was using it. Nina explained that once you're a Huetiful client, you can see any stylist in the salon and it's not awkward. You can schedule online with any stylist that fits your schedule and services needed. This also allows you to get services done by the stylists that specialize in whatever service you need. So, although I loved my initial service with Nina, I had the devacut done by Monique and highlights by Raquel. Again, both of these ladies were very knowledgeable about hair care and what they were doing. I LOVED the end product and will definitely be returning to Huetiful for my hair care services in the future.

38.description: My husband had been telling me to do something for myself ( which I never do),  and after 25 years of being my own kitchen beautician,  I decided to find a salon that could assist me through my transition from relaxed to natural hair.  A few of my Facebook friends posted great reviews for Huetiful,  so I scheduled a consultation with one of the specialist. Fearful but curious, I let her recommend a style and at first, I wasn't crazy about my tiny, curly, rod set; but the older my style got, the younger I looked! I even ran out to buy make-up to complement my new cuteness!  2 weeks later, I was back to see Miss. Patricia Bowdry. She is knowledgeable,  professional, and right on the money when it comes to suggesting and creating a look for transitioning hair! I'm looking foward to this journey with Huetiful & buying jewelry for my next look ;) Thanx Patricia! See you in 2 weeks.

51.description: I had a really great experience at Huetiful.  I have very high expectations when it comes to my hair and I have been utterly disappointed with the other Chicago salons that I have visited since moving here (I won't name them).  NINA is amazing.  The salon is amazing.  It has an upscale feel, with affordable prices.  A few things I appreciate: (1) They do NOT double book -- meaning if your time is valuable to you, you will not be sitting around for hours waiting for your stylist; (2) they obviously specialize in healthy hair; (3) every treatment comes with the steamer and a free trim!!! - That's just unheard of; and (4) everyone is super friendly.These are my observations only having been to the shop once and my appointment was at 7:30am.  But I will definitely be back!

27.description: So I'm extremely picky as to who does my hair so much that I have only let three stylist touch my natural hair. A few weeks ago a went here as a last minute option and was set up with Yolanda. I was getting my hair steamed and straightened. Now I'm always worried about people doing my hair since it's so thick and because I have a very tender head. Yolanda was very patient with me and never rushed even though I was her last appointment that Sunday evening. She adjusted to my needs every step of the way and even let me borrow her phone charger. Needless to say she is awesome. At the end of the service I was impressed at her skill and knowledge of natural hair. My hair was silky straight! I reserved this rating until I washed my hair again because heat damages curls and I wanted to let everyone know I just washed my hair and my curls are still poppin!  Yolanda you're awesome! You have a customer for life!

32.description: Today was my first visit to Huetiful and I was thoroughly impressed. I was seen right on time by my stylist, Daria, and she patiently listened to all my concerns, about my hair, calmed my fears, and gave me tips and tricks throughout. Even before my visit, Daria texted me to ask about expectations and questions. She gave me a wonderful shampoo and then put me under the steamer. She then gently blow dried and flat-ironed my hair to perfection, while we had a really interesting conversation. Even though she mentioned other services and products, I didn't feel forced to purchase anything. In the 10 years I've been natural, I've never straightened my hair, so I was anxious but it came out beautifully. I also felt I came out with knowledge I didn't come in with. The owner came over to greet and talk to me about their new programs and services and was very pleasant. The salon was quiet with nice calm music playing, the beauticians were polite and nice, and the vibe was really cool. I will DEFINITELY be back! So glad to have such a nice salon on the Southside.

54.description: I have only been to the salon once, but I recommend it to all my naturalista friends. The service was friendly and the stylists take extra special care of your curly cuticles during the washing process. The steamer was great! Its a spa for your hair. I will be back soon for a trim, and maybe some color!

48.description: It'd been over two years since I'd been to a hair salon.  Like a lot of natural women, I'd gotten used to doing my hair at home.  I decided to try Huetiful and my experience was AMAZING!  I'd just finished reading The Science of Black Hair and had learned a lot about my hair and why it works the way that it does.  My stylist, Monique, proved to be very knowledgeable in that area!  She explained everything that she was doing, why she was doing it, and how it would benefit my hair.  She asked me questions about my natural journey and made it feel like I was getting my hair done by a life long friend.The steamer made my hair feel AMAZING and the nano smoothing treatment is nothing short of everything it promises!  I got flat twists for my first visit, and a flat iron and trim for my second visit.  This is the only salon I call home and I recommend it to everyone.  They give you an exact start and end time and do a great job of getting you out of the salon in time.  This salon is top of the line for natural hair!  If you haven't already, give it a try!

44.description: I had my first appointment at the Huetiful Salon today. I had a very good experience. My stylist was Patricia and she was great at recommending products for my hair in regards to my frizz and shrinkage. She was also down to earth and easy to talk to.  The salon atmosphere was modern and clean. My favorite part of the salon is the music. It was good to hear neo soul and R&B music playing in the salon. I will definitely be visiting Hueltiful Salon again in the near future. Also, there's a store right next to the salon called, Curl Kitchen, that sells hair products for natural hair. ( I will be visiting them soon as well. )

24.description: So several months ago I decided to cut all the color out of my premature gray hair. This left me with alot more grey than I realized I had. I didn't want to make any hasty decisions so I waited 4 months before deciding to return to color. I HATED MY COLOR and was in desperate need of a Devacut. Previously, I had found a curly hair salon in which I was very happy with but unhappy with my one way 80 minute commute. After a freind recommend Huetiful, I made an appointment for a color consultation, color and Devacut. Unfortunately,  I had to wait 3 painful weeks for an appointment as a struggled to continue to wear my grey growing curly afro. After waiting 3 weeks for my appointment, I received a call the morning prior from my colorist asking if I could move my services times around.  I agreed just as long as my cut would be accommodated appropriately.  She said she'd figure it out and call me back within 1 hour. Well, I never received a call back from my colorist. However, my stylist did contact me the evening before my morning appointment to basically inform me that she was booked and couldn't provide me with a cut as scheduled but I could get my color services and return another day for my Devacut (40 min drive one way). She apologized several times but it doesn't make my situation any better. I have an engagement upcoming and I am now stuck!When booking appointments online Huetiful stresses how busy they are and stresses their cancelation policies. Well last week something unexpectedly came up at the same day and time as my previously booked services. In light of Huetifuls cancelation policy, I had to do some "creative" manouvering in an effort to keep my scheduled appointment. This continues to add to my disappointment. I'm not really sure went wrong here. But to say I'm now reluctant is an understatement. Huetiful is pretty pricey and seems to pride itself to be a somewhat of a unique experience. I would agree with the unique experience as I have never heard of or experienced such a issue with a business!I wish I could provide more information regarding Huetifuls services but its looking very unlikely.Part 2...I decided to go in for my color appointment as it was after 8pm before I realized I would be unable to obtain both services that I originally scheduled and I had a professional event to attend in a couple of days and was REALLY in need of a color and cut. After discussing the situation with my husband, he convinced me to give them another try. Afterall, they are 30 minutes closer to home than where I usually frequent.  So I did - MISTAKE!!!When I walked it the salon seemed clean and decorated nicely. Everyone seemed very pleasant.  But it seemed as though there was little to no ventilation; as I began to start coughing as soon as walked in.They scheduled me to return the following Tuesday for my Devacut. Although I was happy with my color results, other than a slew of apologies,  I received absolutely no financial consideration, even after explaining the hardships their scheduling error placed on me including a 40 minute drive each way without traffic.Tuesday morning, I receive a call from Huetiful Salon explaining to me that I had an appointment 30 minutes prior to the call. I explained that I had left a voicemail message the day prior cancelling my appointment (I went elsewhere for my cut). The woman proceeds to tell me that their policy doesn't allow for cancelations on the voicemail and that I will incur a fee of 50% of my service!!!! Yes. The service I scheduled for 1 week ago!!! Apparently,  Huetiful Salons time is way more valuable than mine that they feel entitled to be compensation for their wasted time!  THE AUDACITY! After insisting to speak with the owner, she tells me she can put me in touch with the manager via email. I told her I was not wasting another second of my life fooling with their sloppy selfish shenanigans and they better not charge my credit card or else!!!!I can not recall dealing with such unprofessional management in my life. I would never ever grace Huetiful with my presence again - not even for free!If you want a salon that is inconsiderate, self-centered,  all about the money, and has a serious deficit in quality customer service, HUETIFUL Chicago is for you!

7.description: Dominique styled me on this visit. She's sweet, professional, and made sure that I loved my hair before I left. Camille greeted me when I entered and she was extremely nice and professional. And my hair looks and feels amazing of course. :)

49.description: My experience at Huetiful Salon was top notch! I was visiting family in Chicago and was in desperate need of some natural hair TLC.  Shawanna really took care of me and was very patient with my neglected hair. I got the Huetiful Hydrating & Conditioning Treatment, a trim, blow-out and flat iron. My hair looked and felt significantly healthier after leaving. Because of her advice I now use the Huetiful hair steamer that has been collecting dust under my sink. My hair is continually getting better.I will definitely visit her on all of my visits to Chicago!! Thanks Shawanna!!

40.description: After having a horrible experience with Thrive Beauty Bar I decided to give Huetiful Hair Salon a try. The scheduling was a little bit confusing because they have so many good stylist that you didn't know who to pick so I chose Lakia. What I especially enjoyed is that she emailed me the day before my appointment to speak to me about my hair needs and what I was looking to do. I greatly appreciated that and speaking with her was easy. Fast forward to my appointment. After reading the reviews on how to get to the building I found it with ease. All I did was look for the scissors on the side of the building and there it was. Parking was good didn't have an issue with that. I was blown away by the professionalism and  hospitality of this salon. It was clean, played great music and had a very chill vibe. They offered me water and all the hair stylist spoke to me.Now the getting my hair done part....I was nervous about the health of my hair and that was a concern of mine but I was calmed by Lakia when she said my hair appears to be healthy and all I would need is a good trim. While going through the process she stopped and informed me of everything she was putting in my hair and how beneficial it was. My hair felt soft while she was shampooing, the scalp massage was gave me LIFE and the hair streamer was relaxing. She blow dried, clipped my ends and flat ironed my hair. My hair never felt better...it had sheen, bounce and it felt so soft. When I walked I felt like a wind machine was right in front of me it had so much body. It was a great experience and I HIGHLY recommend this salon. Will be back soon!

53.description: I've been going to Huetiful for several months now and have never left disappointed.  I seldom write reviews on Yelp but after 2 weeks, several trips to the gym and more rainy days than I would like I am STILL getting compliments on my hair!!! Tasheara is amazing, I feel like she really understands my hair and gets me styled and out the door extremely quickly without me feeling like we rushed the service. On my last trip I added highlights and I am thrilled with the results. .I came in and just told T. I wanted some color and she was able to pick and execute a color that worked for me. Typically you would never catch me taking a selfie the last time I left Huetiful I couldn't help myself

30.description: I visited Huetiful the Saturday before Thanksgiving and had my hair treated, blown out, flat ironed and cut by Kyra Allen. Prior to booking my appointment at Huetiful, I literally followed their Instagram page and took mental notes of the stylist who produced outcomes that I was going for. Huetiful's salon booking website makes you select your stylist first but there aren't any descriptions of their work nor are there any pictures of some of the styles and treatments the stylists have provide. This is where following their social media accounts were especially helpful. I have really thick 4c natural hair so I knew I wanted a stylist who could flat iron my hair and have the style last more than one day. I'm happy I was able to get an appointment with Kyra. Kyra was ready for me at the start f my appointment. She started off by talking to me about my hair. She asked me what I liked about my hair, the last time I shampooed and the last time I had a trim.
