We then moved to the shampoo section where she first clarified my hair, then used a moisturizing shampoo, then applied a deep treatment which contained peppermint oil, then sat me under Huetiful's industrialized steamer for an entire 25 minutes. She then blew out my hair, flat ironed it and gave me a cut (since my last trim was 2 years ago!)My hair was shinny, it had movement, and it just flowed effortlessly. I was able to keep my natural hair straight for 4 whole weeks, even while attending bootcamp and yoga classes, something I never did previously.The only reason why I docked Huetiful one star is because I noticed the salon was a little unkempt and some of the furniture had rips/were dirty with stains. One important note: the difference between style option 1, 2 and three is the amount of time allocated for a stylist to do your hair. I initially booked style option 1, but while Kyra was flat ironing my hair she realized she would need more time and I would actually be a style option 2.All in all, I am happy I was finally able to visit the Huetiful Salon Chicago and let me tell you, it is an epicenter of healthy hair practices.

46.description: I almost didn't write a review, but since my hair still feels super moisturized and silky smooth 2 weeks after my Huetiful Hydrating & Conditioning Treatment, I have no other choice. In addition to the conditioning treatment, I purchased the style 2 option (medium-sized flat twist updo) and a Huetiful Healthy Hair Consultation. Monique Clay provided the best customer service that I've ever received in a salon. She was friendly, informative, and professional. The salon had a very relaxing atmosphere while still feeling upscale. I waited a few minutes before being served, but not long enough for me to start checking the time. I felt that Monique listened to my hair concerns and treated my hair with TLC. She explained each step of the treatment process and the products she used. Looking back, I probably could've skipped the Huetiful Healthy Hair Consultation since I'm not brand new to the natural hair game and already new a lot of the advice provided. (It's just a matter of doing what I know I need to do!) Regarding the style, I'll admit that it had to grow on me for a couple of days, but it was simple and just what I needed as a busy mom. In order to cut back on the expense of going to the salon, I was planning on pushing my next visit until a month or two from now. However, since my hair feels brand new, I will have to cut back in other areas so that I can make my next hair appointment as soon as possible! I highly recommend this salon and Monique Clay to anyone looking for great service using quality products, resulting in beautifully moisturized hair.

1.description: I really wanted to like Huetiful but I was very disappointed with the way my hair looked and felt after it was finished.  I'm giving Huetiful 2 stars:  one because my stylist, Ashley, is a very nice person, she was professional and she took me on time and finished my hair within the 90 minute allotted for my services.  The second star I'll give because the salon is nice and it's clean.So, about my experience...first the shampoo...I was fine with the two shampoos- one to clarify and the other to moisturize the hair.  While I cringed as Ashley used what felt like a brush (that seemed to be pulling out my hair) to get rid of any shed hairs, I dealt with it although I really should have explained to her that I had already detangled and removed the shed hairs from my head.  That was my fault.  I should have said somehow then.  I'll admit, I do baby my hair to minimize damage and breakage and I guess I expected that people working with natural hair in a salon that claims expertise with natural hair would do the same.  Second, I was okay with the conditioning masque and the 30 minutes I spent under the steamer and I really looked forward to feeling the softness of my lush, well-conditioned hair.  Unfortunately, that never happened, because when the conditioner was rinsed out of my hair my hair felt rough and dry.  It was very tangled when normally after being conditioned, my hair is easily combed through.  Not this time.  So Ashley proceeded to comb through my rough, dry, tangled hair using a method that I would never expect an expert in natural hair to use-detangling from the roots down!  Now we come to the styling part.  So, I simply wanted two French braids.  Ashley used some kind of setting lotion/ serum combination that made my hair go from bad to worse!  My hair was sticky, rough, dry, and a tangled mess all at the same time!  At this point what I should have done was to get up, put my hair in a ponytail, go home and re-wash/re-condition it but I didn't do that.  I knew I'd be in trouble if I allowed Ashley to blow dry my hair in the state it was in before braiding it, so I asked her to braid it wet.  During the braiding process, Ashley was very nice and patient with me when I asked her to redo the first braid because I decided I'd rather have my hair parted differently.  Although Ashley is a good braider and she's neat, she did not braid my hair the way I explained I wanted it braided.  But that was something I could live with.   What I had the most difficult time dealing with was the fact that today, 3 days after my visit to Huetiful, my hair was in a sad state.  It was still extremely tangled and feeling very dry and rough and (and honestly, that makes me wonder what the real deal is with their product line).  I was able to get some of the tangles out after almost 45 mortifying minutes of spraying water and detangler, and alternating between finger and wide-tooth combing.  However, after a simple co-washing did not bring back softness or eliminate all tangles, I was left with no other choice but to shampoo and condition it.  $65 plus tip gone down the drain!Finally, after all of this, my hair feels much better now and so do I!  It has been said that experience is the best teacher and I have learned my lesson well!  I really wanted to like this place because I believed all that it was hyped up to be.  There's probably no need for me to say this but I will not return to Huetiful again for any service, not even if it's offered for free.

55.description: I was really looking forward to getting my hair done at Huetiful after reading the reviews. Unfortunately, when I got to the salon I was politely turned away. Warning to new clients, there are no signs in front of the salon which makes finding it a bit challenging and they turn the phones off after a certain time (maybe 5pm) so no one is able to assist you via phone after that time. I found this out the hard way after searching for the salon for about 10 minutes, all the while, tugging on several locked doors that I thought could be the entrance.After finally arriving 20 minutes behind schedule I was told there is a 15 minutes grace period and no one was available to do my hair. What? I wish someone would have told me that earlier when I called to confirm my appointment and explained to the women on the phone that I had never been to the salon before. Long story short, I was not able to get my hair done. The stylist did say she could reschedule my appointment for another day, which I was considering until she said, "and we won't even charge you for this missed appointment, which we usually do". Really? No thanks.Tip for the owner: I understand your 15 minute grace period rule, but you might want to think about keeping the phones on until you close for the day or placing a sign out front so new clients can locate your business.Anyway, my search for a good natural hair salon/stylist in Chicago continues...

9.description: Today was my fourth visit to the salon.  The salon itself is in an old grey stone building where they have converted the first floor into a salon.  There is a cute waiting area, but so far I have not had to wait in it very long.  Everyone is friendly and speaks to you, even though you are not their client.  They have coffee, tea and wine, so that was a nice touch to have my stylist bring me a drink while doing the steam treatment and a stand to allow me to put my drink and IPad on instead of having to try and juggle everything.I have had two stylists and both were great.  The shampooing was amazing...not sure what they were using as I was in the chill zone, but it felt like a brush of some kind massaging my scalp.  The shampoo seemed to go on forever and I loved it.  The steam treatment was not what I was expecting...it is actually cool on the head, but since I have been going to the salon, I have noticed that my hair is more hydrated.I love the fact that I can book my appointments online and cancel them online when the need arises as I don't want to try and get anyone on the phone.  And I love the 15 min rule about not showing up on time for your appointment.  My time is valuable and I don't want to be sitting in a chair all day to get my hair done.  So far I have been out in under 1 hour 20 mins and looking great each time.  I love that when I sit in the chair, it is my time and they stylist isn't trying to do 23 heads at the same time.Overall I am very happy with my experience there and will be going back.

26.description: I went to Huetiful Salon out of desperation. We were taking family holiday pictures and both my regular hairstylist and my regular back up stylist were unavailable. I do not typically try new hair salons unless they have been recommended to me by trusted friends, but the reviews I read on Yelp made me think that Huetiful would be a good choice. The experience overall was pleasant. The stylist was very nice, and the salon was clean and well cared for. However, to say that I was extremely disappointed with the results would be an understatement. While my hair looked fine when I left the salon, as I got outside I noticed that my hair smelled burnt. So much so, that a checkout girl at the store I stopped at commented, "What's burning?". Um, that would be my hair.Over the next week, I noticed a large number of strands falling out of my hair when I combed or brushed it. Alarmed, I went to my regular stylist. Sure enough, she found a large section of my hair had been burned so badly that the hairs were breaking off and falling out. I currently have an area about 1.5-2 inches in diameter where my hair is completely broken off, fuzz patch city. Thanks to my visit to Huetiful, I now have to rock a combover until the hair grows back. Needless to say, I won't be returning.

25.description: Great steam / deep conditioning treatment, but i left with BREAKAGE!I went in for a condition, trim, and style on natural hair. I have very thick hair and noticed breakage at the back of my hair. I went in and asked them to look at my hair and they denied any breakage. Though all of my friends can tell from the lack of volume in the bottom right part of my hair that there was breakage.I've since been to the barber shop, where everyone agreed that either they gave me an uneven trim or i had breakage. The barber was able to even out my hair thankfully.

12.description: It'd been over two years since I'd been to a hair salon.  Like a lot of natural women, I'd gotten used to doing my hair at home.  I decided to try Huetiful and my experience was AMAZING!  I'd just finished reading The Science of Black Hair and had learned a lot about my hair and why it works the way that it does.  My stylist, Monique, proved to be very knowledgeable in that area!  She explained everything that she was doing, why she was doing it, and how it would benefit my hair.  She asked me questions about my natural journey and made it feel like I was getting my hair done by a life long friend.The steamer made my hair feel AMAZING and the nano smoothing treatment is nothing short of everything it promises!  I got flat twists for my first visit, and a flat iron and trim for my second visit.  This is the only salon I call home and I recommend it to everyone.  They give you an exact start and end time and do a great job of getting you out of the salon in time.  This salon is top of the line for natural hair!  If you haven't already, give it a try!

59.description: I write this review with a HEAVY heart. Not because I didn't experience the most wonderful hair transformation, but because I don't want more people to go and make it EVEN harder for me to get a hair appointment. **caution it's a LONG review, because I feel it's needed, feel free to jump to the bottom**As I continue to progress on my hair (natural) journey, I find that until natural becomes critical mass or people understand different textures of hair, it is critical for you to find someone who understands your tresses. I think Huetiful has really got a gift for education. So let's begin.Appointment: You HAVE to book online. Once you get the hang of it, making an appointment is easy. It's hard to start out. When you select a stylist, you are presented with "selections" (i.e. style 1, style 2) but you do not get a description of what that is. On a separate page, you are given a rundown on what is included in those styles. Also, be sure to have a credit card on hand to book your appointment. I repeat, you must book online.Location: The salon space is a renovated home in the Bronzeville community. First time there, you do have to do some looking and then you hesistate when you think you found it because it a random location with limited signage. Look for the shears or the Chicago Public Libary. If you pass it, you've gone too far. The sheers will take you to the transformation heaven.You are greeted with a smile when you enter. The salon is modern, fresh feeling, and clean. I mean THIS is how you should spend your time being pampered. It really is like a hidden oasis. Each stylist station provides a level of privacy yet the space is still open, which is a nice touch. They have fun, feel good music, piping overhead.The Experience: The best I've had in a very long time. Definitely the best I've had as a natural and it's been almost 3 years. So I booked with Nina Christmas, she started in their Atlanta location in 2012 and I see she has been a force ever since. When I sat down I gave her the lowdown on my tresses. I was at the point of thinking of cutting it all off because it was just TOO much. She took me to the bowl and that is where the education by science began to happen. She gave me a mirror and literally explained everything she was going. She debunked a lot of myths and said their salon is ultimately trying to shift the paradigm about natural hair. She explained a lot of times, our hair is "unruly" because we are using the right products or the right methods. As she selected products, she let me take work a small section into my head. When she detangled, I watched in my mirror. It was the first time that I was detangled and I didn't coil back up. It was like NEW hair! OMGosh. Now for some people, they don't want to talk to their stylist, I was there to learn and absorb. She definitely gauges if you are a talker or not.My hair was SOOO soft during shampoo, I couldn't believe it. I mean we detangled during shampoo, who does that?! I guess I will be now. Then came the condition, hair is still soft and tresses are still not coiled. We make our way to the infamous steamer to add and seal the moisture. If's a fascinating little gadget, but my hair felt really good. We rinsed the conditioner and were ready for styling.Soo I appreciated Nina because she again told me everything was happening. She used a lower setting to blow dry it (no burned follicles here) and then we flat ironed it. This was my first experience with a stylist telling me that we would start at a low temperature and work our way up if my hair did not respond. It ensured my tresses only used enough of what they needed which leads to health in the long-run. We looked at my ends.. had a discussion about the trim and we were off. So final touches.. because my appointment was running over and someone else's appointment was starting, she politely told me that she wanted to get her next appointment up and running and she would be back. That's true professionalism.When she returned, we were ready to curl my hair. I thought this was going to take FO EVA.. but her technique was QUICk and I was fabulous looking.. because it was a monsoon outside, she put my hair in these pin curls, but said.. you need to be able to wear them. We can't have you looking crazy. It's day two and I'm still rocking the pin curls with soo many compliments.Bonus: She said that all her stylists were fantastic and they all had a different specialty. She said at any time feel free to check them out for wash n gos, rod sets etc. We work as a team. You NEVER hear that.Such a great experience and affordable. I can't wait to go back. No big chops here.. I'm on my way to see if I can grow this hair out.

21.description: I had a 7:00am appointment scheduled. I arrive at the salon and no one is there. My appointment was with Latasha Thompson she nor anyone at the salon notified me of any scheduling conflicts or any reason why my appointment would not be taking place. This was a major inconvenience, I was leaving town the same day and had to leave without my hair done. Prior to my appointment they sent me several reminders via email and text message reminding me of the time, day, stylist, and services I would be receiving. I don't understand why go through the trouble of making sure the client remembers their appointment just to not show up? New comers please beware you can make an appointment but it's a high chance you won't receive any services.

17.description: They are very professional and I love how they don't over book so your appointment is your appointment and you are out when you're supposed to be out. I have gotten both straight styles and wash and go and loved them both!

10.description: Unfortunately, I had to make an update here. Went a 2nd time, and got a hack job of a haircut. This didn't happen to just me but a few coworkers as well. We all had different hairstyles, different stylists, and all received bad haircuts. So bad that all of the preceding beauticians that we've gone to have asked us where did you go, what happened, etc. So, if you do go here, you should do your homework on exactly who you're going to at the very minimum.

5.description: So, I want to first start by saying that my overall experience here was awesome. The salon is gorgeous, the staff are friendly, and I was in and out in a decent amount of time. However, what baffles me is that I paid $105 for a flexi rod set that lasted all of a day and a half. How that is humanly possible is beyond me. I went to the salon on Friday, August 21st in preparation for my bday weekend. So as you can imagine I was saddened that I had to rod half of my own hair the following day because they had fallen--not just fallen, but the hair was bone straight. As a salon that boasts specializing in natural hair, I was sadly disappointed. And given the cost for the services, I will not take another chance for them to fail at a flexi rod set or anything else. I really wanted to like the salon, but due to the outcome of my hair, I had to rate accordingly. Signed, Natural and Saddened

3.description: I knew two things when I walked into Huetiful, this evening.1. I was going to be writing a review. 2. And it was either going to be good or bad.I'm writing this an hour after leaving the salon and unfortunately.. this review is bad. Which sucks bc my experience was wonderful.My hair.. not so much.Let me start off by saying that I straighten my hair, every blue moon. Last time it was straight was summer '14. I decided to get it straightened today bc it was in desperate need a trim and some TLC. I booked a last minute appointment and was happy to get in tonight. I arrived for my appointment.. got a very friendly stylist.. got a phenomenal service (silk press) and gave a very good tip. I spent a total of a $140 for my press, haircut and gratuity.My hair was a frizzball ten minutes after leaving.Mind you, it's late September. Chicago humidity has came and left. The humidity is not even near the reason my hair frizzed up. The stylist did not apply a sealant, antihumectant, drop of hairspray.. nothing. My hair should not go from bone straight to Anne Hathaway's pre-makover hair in "Princess Diaries". I can't even wrap my head around it. No pun intended.I ended up stopping by Walgreens on the way home and grabbing some John Frieda Frizz Ease serum and I'm going to run my blowdryer through it in the morning. I'm praying that it doesn't expand more between now and then. Taylor, I really like you and you are a pretty good stylist. But please add a sealant or finisher of some kind, next time you straighten someones hair. I'm very upset that I had to spend more money on a product to correct what I had just spent an arm and a leg on. I'm also upset about the extra heat I'm going to have to add to my hardly heat exposed hair.I am a first time and last time customer.

35.description: Huetiful is the best salon by far. The stylists book appointments with accurate time slots so there's no wait time. The ambiance is amazing and semi-mellow. The best feature is that they are open 7 days a week.Tasheara is my "go to" stylist. She's awesome and very personable. On my first visit she explained the Huetiful experience and the deep conditioning treatment thoroughly and didn't seem annoyed with all my questions. I have been going to Tasheara for the past 8 months and have no regrets. I even trusted Tasheara to transform me into a golden blond diva and am loving every bit of it.

19.description: Egregiously unprofessional. Previously loved this salon but will NEVER return.This weekend is my graduation from college and obviously a large event in my life, so I trusted Huetiful with my hair (they have previously done my hair on my birthday and I had a great experience.) My roommate is also natural so I recommended she book an appointment the same time as me so we could go together. We rented a zipcar to drive to the salon (its pretty far because we live in Evanston). We left Evanston at 10:40am for our noon appointment, but were caught in heavy traffic during a terrential downpour. I called the salon twice around 11:30 and was sent straight to voicemail, where I let them know our situation which was completely out of our control. Finally, we arrive at the salon at 12:16. We are told that the 15 minute grace period has ended and I remind them that I called to let them know in advance. The extremely rude receptionist lets me know that my friend's stylist will honor her appointment. However, my stylist has not only canceled my appointment, but charged me the late fee. This situation could not have been handled worse for the following reasons:1. When I booked my appointment I was not alerted of this policy at ALL and received no confirmation email2. Nor did I receive a reminder email for my appointment with this information listed3. The lateness was out of our control and my efforts to communicate the lateness was ignored4. They honored my friend's appointment but not mine, though I recommended her and am a repeat customer. When I tried to get them to squeeze me, the receptionist rudely said it was impossible because of my hair type (my friend is 3b) even though I was already detangled5. I called my credit card company and I was charged at 12:10, DURING the grace period6. Their honoring one appointment but cancelling another shows a true lack of investment in customer service. You are taking chances when selecting a stylist!! When my friend brought up the policy to her stylist the stylist had never even heard of it. This gives each stylist the ability to mistreat customers at their will7. I never received a receipt for the unfair charge, which is ILLEGAL. Businesses may not charge customer credit cards without their consent/knowledge and providing proof of purchase8. I made it clear that I would be willing to wait but my efforts were ignored by ALL STAFF. I have never felt more disrespected.The plus side is I went to MENAS around the corner and they did a GREAT job and charged me with my full consent at a fair pricehuetiful - you will never survive long term with this brand of customer service. You should not be more in favor of your wishy washy policies (only applied to certain people at certain times) then the paying CUSTOMER. I demand a full refund and apology. I will NEVER make the huge mistake of recommending another natural haired woman to this atrocity of a business. What a disgrace.RE: the comment below from the owner, your comment is utterly useless to me because of the points #1 and #2 that i clearly laid out above. I received absolutely NO indication of these policies because I received no emails from you. None. At all. Your comment also does nothing to acknowledge the other pressing issues I have addressed, including how my appointment was canceled but my friend's was not. Instating such a policy without carrying it out consistently is unethical and poor business practice. Your attempt at communication has only left a worse taste in nu mouth about your business. I will continue to warn all my natural friends against your business after this truly horrendous experience.

28.description: Natural for 2+years, I was looking for a natural stylist/salon WELL-VERSED in natural hair care and styling..keeping hair in its natural state, not pressing or flat ironing it/one that can assess the client's hair type and determine what products to use that will not dry out the client's hair, optimize moisture retention, enhance shine, bounce and all that good stuff.  Needless to say, didn't get that, got a run-of-the mill salon experience that took WAY too long and didn't look much better than my twist-outs at home, no shine...disappointed and out $75..

45.description: My 1st visit was terrible... but the 2nd time was a charm! I waited 4 weeks until after my 2nd appt to see if my view would change. THANK GOODNESS this time I was extremely happy!! In true Yelp fashion though, I will give the real deal about both visits and won't sugar coat my 1st 2-star experience but will also rave about my lovely 2nd time 5-star visit.TIP: There is no "HUETIFUL" sign on the building, so look for the address. It's located next door to the public library, and there's free street parking but only enough space for a handful of cars.Unlike most salons, their timeliness is impressive. You have to make appointments online with a credit card hold. If you cancel less than 24 hrs in advance or arrive more than 15 mins late, you will get charged the full amount and will not be serviced. I like this policy! If a salon is going to respect my time and get me in and out without overbooking or delays, the least I can do is show up on time for my appointment. And the price is fantastic! Starting at $65 you get a steam condition treatment, trim (if needed), and style options off the Menu 1 list (e.g. press, twist out, bantu knot out, flat twists). The price goes up based on styling options and trims over half an inch are considered a cut for an additional $25. One downside is that the number to the salon is basically a general answering service. No live person answers the phone so if you have questions - good luck. I wanted to change my service from Menu 1 to Menu 2 and had no way of doing so without canceling my appointment and HOPING I could rebook for the same time. I called, left a message, emailed, but got no response so I just crossed my fingers and hoped she could squeeze in the time for my extended service. Huetiful should really figure out a better way. Perhaps post each stylist's number directly on the site.Starting with my 5-star review: Patricia was fantastic!!! I left smiling and had a mini photo shoot to show off my luscious curls after my appt. LOL I arrived early to see if I could start early given my menu change. Thankfully, she was ready for me and said she would work it out. I appreciated that she said if her next client came in, she would stop and attend to her in order to keep her schedule. I like that. She was willing to accommodate me but stay true to her other clients too. That's professional. I have dry scalp so I told her to make sure she washed me thoroughly. She had already said she noticed and was planning on it already! Observant and proactive. I like that too! I wanted a flexi rod set since I had never tried that style before and it turned out lovely! I got so many compliments before even leaving the salon, you couldn't tell me nothing! Aside from having a great salon and styling experience, Patricia was really cool, down to earth and easy to talk to. My friends know that I'm not really chatty like that - especially not at salons and my stylist at another salon is kind of mean frankly and doesn't talk very much LOL - so I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed my overall experience. I will definitely pay Patricia another visit or two or three ;-) and recommend her to anyone who wants a clean, fresh style!Unfortunately my 1st visit with Tasheara sucked (no sugar coating). I desperately needed to re-wash my hair within just 2 days. Washing hair is a basic service I shouldn't have to stress about. It wasn't until after she had blow-dried my hair for my press that she said my scalp wasn't clean. Considering she was the only person attending to me during the visit, I was shocked!! How are you just now noticing this? At the bowl she had even commented on how detangling and brushing during the wash really helped to better cleanse the scalp. Wrong. So at this point, wouldn't you think she would re-wash my hair? I mean, no way, she's going to style a client's not-so-clean hair right? Wrong again. She said, "I'm just not going to flat iron all the way to the root since your scalp isn't clean." Umm, so a) you didn't wash my hair properly and b) my roots won't be smooth. Great, what a disappointing waste of time and money! I was pissed. That was the most ridiculous thing I had ever heard or experienced.I was initially going to do a twist out and Tasheara said I would only need a light dusting of my ends. However when I switched to a press, she said I needed a full INCH cut off! That's the tough dilemma of trimming wet vs. dry. I've been natural for 8.5 years and have done both and the frustrating dilemma still remains. I hate wearing my hair straight but whenever I do it seems I always need so much taken off yet when I rock a curly style, I barely get a dusting. I'm still scratching my head on this one... ugh.

33.description: I've now come twice. After my first visit I thought I'd finally found a styling home in Chicago. After my recent visit, I probably won't come back. The two stars are for my first visit where my stylist was friendly and educational. Also because this salon takes you on time (hopefully every time) and too many other places fail to respect your time. The negatives were the salon was overbooked and my stylist was having trouble finding a station to work in. The first time I had my hair trimmed but my style was a braid out. This meant they didn't trim the whole hair but just the part that was out at the ends. On my second visit , I asked for a blowout trim, she did it but then proceeded to not follow my instructions re the trim. It looks fine straight but I know my curly looks which is how I always wear my hair ( and yes I shared that with the stylist) will be a challenge. On my first visit, I was talked through the products, had a great shampoo, and my hair was de tangled while wet. My hair this time was yanked through dry (which never works for my tight coils) and while she apologized for yanking. She also blamed me for having such damaged hair.My scalp wasn't clean and there was dandruff flying out as she styled. I've never had hair professionally washed but left dirty. I'll have to wash it again in less then a week. But the final straw is that a stylist made me feel ashamed and embarrassed about my hair, I mean my hair wasn't perfect and I definitely needed a trim but that's why I was there. I haven't felt ashamed like that since going natural, and the side comments from other stylist walking by didn't help. And I'm certainly not going to pay $200 to feel that way. So I'm still hunting for a stylist, if you have any recommendations please let me know.

43.description: I cant say enough about this place. It was a wonderful experience, all of the stylists were warm and welcoming and made me feel right at home. It was a highly professional environment and very stylish and up to date. My stylist was Dominique and she was fabulous! She answered all my questions and was very informed about natural hair. I knew the location was near a library which helped me A LOT becuase there is no sign on the building and it is very easy to miss. I have no complaints and I have already recommended the salon to my friends! I live an hour away from the salon but the drive is well worth the top notch experience! They truly seem to care about their clients.

2.description: All I can say is: AWESOME! Had the best, most professional experience ever. I've been natural since 2000. It's been long, it's been short, it's been healthy, it's been fried... Here lately, it's been fried. A big mop that I couldn't stand to comb, so it was time for a change. I'd heard very good things about Huetiful & for me they all turned out to be true. I'm baffled by the bad reviews. I was seen right on time by Brenda & got a pretty thorough hair "diagnosis" & told her what I wanted & then she got right to it giving me a precision cut. The ethos is all about the health of the hair & Brenda took great care of me & my head. My hair is very curly--4A & very fine. I loved my cut, deep condition & steam treatment. Brenda cut my hair dry & wet for the best precision cut. I thought I was going to get finger coils but I really only needed a wash & go and that's what I got. I have the cutest, curliest, most hydrated & healthy TWA (teeny weeny Afro) that I've had in years. Most of the things Brenda told me about how to care for it I already knew but I appreciated the reinforcement. I was in & out in about 2 hours. No fuss, no drama, reasonable price.Huetiful is redefining the Black salon experience & providing lots of professional options in particular for those of us with natural hair. From what I could see all the stylists are great but I really loved my stylist Brenda. I will definitely be back. Proud to support this top-notch Black-owned business.

18.description: Keywords,  hair care..when dealing with natural hair you don't want to have to worry if too much heat is applied or if they know how to care for your natural tresses. Also, they can do any style from coils to blow out.

41.description: I had an appointment with Tasheara for a color and flat twists. I wasn't 100% satisfied (although the color was great) and decided to call the next day for some feedback. Tasheara reached out to me and allowed me to come back for another style. That appointment was yesterday, it was a great experience and i left soo happy. She flat ironed and trimmed my hair. I got so many compliments. After my first appointment i wasnt sure the salon was a great fit but after yesterday, i will def be back for my next flat iron with Tasheara! My hair feels soft and healthy another plus!

52.description: This was my first time at Huetiful, and I'm sold. The salon is just what I was searching for. It's upscale, calming, and the stylists care about healthy hair. My goal for this visit was to get a drastic haircut - a tapered hair cut - and I really needed to find a stylist that I trusted to design a chic, funky style. My stylist was Shawanna who seems very professional and friendly. Oh, and she knows what she is doing. My new haircut is so fun! It's exactly what I had in mind, except better. (I brought in a Pinterest picture for guidance. She got the idea and rolled with it). When styling, I liked that she told me what products she was using and why. It put me at ease and I appreciated the communication. For my final style, I chose flat iron, which turned out silky and has lasted several days now. Next time i see Shawanna, I'd like to try a non-straightening natural hair style, and I'll update after that experience. All the Huetiful stylists care about natural hair, so I'd feel safe and assured in making an appointment with any of them. That said, I believe all stylists have their specialities, and I wish the Huetiful website promoted those more prominently. For example, I feel that some are better at natural hair styles while others are better at straightening natural hair. Some have a passion for and are skilled at creative haircuts and others are more colorists. It's just odd to think that every stylist is a jill-of-all-trades. When making your first appointment, I'd suggest calling the salon to get recommendations on who could best fit your needs. Hopefully you get a candid response. Prices: They're affordable and competitive rates -- for now.

50.description: Great Salon! We've needed a salon like this in Chicago for a long time. Very professional, nice stylists who are very informative and knowledgeable about hair and especially natural hair. I love how they book appointments online and they are on time. I just wish there was more availability and they booked later appointments. I would highly recommend this salon to anyone with a relaxer or natural hair. You will be in and out on time.

4.description: Updating to say I took my hair out just two days after getting it done. And I'm glad that I did. My hair was super dry and probably would have experienced breakage. I did a deep conditioner after taking the style down and booked an appointment with my regular stylist. I won't be trying Huetiful again :(

6.description: This salon is AMAZING! My mother saw Brenda for a Huetiful cut and a wash and go. She had experienced some breakage and wanted a cut that would blend the rest of her hair with the broken off area as it grows back out. Brenda listened carefully to what she wanted, made very helpful recommendations for what would work best and gave her a cut that my mother was extremely happy with! Brenda (and everyone that we interacted with for that matter) was not only professional and knowledgeable but also warm. She was easy to talk to and both my mother and I had a great time. Not only will my mom be returning but I am looking forward to making an appointment for myself and for my daughters in the future. I highly recommend this salon!

22.description: I had a 12:45 appointment for color with Tasheara.  I was greeted by Nina who was extremely accommodating and pleasant.  I was about 15 minutes early so I was able to observe Nina with her clients she had a regular client in her chair that she was finishing and a new client came in right after I did for a consult I believe.  I couldn't help but notice how accommodating she was to the new client as she was finishing the client in the chair.  The salon is pretty and clean. My experience with Tasheara was awesome! She was not super talkative at first (not a problem) forced conversation kinda sucks anyhow.  However I did notice that every time she spoke to me during the coloring process she smiled.  She is extremely pleasant.  My color is beautiful I didn't have to tell her anything she matched it perfectly and warmed it up a little.  She trimmed the ends a little bit flat ironed me and sent me on my way happier and in a timely fashion! I was done by 3:00! I will definitely see her again! Thanks Tasheara!

15.description: ***THIS REVIEW IS NOT FOR THE SALON, IT IS FOR THE HUETIFUL STEAMER***I need to vent my frustrations, and thought hey, Yelp is a great place to do so.  I've already written my complaints with the Better Business Bureau (of which this company has an F rating) and on Amazon.com.  I will continue to write on every social media outlet / platform I can until I get a resolve on my complaint.Anyway, I ordered my steamer on October 20, 2014, and received the steamer on October 27, 2014 via UPS.  The steamer seemed to be in good working order and all of the items inside were intact.  I have used the steamer approximately 6 times in total since I purchased it, and upon my last use the measuring cup that holds the water melted and is now deformed.  I am now stuck with a product that I cannot use.  I have tried calling, emailing, writing, sending smoke signals, fireworks, everything to speak with a customer service representative in hopes of getting a replacement part, and have received NO response.  Not sure what kind of business is being run here, but I'll just say it won't be around for long.All I want is a replacement measuring cup....is that so hard???

57.description: This was my first experience at Huetiful. I wish I could have given 3 1/2 stars, but the site won't let me. I went in for a color (with about 1 1/2" of new growth) after having a consultation. I had been coloring my own hair (since '09), but decided to try professional services so that I could get better, even-looking results while wearing a lighter color ( I have been wearing a lighter color for over a year now). As for style, I opted for a wash & go. I was not fully confident in getting anything else because I've never had my hair "done" by anybody else as a natural. I've always done it myself. At first, I was not really enthused with the results for two reasons: my roots appeared to be way darker than the rest of my hair and my wash & go was a wash & 'fro by the time I got back home (within 40 min. of leaving the salon). The stylist used the Deva Curl line on my hair...that was a first as well. But when I got home I began to like the color better! (My bathroom has great lighting!) Anything lighter would have made my roots look washed out. So, I definitely will be back for a color touch-up, with me taking my own product. Staff: Friendly, Laid-back, KnowledgeableEstablishment: Clean, a little dark for my taste in the styling area thoughAmbience: Quiet, ComfortableParking: Great for early morningBooking: A little tricky for a first-timer. You won't be certain about which stylist is best for you...unless they were recommended by someone.Suggestion for management: if a color consultation results in an actual service, give the client some type of a credit (from the consultation fee) towards their services. :-)

20.description: I have always heard great things about Huetiful. After hearing so many positives I decided to check them out myself. I am very skeptical of salons when it comes to natural hair so I went of faith that I would have a great experience. When I walked in the receptionist was very friendly and welcoming. My stylist came and introduced herself and she started on my hair right away. I decided to get a blowout and trim. When it was all said and done my hair looked fabulous and I thanked my stylist for her work. It wasn't until the next day that I noticed that she didn't just give me a trim she cut my hair. I wish she would have notified me of how much she was going to cut off. I had no idea because of how she curled my hair. Although, I am very disappointed at how much hair was cut I will go back. It wasn't a deal breaker and the service was great.

36.description: Too expensive for fairly mediocre hairstyles. For $90, I expect a style to last more than a couple of days.

14.description: UPDATE:I received a formal apology from the CEO today. Obviously they do care! It seems that the bad apple they had managing the salon has been replaced. I look forward to trying them out again.******************They will charge you for services you never received.I was in a bad car accident and stranded in Ohio on the day of my appointment. Obviously, I had to cancel. Not only was I treated with no compassion for my circumstance, I was lied to, hung up on (twice) and charged for 80% of the services I booked. I completely understand the 50% cancellation policy and would have gotten over my poor fortune but the treatment I received over the phone was beyond rude.The salon manager said she would call back to fix the overcharge but never did.I will never go there again and neither will any of my Chicago friends. Don't have a death in the family, end up in the emergency room, or miss your flight. They don't care.

12.description: In town on family emergency and needed just a wash/style. I Yelped the area and found Mena's. Read the reviews, called and walked in. They weren't busy at all and it felt like family when I walked in. Got washed by one guy, blow dried by another, and finally Fayza styled my hair. 4 stars instead of 5 because I prefer no more than 2 people to complete a wash/style. I also wasn't sure why I got a steam condition right before my hair was blown out. I didn't like the roller brush, but that's their style. I will speak up next time. Fayza had instant chemistry with my hair and it reflects in the pictures. She was appreciative that I allowed her to style my hair because most clients request the set curls not to be fluffed out. I enjoyed my appt that was exactly one hour! My hair is so soft and my husband loves it. This will be my spot everytime I come home to visit! Thanks you all!

7.description: Sasa is very personable and nice. Great service!!! I went in with the nastiest tangled hair and he was able to turn it silky smooth. Turned an ugly duckling into a swan hehehe. I love my hair and new look. Thanks to sasa

20.description: I've been here a number of times to get my hair straightened. I have natural hair and I LOVE the way Mena's leaves my hair! It's never overstraightened so it curls back up after I wash my hair with no stray straight pieces. Awad is my guy and I highly recommend him or any of the other stylists! Sometimes the wait can be ridiculous which is why I didn't give 5 stars.

19.description: I've been going to the 35th street location for a couple years. Fayza and George is good!!

1.description: I wish it was a way to give these guys 2.5 stars. I used to like and frequent Mena's a lot, even started a regular routine in the past to get my hair healthy. Their purpose is to only straighten your hair and the ways they do that is not healthy. You have 3 people working one head and two are using heat? Blow dry with a brush. Flat-iron. Style. Last Tuesday (12/1) was the experience where I said no more. George is a great stylist however, majority of the women (including me) ask for him. Very few go to any other stylists. It gets a little tiresome because you have to wait for George to be done styling several heads. It's not like they use appointments so what can you do, it's more of a first come-first serve. This day I went to Sasa. Sasa is very nice and personable and I've been to him before, but this day he used so much heat on my hair that it smelled burnt. Also, when I went to pay he tells me that they no longer have the $10 off discount for Tuesdays through Thursdays. This was one of the main reasons I went there on weekdays! I'll tell any reader like I told George over the phone when I got home: "$65 for burnt hair is not good".

2.description: The worst customer service, overpriced for just a wash, deep condition, and trim. My hairstyle didn't last long smh. I will never go here again.

9.description: VERY DISAPPOINTED!I went to this location because Dee Dee at the Matteson location was off. I really needed to get me and my daughter's hair done. This location is much smaller than the Matteson location and not as busy as that location either. I am not used to have three different people work on my hair, a shampooer, a blow dryer, and then a stylist. Not everyone can do a good job on my daughter's hair because it is long and thick (very thick). I was pleased with my hair, but was not happy with my daughter's hair. Also they take their sweet little time. They stop doing hair to have conversations with one another.What made matters worse, was the pricing is not the same as the Matteson location, Apparently this location charges more for having natural hair. (Never heard of that before). On Tuesdays it is supposed to be $10 off of your services. My total came to $90 for both of our hair (wash and blow dry). The guy tried to make me feel better by saying I got $10 off and saved an extra $5 for paying cash. I did not have time to debate with him about the cost, so I paid it and made sure he knew I would NOT be back!

6.description: I went couple months ago and george was my stylist. He did a perm, color and gave me a hair cut with short layers. My hair felt light and bouncy, and the layers gave it great volume.  The guy who washed my hair did a superb job, love a good scrub. It was my first time there and was impressed with the service. Thanks george.

18.description: So I've been going to Menas for the past five years. Now with that being said I've seen the same person for those past five years and truly adore his work, but my hair just needed a break!!! So I decided to put a sew in.... I asked George about the young lady (Tenisha) who sat across from him and he said that she was pretty good and  that she had a special every Tuesday, wednesday  and Thursday (75 dollars off of 200 dollar sew in). So me being the person that I am I decided to give her shot. Let's just say it was one of the worst hair decisions that I've ever done in my life. The work was sloppy, the braids looked like my 9 year old cousin did it and just no proper etiquettes!!! Her work was so bad that I literally got my hair re- done the next day!!!!  Although a little bit of money was returned (not from Tenisha's pocket it was from George's) I would advice whoever is looking to get a sew in at Menas on 35th to keep walking and go to the lovely people at Glam Luxe right off of Michigan Ave and Canal. If you don't believe my story shoot me a messageI've got pictures to show how awful Tenisha's work is!!!!!!Aia

10.description: For $40 cash, I can get shampoo, steam condition ($15 extra for deep condition -worth it!) and blow dry, style.  These are Egyptian men doing African American hair.  Milad is my stylist & he's excellent. I'm so happy he can blow straighten my kinky hair and not complain about me needing a perm, which he discourages anyway.y hair is beautiful.No frills, no appointment necessary. Reminds me of the Dominican salons on the east coast. Mena's is open on Sunday's, which is how I found the place -- desperately needing a do for an evening party. That was almost 2 years ago.

13.description: This place is terrible. The 'stylists' yell across the salon at each other and get so worked up, I've actually seen several stop doing hair because they're so angry. One of the women, a shorter hair with a tattoo on her arm, gave me a horribly uneven hair cut. I know they're open for walk-ins very early in the morning. However, it's just not worth it.

16.description: I have been with Mena's Salon for years. I decide to go "natural". My Stylist was very supportive of my decision. Fayza literally has my hair growing down my back. I have never been disappointed leaving them.  I would recommend Mena's to anyone considering going natural or anyone who is a fan of healthy permed or otherwise.

17.description: This will be the last time I come to this location. Last time I came in for an early appointment, and I had to wait an hour & a half with wet hair before the ALL of the hairstylists showed up for work (a shampoo guy let me in). This time, I have been waiting an hour with wet hair for someone to blowdry & style my hair. The thing that upsets me most is that they refuse to be clear with you. I'm not sure if it is a language barrier or what, but when I ask, "Can I be next in your chair?" a simple "yes" or "no" or "I have two before you" would suffice. Mumbling and nodding doesn't cut it- I think I'm next in the chair and when someone else sits down I have no choice but to be upset. Do yourself a favor & don't come here. There are a ton of other places in the area you can go to. If my hair wasn't wet and under a plastic cap I would get up and leave.

15.description: I went to Mena's on Easter Sunday for the first time. I normally wear braids or sew-ins, but I wanted to allow my hair to breath so my daughter suggested I go there. I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of time I spent in the salon because it was quite a few people there waiting for service. Sasa was the stylist that did my hair, he was pleasant and friendly and I was very satisfied with the service I received. I will definitely be returning!

0.description: Excellent.  I love the Egyptian stylists.  Before moving to Chicago, I went to Dominican Hair Salons.  Although this salon uses hot curlers, I simply asked for flat irons only and they always do it without complaint.  They never asked me to get a touch up perm or relaxer, which is awesome!  They're really good at getting coarse hair straight and stylish as if I had a perm.  My styles last a long time, 2 weeks (I pincurl & wear silk scarf at night).  One of the lady stylists is superb at eyebrow threading!  The great price, flexible hours, the friendly Christian environment -- deserve 7 stars.  Best stylists: Sosa, George (the manager), and the guy at the third chair on the left as you walk in (has a short, wavy ponytail), and the short old guy who washes and steam conditions my hair.  By the way, they're open 24 hours. Catch them one a good day and someone will spontaneously start singing Egyptian gospel songs (cracks me up).  By the way, they also have a location by 95th street.  Make sure you see Melad, my stylist for 4 years before he moved locations.

5.description: I got a spam text message to my cell phone from this place advertising their services. It gave their address, so I know this is the location. I've never been here, so they must have bought my cell phone number with some list. Mena's, I don't do do business with spammers.You suck.

11.description: Waste of money. This dude stayed on his cell phone the entire time. I asked for a cut and I barely got a trim. $90.00 down the drain.

8.description: I enjoyed my most recent experience.  My hair is natural, fine and easily damaged. I received the deep condition and steam. George trimmed all of the crunchy ends from my hair in layers. After one hour, I was transformed.  Loved the results

3.description: I absolutely love, love, love Sasa! He's the best! He always does exactly what I want, he's very friendly, warm, and professional.  Did I mention he's very good at what he does!?! He is the only stylist I go to. Give him a try. You won't be disappointed!

14.description: I've been going here for a couple of years now. George is the best stylist!!! When I first started coming my hair was broken off and damaged now I have my length and healthiness back. They have steam dryers and the service is normally fast!!

4.description: Sasa was great doing my hair. He was very nice and did a great job styling my hair. As soon as I came in I was helped I didn't have to wait. I got the deep conditioning treatment, ends trimmed and wash and style for $75. When I was leaving it was raining and he gave me a free shower cap. I don't live in town, but whenever I come to Chicago I'll definitely go back and get my hair done with Sasa.

12.description: After teasing an opening for almost nine agonizing months, this place opened last week.  Yes for us employees around the IIT campus, our options for lunch have risen dramatically...  no longer am i choosing jalapeno cheetos from the vending machine, 7-11 sandwiches and samosas (very brave of me i might add)  or just starving.  In one week i've gone 5 times.  I promise never to get sick of you jimmy johns.

7.description: After procrastinating and studying nonstop for an exam at Starbucks next door, I was famished! Conveniently, JJ is right around the corner. The service is always very friendly and freaky fast! It's my go to place for a quick lunch when I'm on campus. I don't know what it is, but the bread is addicting - along with a bag of jalepeno chips and a pickle, I'm a happy camper!

20.description: After teasing an opening for almost nine agonizing months, this place opened last week.  Yes for us employees around the IIT campus, our options for lunch have risen dramatically...  no longer am i choosing jalapeno cheetos from the vending machine, 7-11 sandwiches and samosas (very brave of me i might add)  or just starving.  In one week i've gone 5 times.  I promise never to get sick of you jimmy johns.

19.description: I work across the street and am very happy that there's a reasonably healthy, GOOD choice for fast food now!  Always fast, always cheap, and always good.This is my go-to when I don't bring a lunch!!!

1.description: Walked into the place and stood at a register and wasn't greeted. Turns out the cashier was closing the register, but at least acknowledge the fact that I'm standing there waiting to be served. Not once did she look at me or speak to me, but called someone over to open the next register. Also, this was THEE Slowest jimmy johns I've ever been to. It took too long for them to make my sandwich, and by the time I got home, I realized my bread was stale. I wasn't going to drive all the way back up there, but I'll never return to that location. When I walked into the place, they were throwing out bread by the loaves. I should've took that as a sign that my bread would've been dry and old as hell too!!

2.description: I just tried to order myself a sandwich and I live about 7 blocks away and they told me they would not deliver to me what kind of stuff is that they are on 35th and state and I'm on 33rd and Lowe I'll never order from there or get food from there again the girl was very rude

9.description: Slow Deliveries, Mediocre Customer Service, and the Owners stinks. Blaah.

6.description: I really thought Jimmy John's was supposed to be fast... Typically it is.  But somehow it took 50 minutes to deliver to a location approximately 1 mile away.  By the time the sandwich arrived the bread was soggy.  Even worse were the mushy tomatoes they put on the sandwich.  I was pretty disappointed and probably won't order food from here again.

18.description: This is a review for their delivery. I honestly just love Jimmy. So dependable and always here quick when I'm most in need. I don't know whether it's this location, but they really are freaky fast. I've ordered so many times from here, and not once have they screwed up my order. And, to top it off, the delivery boys are so nice. Sure, they've been late a couple of times here and there, but the guys always seem sincerely apologetic.It's the best thing after a long day when I'm too lazy to cook.

10.description: Ummmmm....tell me something, people.  Is it customary for JJ's to ask for sandwiches BACK?  LIke, you know, if they screw up on a delivery order and you call to complain about it?  Isn't that against some, if not health code, for customer service code?  Other than that, this place is okay - typical JJ's.  Packed during lunch, but they're usually pretty fast with delivery.

13.description: F you Jimmy Johns.there is nothing else next to this place so I'm forced to come here or eat the new 'cous cous' salad from Starbucks.They've consistently left things out of my order. I didn't want tomatos...And yes, there were tomatos.Today, I paid the extra 50 cents for hot peppers. I heard the lady scream peppers but when I got back to my office and looked in my sandwich, did I get hot peppers? No. I personally believe a $7 sandwich should at least have all the right parts.

16.description: This place has been open for about two weeks and it still runs like a well-oiled machine.  I think I ate here 3 times last week - oops!  Love the Vito and the "Big John".  If you don't order your sammy without hot peppers you are totally missing out.  Hot dang!

17.description: So I ordered Jimmy Johns for lunch with a few friends at work. The bread is amazing... and I got a BLT which was great.They did take almost 2 hours for delivery and the size of the sandwich was much smaller than I expected for the price.So, I'd say, if youre willing to spend the money for a good sandwich and you aren't starving (which I was by the time I got it)...then go for it! But, stop by, don't get delivery.

15.description: I have ordered here many times for delivery to my school. It takes this establishment over 40 mins to make 2-3 sandwiches and deliver them from a mile away. Not freaky fast.

0.description: Great service and delicious subs!  This place is always clean.  The staff is friendly.  The parking can be challenging since there is limited parking in front of their establishment.

5.description: Best subs ever!!Especially  #5 vito

11.description: Horrible! My husband ordered sandwiches with no tomato...both came with tomato...and about 2 cups of mayo...so much mayo the sandwich couldn't be salvaged.I ordered an unwich...the lettuce used for the wrap looked unwashed.  It was wilted and brown...also inedible. When the guy at the counter handed my husband his sandwiches, my husband told him it was to go, and the guy at the counter replied "the bags are right there".Finally, when a place's slogan is subs so fast you'll freak, they should try to live up to it.  Service was slow considering there were no other customers in front of us. Will not be going back.

8.description: I've been here for take-out and ordered for delivery several times. Orders are always accurate and quick. I love the veggie sub. Delivery isn't always the fastest compared to other Jimmy Johns locations, but they come up to my door (I live in a highrise), rather than make me come down to the lobby. So nice.

3.description: Horrible phone customer service!  Called to place a large catering order for the end of the yr party for my organization and in five minutes had three people answer the phone, place on hold, and the final person appearing mentally challenged or under the influence trying to take my order. Loud giggling and yelling in the background, the guy couldn't hear, finally I said never mind. Won't call back and will not recommend for business..

14.description: REVIEW OF SERVICE ON 6/10 - $1 SUB DAYLine was massive, as expected, but the service was spectacular. They had people fill out thie rorder sheets while in line, and all we had to do was hand it to the cashier. Sub was made fast, and very tasty.It's nice they offered this promotion the day I'm at a sox game.

4.description: I reserved this review until I gave this jimmy johns a second chance. The first time I came here a week or so ago they were completely out of bread and said the customers could wait 15 or 20 minutes. I went in again today and asked for wheat bread... Out again. At least today they had white bread (which I am unable to eat). How can a sandwich shop be out of bread for two days? If you offer sandwiches as your major product, you should have bread on hand... It seemed like the staff didn't even care. Too bad, this place is very close to me and I will not be back.

3.description: Too bad this place has such bad review so thought this was the best one my chicken is always fresh and if there out of something they will give u a fair trade of something else.....

1.description: I was in the drive up and waited over 20 minutes for popcorn chicken.  slow, lazy workers and need to be slapped  I mean trained more on customer service. Now I got my food and I asked for potato wedges and I get mashed potatoes with no spoon.  This pace needs to have the workers trained more and not just come in with a I hate customers attitude. I want to apply for manager just to get this place on track.

2.description: This was a Awwful experience,the Original Recipe was was too salty and extra greasy, where was the 11herbs and spices,just Awwful, #NeverAgain.

5.description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. EVERY time I come here they always say they are out of something or the wait will be 20 min. And when I say I'll wait for the 20 mins it's never that long. They are just lazy and don't want to make it. Better staff would defiantly be the answer . Not a bunch of hood rats trying to sit on the clock and make a dollar.

6.description: I don't shop at places with glass between customer and order taker. Can barely understand what is being said.

0.description: Just a tad bit hood, but other than that it was alright.I loved how it felt like the lady at the pick-up window was yelling at me because her mic was turned up too loud.If someone finds a 5 star KFC, let me know... seems like an oxymoron right?

4.description: This has got to be the worst KFC in town.  The wait is long, they never have food already ready, thus the misnomer 'fast food' and the food is awful.  The management is a joke, not taking any complaint seriously.  Don't waste your time or your hard earned cash for over-priced bad food

3.description: The history of this place is pretty amazing. It's worth going in just to get the feel and see the old pictures. The employees were all friendly and they helped us find anything we needed. Of course the selection isn't phenomenal with a neighborhood hardware store, but we were able to find almost everything.

1.description: This place is awesome. I love the personal touch that they apply to every encounter. I know I could go to the big box franchise and save a few cents. I rather support a business that genuinely cares about the community that they serve. The location is also a part of music history as it was formerly one of the hottest jazz clubs in the world at one time. Ask for Dave for a brief history lesson.

2.description: I made the mistake of offhandedly mentioning Home Depot to David, the proprietor, and he revealed what we all know: "Those guys are crushing me. I can't compete." He also added, that he has one thing they don't: history.I think he's mistaken, though. In addition to history, this store also has (as a previous reviewer noted) that extra "personal touch" and it seems that he knows most of his customers personally.Regarding history, this hardware store is in the same legendary building once owned by Satchmo and hosting the likes of Benny Goodman, Earl Hines, and Cab Calloway. The current owner admits to not being a jazz guy, but was more than willing to leave his post at the cash register to give us a quick tour, pointing out how the room's support pillars had been modified from photos of the original Sunset Cafe. He let us in to the best preserved part of the club, the current manager's office which formerly served as a stage. Strikingly, the mural behind the stage was intact.A true fact I learned today: sound waves don't ever die, they just get smaller and smaller until you can't distinguish them from background noise even with unlimited amplification. Maybe that's why it's been said that if you close your eyes here, you can still "feel the jazz."Back to the hardware store itself... locally owned stores, like classic jazz, are fading but not yet forgotten. I've learned to love places like this ever since that time in '05 at Home Depot when I almost got run over by a forklift.

5.description: The best neighborhood hardware store ever! The owners are they every day and willing to help in any way they can. I needed a tempered glass curio cabinet door made. After calling MANY glass companies that couldn't help me and the ones that could were crazy expensive I thought I would call Meyers Hardware just down the street and of course David got it done.  We forget how helpful and fortunate we are to have a hardware store right in the neighborhood that knows customer service!!

6.description: I love this store!  They have been around for a long time and the owners are always on site providing that extra personal touch that you just can't get in the big box stores.  The staff is helpful & friendly and they go out of their way to provide great service.  I've never left this store disappointed, or without whatever I'm looking for.  Neighborhood stores can not compete with the prices offered in the big box stores - but when it comes to great service they absolutely take the prize!!!

7.description: Long-established hardware store.  I read in the Tribune that there used to be a nightclub on the second floor with a lot of artifacts extant.  The owner might let you take a peek, but he apparently doesn't have a whole lot of interest in it.

0.description: So glad that this Ace is here, David and his staff can't be any more personable. We try to get anything hardware related here first, only then do we think of the big box guys. I know some people say that their prices are a bit higher, well that may be true as they don't having the buying power of the big guys, however what is your time worth? It takes me two minutes to get there, and a few minutes in the store. I'm in and out of Meyer's before I'd even be halfway to that other place.Need some screens repaired they do it, glass repairs they do that too, some stuff to put in the garden so the rabbits go away, check, also stuff to get rid of the ants and wasps too. My house is known as the natural disaster zone.Then of course there is the history, before it became your Ace is the place, it was the Sunset Cafe, so even if you don't need any hardware, this is the place to visit for some cool jazz history.

4.description: I'm always impressed by the selection at this Ace. I've walked in many times thinking they won't have what I need because it's too small a store. Ever time I walk out with a solution. The guys behind the counter are very knowledgeable and helpful to point me to what I need. A great asset for the neighborhood that saves a long trip to the big box store.

3.description: I've walked past this salon since it was being built as my vet is right down the street. I kept telling myself that i'd check them out and today I finally did after becoming increasingly dissatisfied with my current stylist. I wish I'd done it sooner because my hair looks great.I called the day before to make an appoint and had no trouble getting in. I arrived on time and waited about 10 minutes before being seen. The shampoo guy was nice and did a fine job but I found the bowls very uncomfortable. My stylist was Adel and he took me right after my shampoo. I informed him about my hair and cautioned him not to use too much heat. He used the blow dryer on medium heat and asked questions every step of the way. He made sure that he didn't put anything in my hair without my consent and took the time to explain how my hair would look if he used one curling wand vs. the other one.Adel was very personable and professional. The entire staff seemed that way and the salon is nicely decorated and modern. There happened to be a lot of children being serviced so it was a bit chaotic for awhile but I heard one of the stylists say that children are only welcome if they are actual clients. The prices are extremely reasonable as well. I will most definitely be a return customer!

1.description: $35 wash & blow dry, you get what you pay for.. I thought I'd try someplace new because my usual spot is by appt only and cost $65 for a wash & blow dry. The guy who washed my hair has a physical disability which enables him to thoroughly wash and comb my hair. The guy who blow dried my hair had the heat too high and the combo of the heat and very hard brush was painful at times. Finally the guy who curled my hair (the owner) was quick and pleasant.  The salon is very clean, and I was out in about an hour and a half. Overall,  the experience was ok. They just need a shampoo and blow dry person to be as skilled as the stylist (owner). In the meantime,  I'll go back to my main salon. It cost more but the staff is friendly and skilled, they comb through my natural hair with ease, blow dry on med heat and style me just right:)

2.description: You get what you pay for. $35 cut and blow dry.   Friendly staff, ample street parking, conveniently located, tea  and coffee. The shop can get busy but they're very accommodating and are conscious of your time.  I will be visiting them again.

5.description: This is a great place. Quick service and has reasonable prices. I'm glad to find a place that doesn't charge extra for length. I've been here 10 times and have no complaints.

6.description: This was a first visit for me, Adele was my stylist and really took care of me. Ive been looking to find a new salon, so I think this may be the spot. Hafid really has a great customer service set up here and is very catering. Just what the neighborhood needs! The shop is relaxed and the music was nice, it was specific to the clientele and not his native country. Nice touch. Decor is sleek but comfy and he offers a great price. Im a fan.

7.description: I've been looking for someone who can style my hair based on my face structure.  Someone who can cut my hair based on my skull topography.  Finally, I found Hafid.  He was delightful, personable and did a fantastic job with my hair.  Proof was in the number of compliments I received on the haircut and the happiness I felt looking at myself in the mirror.  I was able to style my hair in any-which-way I wanted!!  I would go there committed.

0.description: This place has a great atmosphere and friendly staff.When you need a good wash and blow dry this is a good place to come to.This place is very clean and very well kept.The Guys that work here always do a really good job on your hair.I like to get the deep condition and  under the steamer  it's like the  best thing that can happen to our hair.You well feel the difference as well as see it.When I leave this place after getting my hair done I feel like a million bucks and I can just hear my hair saying thank you lol. So give this place a try You can always find a good parking spot and its in a very good locations.Have a great day. Happy yelping

4.description: Literally the worst salon I've ever been to. The sign outside says $35 wash & blow dry. Not "starting at..." or "$35-$55". But when i come in I'm told my hair will be $10 more because my hair is natural and long. The next issue is the person that washed my hair didn't do much washing at all. My hair came out half clean. As I set in the chair to get a blow dry I was still scratching residue from my scalp and no one said anything. Lastly, the guy who straightened my hair didn't do much straightening either. When he showed me the mirror at the end, I had chunks of hair that was still frizzy, my edges were not straight and half was uncurled. When I asked him to fix it, he barely did that. I literally went straight home and flat ironed my hair all over again. Ive had my hair styled for over 20 years and NEVER experienced anything this terrible. I just moved to the city and was looking for a new salon buy will never return here. I would urge anyone else not to go here unless you're looking for a cheap job.

3.description: Funky building - good drinks (better than most chain coffee places like *bucks and the like).The staff is really diverse with 100% student workers from all over the world ie. "Global" grounds cafe.The fresh baked pretzels, and smoothies are unique items not found at most coffee shops - oh and the chocolate cake milkshake is a must try!This is the college hang out with music chosen by the barista from 7am-11pm so you get quite a diverse cultural experience from Indian to dance to rock.

1.description: The coffee is worst. Literally. I travel long way from my dorm to Starbucks rather than have IIT coffee. It taste bitter and plain, and the staff aren't that professional. It said on their face:"yea it's just a stupid part time job to get some money."

2.description: This location is currently run by Sedexo. They have "health smoothies" (for weight loss, muscle gain, immunity boost, etc.), milkshakes, coffee & baked goods.I mostly purchase coffee and smoothies here (though the milkshakes are pretty damn awesome).I would give Global Grounds 5 stars, but there are certain staffers to avoid. There are those few (evening workers mostly) who really make the experience (AND THE COFFEE) better....much better. Also, the choice of hours is odd & dependent on events and student presence. :'(There is a newly furnished, quiet area to sit comfortably at with plush seats and small "coffee tables." From here you may view 32nd street.Cost is lower than Starbucks with, in my opinion, better coffee. They serve it in a variety of ways with a variety of beans. As a result of being run by Sedexo, the entire menu changed in the last year or so.ALSO, there is a spending program for each $5+ you spend in non-university currency.WiFi is only available to students. If you're going to park, either use the meter parking on the east side of the building, or park a block away (east) on Michigan Ave. or Indiana Ave.

5.description: This is the patron coffee shop of IIT, owned by IIT alumni and run by students. However, since there is so little food near campus, I've seen area medical interns frequent it as well. However, as a coffee shop, it does a pretty bad job. It's very expensive, and you have to know what you're getting, because most things taste the same, despite the menu being enormous. The best are the Oreo shakes and mango smoothies. Occasionally, some of the stuffed pretzels are good, if you get a student who can make them well. The only reason it gets a decent amount of business is because students have it as a choice on their meal plan and many tourists, who can afford the prices, come to the campus to see its well-known architecture.

0.description: The Mies-van-der-Roast is very good. I'm an avid coffee drinker, and most of the coffee there is pretty great. The decaf makes my stomach ache though.There are a few of the shakes that I don't like very much, but overall it beats starbucks by a long shot!

4.description: They have really good flaxseed muffins which I've been able to find elsewhere. As a campus coffeeshop, though, I'm not all that impressed, mostly because the students make really, really horrible drinks. Don't ever, ever order a soy chai latte here, and if you see a guy with a ponytail at the counter, I'd recommend staying away from the milkshakes as well. Yeah, I lack school spirit, I know.  All too easy at this institution.Some kudos: GlobalGrounds only serves FreeTrade coffee.

3.description: I went through the drive thru tonight and ordered a strawberry cream cheese pie. The cashier, and his nastiest voice, told me it would take seven minutes. Then he said, "We have apple pies ready... take one of those." I told him that wasn't what I wanted and he said, "Well you gonna have to wait."  What kind of nonsense is this?My last visit there, a few weeks ago, resulted in the cashier leaving two items out of my order. I try to support businesses in my community but this restaurant seems to make it hard and sometimes impossible.

1.description: This was a good day at this Popeye's.. my food was good and  hot... The drive Thur was fast. I was happy to see that I had napkins ,hot sauce,and cocktail sauce.. way to gooooo. I'll be back

2.description: This is the worst Popeye's location!! The customer service is non existent. The employees are rude and have an attitude.They also lie to the corporation about wait times by asking everyone who comes in the drive thru to back up to the garbage can and pull forward again. They are ALWAYS out of something whether its hot sauce or a side dish. I have NEVER been satisfied at this location and I do not plan to ever go back. They need to fire everyone there and start over.
