I will be calling the corporation to report them. The only positive is the chicken is usually hot and good.

5.description: This location makes it seem like you are in a maximum security bank. Glass at the counter blocks staff from customers.  Maybe this was needed 10 years ago, but Bronzeville has come a long way since then and most other restaurants don't have it in area.  It's incredibly hard to hear the order takers through microphone system.  Same story with drive threw.  Service is slow.  They ditched Pepsi for Coke products and mac and cheese, which also gets negatives in my book.

6.description: Popeye's is a great franchise all on its own, so it automatically gets four stars in my book.This location is in a difficult spot, since it's directly next to a KFC, directly across from Wings Around The World, and there's a Church's within a few blocks as well.  Still, I always have to stop in at this Popeye's if I'm ever in the area.  It's not uncommon for me to have a bounty of wings from WATW and still walk into Popeye's to get some biscuits, french fries, and maybe a couple of pieces of that spicy fried chicken as well.This location in particular could use with more specials / family meals.  The smallest special at this place (other than the Wednesday deal) is something like 10 pieces of chicken and two large sides.  I've been to other locations with more offerings to get me a good deal on some delicious chicken.Still, it's Popeye's and that's what gets it four stars.  The staff is average and the deals are minimal, so it shall remain at four stars.

7.description: This is got to be the worst Popeyes I ever been to. How do you explain running out of chicken at a chicken restaurant, really. Terrible service, all most of them seem to have an attitude. No ice is no ice sorry you got it wrong. This is a pretty regular occurrence. Hate coming here but live so close and I love Popeyes.

8.description: Unprofessional teen Employees acting a fool inside and thugs hanging outside. Took 20 minutes for 2 piece in drive up. Drive the extra miles for another chicken place. They need to close this one down and build a church.

9.description: Despite there being 4 other fried chicken places on the block, Popeye's is always my choice.  Watch out for the 8-piece special on Tuesdays and the month before Marti Gras.

0.description: Stopped in for a quick lunch on Monday afternoon.  Popeyes is Popeyes, pretty much no matter where you go.  Well except for that one downtown.....(clears throat)This particular Popeyes is a very clean one.  The food they gave me was piping hot and tasted good (in other words it was cooked thoroughly) and the service was professional and fast.  From the time I placed my order to getting my food = 3 minutes.I'll be back Popeyes, now that I've found one on the South Side near my house that I like.....

4.description: This is by far the best Popeyes I have ever set foot in. I've been to about 4 others and I don't know why but they are always lazy, getting your order wrong, or horrible service. But this place takes the cake! Congrats Popeyes on 35th!

3.description: The worst ever...I do not like 7e anymore because of their exploitive methodsFrom refusing to give cash backs to force you use their ATM, to intentionally ignoring the deals and offers 7 E nationally offers.Some people are nice but their practices  are disgusting.

1.description: The main staff always seems to be trying to sap every last cent out of you. Everything in the store is priced higher than the average 7/11 even those in the loop. They even place promotional deals weeks in advance before it kicks in. So you head up to the counter to just be charged full priced. And when you ask why they move over to the promotional board and point out the date(in very small print) at which it kicks in which wouldn't be for another week or two. Heck I've even seen promotional deals where the staff wrote in s higher price with a marker. They only reason they're still around is because nothing else is as conveniently nearby as the 7/11 so they have they're own little monopoly going on. Every other 7/11 is perfectly fine but this one. I try to avoid it at all times. If a walgreens opened anywhere nearby this place would be out of business quick.

2.description: After spending the summer having to visit this 7 Eleven the only great thing is that they are open 24/7. The hot food sits out way too long to be edible. The staff was not friendly or personable. The last thing: How can a 7 Eleven be out of slushes? I don't even drink them, but I found it odd that the machines were out of order on national slushie day. The counters were never clean and the food didn't have prices anywhere (on the item or even on the freezer tag). They were also more expensive than the 7 Eleven off of Jackson. This 7 Eleven is only for IIT students, staff, and visitors.

5.description: It looks like the other two reviews for this site are outdated, and I'd like to give an update that I think is rather important.I've bought spoiled food from this 7 Eleven more times than I can count now. The store constantly has problems with temperature regulation and I've walked in more than twice each week on probably 85 degree heat. So, not only is all of the cold food getting warm, but everything from candy to chips/snacks goes bad quickly. With the exception of maybe one or two employees, almost every person who works at this store seems to show a lack of respect for customers or motivation to do their job properly and efficiently. Some employees handle the hot food well, but most of them leave pizzas and other snacks out, and still try to sell everything after it's been sitting out for at least 5 or 6 hours. First, I think 7 Eleven needs to get a handle on the quality control of this specific location. Every other location I've been to, specifically in the loop, always has fresher food and a larger variety. I'm not saying this 7 Eleven needs to start serving alcohol like the others, but I would really like to see more variety and better quality. Also, temperature maintenance is a HUGE problem. I don't know what is happening with that, but every time I've bought food from there when it's hot inside, it has always made me sick. I don't intend on going back until that problem is fixed.I'm hoping other IIT students and Bronzeville residents would agree with most of this. Also, another addition - this 7 Eleven is EXPENSIVE! Even the ones in the Chicago Loop (West Adams) sell most of their dry goods at half to three-quarters of this 7 Eleven's prices. I don't see any possible reasons behind that.

6.description: I went on 7/11/11 to celebrate 7-eleven's birthday with a free slurpee and some chips. When I arrived the cashier informed that they only offer the free slurpees from 10am until noon.  I felt it was un-fair to stop the promotion at noon, when radio and news advertisements stated it was an all day promation.

7.description: I like that this 7 eleven sells indian food in the freezer section, because other than that it is impossible to get anything gluten free here. The younger lady that works there is very rude. I avoid going into the shop when she is working.

0.description: Located in a sketchy neighborhood. Was convenient to grab some gatorade and snacks when we were in the area to attend a function. The snacks you get here are of the cheaper variety loaded with artificial flavors.

4.description: Looks like this place hasn't been reviewed in a while. Well, having read the other reviews I'm happy to find I haven't had nearly the negative experience that others seem to have. I've always had nice interactions with the employees and have never run into expired food. Maybe they've changed some practices since then. But like another reviewer said, I'm also pleasantly surprised and happy with their selection of meals. I have on several occasions picked out a decent korean ramen and indian frozen meal--especially important when you remember this 711 is on a college campus :P I will say however that I can confirm what yet another reviewer mentioned about having up a little sign quite frequently to say that they're not doing debit withdrawals at the register. And yeah, that totally just seems like a scam to get you to use their ATM. That's disappointing. I can't comment on their hot foods really, as I've only had a single slice of pizza before--but at that, it wasn't bad? haha. No major complaints here :)

3.description: Curl Kitchen is ingeniously located right next door to the renowned Huetiful Salon on S King Dr in Chicago.  I've had the pleasure of visiting CK twice and both times I saved money on products and purchased the Huetiful hair steamer for the cheapest it's ever been.  The associates are super helpful and knowledgeable about the products and I was greeted with a glass of wine when I 1st arrived which made the visit even sweeter.  I'll def be back.

1.description: I'm natural hair newbie so glad to have a place I can go to for questions, help advise. I wish you great success and hope your business thrive hope more embrace their natural hair. I've now become comfortable with embracing my natural hair I'm comfortable in my brown skin now   Can't wait to visit your store

2.description: Curl Kitchen is my -go to- place for natural hair workshops/products, great conversation and genuine level vibes. The hair kitchen setup, chalk board wall, big bay windows (with pillows), robust wine and being directly next to the Huetiful salon are just a few things that make this business great. I purchased my Huetiful steamer from here a while back and adore it! The central location in the historical Bronzeville area and the owner Claire being the beautiful soul she is keeps customers like me loyal. I'm enjoying watching this business thrive and will be there for the ride. Definitely a must visit.

0.description: I've visited Curl Kitchen on numerous occasions and am always impressed by the product knowledge that the owner , Clare has. I know a review for a natural hair care store might seem odd coming from a male but aside from the fact the various products are male and female friendly , curl kitchen periodically has products specifically for men. Curl kitchen has become my go to spot for shampoos and conditioners and I've got all my friends coming down too!

3.description: These were the "hot wings" I received. This location is very careless with how they handle people's food. This is my 2nd time I've tried this location both times the food has been horrible. I will not be returning.

1.description: This Domino's is the worst. Unfortunately my wife and I love their pizza but we HATE ordering from this location. I was at work 40 minutes away and thought maybe this time they would prepare our food and deliver it before I come home - guess what no pizza but I did get an update from their amazing little app telling me that my driver Stephen is on his way. As of right now, that was over 25 minutes ago and still no pizza. The sad part is my apartment is literally 2 blocks away. Now I could have drove from work and picked up the pizza myself or stopped at another location, but with traffic being unpredictable and a hungry family at home I thought maybe the one thing Domino's can do is deliver the pizza within a reasonable time frame... but as usual why should I expect that from a restaurant that delivers.

2.description: I told myself the last time this happened I would not be ordering from this location anymore but I did once again. I ordered two pizzas and Parmesan Bites. My pizzas came not done, it seems as if they put it in the oven for 5 minutes and sent my order out. I am continually disgusted with this Dominos and I will be sure to contact corporate about them. I called the store and the manager got an attitude at first saying they don't send out undone pizza. Then she said she would remake and send them out but then I run the risk of them doing something unsanitary to my order.  Secondly they didn't delivery any sauce for the bites after we had to pay extra for the sauce. I called in again about it and she refunded me money but wasn't happy. The inconsistency here at this location is the reason I will not be ordering from them ever again.

9.description: I called then the boy who took my order is really rude. When I was talking to him, he was talking to somebody else :/

10.description: Phone etiquette is awful. Pizza is nasty. Delivery people are pathetic.

4.description: Zero stars. Location sux. I live five min if that from this location and it took an hr for delivery when it told me fifteen min . Would never order from her again or even eat here again.

6.description: I recently visited this location and all of the one star reviews are much too generous. The cashier had sagging pants and looked totally unsanitary from head to toe. Firstly, the boom box was so loud playing rap music that he could hardly hear my order. The customer ahead of me was told after he charged his Artesian Pizza that they no longer sell them. The Artesian Pizza is still prominently displayed on the overhead menu. Nevertheless, I was never thanked for my order and waited for 40 minutes. The pizza was very sloppy which showed zero skill. This location has always been bad news.

11.description: This is the worst Domino's location, don't go there. I ordered from this Domino's location because it was newly built in the area. I ordered my pizza online. When I went to pick it up the delivery driver took my pizza. Now mind you, my husband was due to leave for work in 20 minutes and had no dinner and had to leave hungry! They had no apologies, no supervisor, and no compensation for my inconvenience (coupon, % off, anything). I tried to contact the supervisor Beret via the phone number the worker gave me and I got a general vm message just stating the number. What manager doesn't have a greeting on their vm stating their title and name. Then I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and ordered from them again, online. My husband went to pick up the pizza and they told him that they couldn't find it and that he would have to wait 45 minutes for another pizza. No explanation whatsoever. Mind you if you order online it shows you the progress of the pizza (prepared, cooking, ready for pick up) and it said that it was ready for pick up online yet they claimed to not even find it in the system. Everyone that works here (including the manager) are unprofessional and careless. I will not ever order from there again!

5.description: Worst experience ... the manager was rude and unprofessional once I question why my food was not delivered. You will think a big corporation will  take action on hiring better qualifying people to handle situations like these.

7.description: Only gave it 1 star because no stars is not an option. Ordered my pizzas at 9:20pm. It's 10:40 at the time of this review and I still have not received my food. Called twice, spoke to manager once. No one has any answers nor does anyone want to take ownership of why it's late. If you're in the Kenwood/Bronzeville area and feel like ordering pizza from here, I'd suggest just ordering Chinese or making yourself a bowl of cereal.

8.description: I placed an order on-line through their website shortly after 6pm.  Got the confirmation and it stated it would be ready within 26-36 minutes; which is fine.  Waited till about 40 minutes (giving them some benefit of the doubt) , still no order and then called them once it has been almost an hour since that order was placed on-line with a email confirmation.  They told me it would be 15-20 minutes before my food is delivered.  Not exactly the best wait time for 1 order of 14 piece BBQ wings and 1 order of 14 piece hot wings... guess I am going somewhere else to get those wings next time.

0.description: I place my order online for a carryout. My item of choice was the chicken haberno sandwich. Which it is one of my favs. The pizzas are okay if you are on a budget. During certain particular times you may find a manager special for a medium pizza for $3.99. Although I prefer any sandwich on the menu than eating their pizza. Every time I have entered this establishment someone has welcome me. I have not had any problems with an order thus far. The restaurant is always clean. The only tiny issue is lack of personality from the employees behind the counter.

3.description: We found a new favorite spot in the neighborhood!  Forever Yogurt is fab - the space is bright and cheery, the owner was a delight to chat with, and the yogurt was delicious!  I took my daughter and her friends today and as we walked out they asked when we're coming back!  Support this business - a real asset for Bronzeville!

1.description: I love my dutch chocolate but now they have double dutch so I have to mix it with vanilla bean buy overall its great frozen yogurt. I just hope this location doesn't turn into a posted up spot for the unruly individuals that live around here. I love my people but I don't need you posted up if you're not purchasing and being civilized. When I walked in they were playing explicit rap music. This is inappropriate since forever yogurt is suppose to be a kid friendly place. The owner needs to ensure this place don't turn into a ghetto spot or it may not last long and that's something I wouldn't want to happen.

2.description: This new spot is GREAT!  Lots of flavors with solid nutritional info to go by unlike places that just say "low fat" or "no sugar".  The two ladies were super nice and friendly when I walked in.  I loved the double dutch chocolate and green tea with honey flavors!  When I went in, some of the yogurt was coming out a little bit more runny than I would like, but overall, the place is a great addition to the neighborhood. Keep it up!

5.description: This Forever Yogurt location is awesome.This was our 2nd visit and It was another wonderful experience. The staff is friendly and very helpful without being overbearing. The owner I met was very personable and friendly. They always have many different flavors from sweet to savory to tart. My faves are the birthday cake, Vanilla and sugar free strawberry which is divine!! The prices are super affordable! The best part is they offer so many different toppings. They have at least 40 different options unlike most places I have been have a standard of 15-20. If you are in the area stop by, If you aren't in the area make plans to stop by!! You wont be disappointed.

6.description: Horrible service. Went in tonight (Saturday) at 7:15 pm, and all of the machines were empty. The two guys working were just standing there and talking while another family and I were struggling to get some yogurt out of the machine. Finally one of them went in the back to stir up one of the flavors, and still nothing. I have been to almost all of the other Forever Yogurt locations, and I have never had this problem. This by far is the worst location.

0.description: Great frozen yogurt shop in Bronzeville! Nice change of pace from all the greasy fast food spots. The shop was well lit, clean and customer service was great. They had a great variety of yogurt and topping selections. Yogurt was great! I hope this business strives in Bronzeville. Enjoyed the experience and will definitely come back.

4.description: I was so elated when I saw that a Forever frozen yogurt was coming to bronzeville. I went in on a Wednesday evening and the staff was so pleasant and knowledgable. I even got to meet the owners. They were so nice and down to earth! I was short like dollar so I went back to the car to get one, and she said to me when I returned "I would have gave you a dollar girl" I was in awe and very thankful! I will be patronizing them more often!

3.description: I followed my stylist, JoJo, to this salon and I love it! The salon is in the South Loop Hotel - so there's free parking and its not far from my West loop home. My stylist JOJO is AMAZING! Truly the best hair stylist I've ever been to! She's one of the nicest people I know, she is professional, punctual, and most importantly - she actually cares about my hair! Since I've been with her (since I left Toss hair salon), my hair has grown longer than it has ever been (as an adult). Once, I asked her to color my hair and she honestly and frankly told me that I shouldn't do it - my hair wasn't strong enough to handle the damage of color at that time. My old stylists would have just colored away regardless of the damage to my hair. JoJo is the best!! A selfish part of me wanted to keep her genius as secret as possible, but it wouldn't be fair to deprive others of the ability to leave the salon feeling absolutely beautiful. The salon also has a great aesthetician - Shaddah - I've been to her for a facial and a few times for waxing. She is very good, takes her time to make sure the job is right, and she is very professional. Also, the salon sets out products, jewelry, head wear, and purses for sale. These pieces are nice and pretty reasonably priced. I find myself buying something each time I go. The prices vary for the stylist. Some might think that JoJo is kind of pricey, but her rates are comparable to many other stylists in the downtown area, and (unlike the several other stylists I've been to) JoJo's is worth every penny! Shaddah's prices are comparable to other day spas in the city, but a bit cheaper than the ones downtown. All in all, great salon!!

1.description: Kimberly is awesome!!!! I love my hair!!!!! This was my first time here & I will be back!!

2.description: Karla Thomas!!!!!!!!!!!

5.description: LOVE Nan!! She's works with Natural and Relaxed Hair and if you've ever dreamed of going Perm-less, She works it out! I haven't had a perm in years thanks to Nan! .... the Salon is very nice (I had photos from Flickr but my assumption says that the publisher must have taken them down)  and I'd follow her anywhere, the prices are reasonable and she gets you in an out in an extremely short amount of time. You are not sitting there for hours. She's uses great products and her styles are TIMELESS!  She's extremely great about giving you styles that actually fit your face and hair type.  The Ambiance is nice/quiet and Serene. Love this part.  But the best is how fast she can get you in and out of the Salon looking and feeling great! They do offer Pedi's and Mani's so lets say full service Salon here. Great place I forgot to add. Nan also works on Sunday.. How fabulous is that ?? you can get your Tresses done from Early AM until Noon.. This is a Plus for those of us who can't make it during the week or have other plans during Fridays and Saturdays.

6.description: I absolutely ADORE Kim!!My hair is an odd mix of curly/wavy/straight and she's managed to tame it all without chemicals. Since growing my hair longer, it's been hard to find THE stylist for me. I actually stalked one of her clients in Target who happened to have amazing hair and finally got the info I needed. I booked my appointment online and was there the next day. I'm hooked.The salon's new locale is in the South Loop Hotel (first floor, rear of building) and the space is heavenly. I love a salon that's welcoming and Kim's salon offers up no pretentions.Everyone on her staff is amazing, as well.

7.description: I am so glad I found Nan again! I have natural hair and Nan always makes my hair look great and I get lots of compliments. I can also see the difference in my hair, my hair is much healthier. Nan is friendly and professional. You are not held hostage all day on a Saturday either! The salon is decorated nicely. The receptionist (I think her name is Gina) is very friendly. I would definately recommend Nan. I feel comfortable when I get in her chair that I will leave very satisfied.

8.description: Professional salon located in the Bronzeville area.  I enjoy coming here because I am not sitting in the salon for hours waiting to be serviced! Kim Coleman and staff are very professionl.  I  also get my pedicure and waxings done here as well. It's a one stop shop! Very clean and stylish salon. Always love my  hair and services when I visit.

9.description: Very chic and professional salon! Kimberly is extremely knowledgeable in healthy hair and specializes in hair care opposed to hair styles. I will certainly be returning! I was in and out of the salon within two hours. Kimberly did not trim more hair than was necessary and she even gave me some helpful advice for my date! ;)

0.description: For the best mani pedi in the city you must see Kim( the nail tech) You start with a hot ,sudsy soak progress to a gentle pedicure/trimming/sloughing, float to a parafin wax for hydration and end with the hottest colors available. Kim is a joy to know, punctual and always has my water waiting for me. Talk about service!For the best in hair services you must see Kim( the owner/stylist) She is so very professional, precise, friendly without being chatty or catty and fast. Did I mention that she is fast? She totally respects your time. I was out the door in 2 hours for a cut/style with 4 people ahead of me. Love it!! A lot coming from me: a former stylist who is extremely picky about who I allow to touch my hair. Seriously, this is a beautiful salon with friendly staff, wonderful products and a clean, zero drama atmosphere. Go soon!!

4.description: Kimberly Coleman Salon offers the best because they are the best!  All of your "got to get gorgeous" needs can be found in one place.  From head to toe, Hair, Mani/Pedi, Facials, Body Treatments - you will leave a more fantastic you! Kim Coleman has been MY hair stylist for 10 years.  I keep coming back because she is that GOOD.  She not only gives you a great finished look, but she makes sure you have healthy hair.  When you walk into KCS, your senses are transformed.  The soothing colors, the ambiance, the friendly and welcoming receptionist, the smiles from other customers and any member of the signature staff makes this an experience you won't forget!  I love KCS!  Try it and see for yourself.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

1.description: If I give negative stars I would. I've been shopping with Jewel for 10 years and have not had a complaint with customer service until this evening. I have been shopping at this location for a couple of years and the cashier Dyvette had the worst attitude I've ever experienced from anyone, anywhere. Where was she hired from? First of all, her disposition was less than welcoming. Instead of her asking how my day went she decided to ask me if I would be paying with a Link Card today. That is rude and unprofessional and I never had a Jewel cashier ask me that. She fed me some b.s line about it's a new policy when customers buy water because if you have a link card they take off the water tax. I'm sure she didn't ask not one white person buying water if they were paying with Link. I looked a little rough today but know that I spend at least $300 a month on groceries at Jewel and never not once used a link card and I buy water all the time. I'm pissed because she smirked it off as it meant nothing when I asked her when did this policy change. She murmured to another associate that ' let em know through the doe' I Don't know who she was talking about or what the hell she was talking about but she picked the wrong customer today. The lady assistant mangaer seemed appalled by my experience but the male manager who came over seemed to care less.Just in case your company thinks its ok to ask Black customers if they are using Link cards.... It's not. Do better.

9.description: Ok.., this  sucked anyway (dirty, subpar produce and meats) but now this new recyclable bag ordinance definitely brings this store to a zero star rating. I went to the store tonight to by items for a potluck tomorrow.  I checked out and then the cashier asks me "where are your bags?"  What?  Then I get a lecture that I have to bring my own bags if I want bags with handles.  Ok... I am walking to my building.  How do you expect me to carry four two-liter bottles of soda?  I politely left all of my groceries and plan to go to Walmart tomorrow where I can get plastic bags without a hassle!

23.description: There are not enough words in the English language to express just how terrible this place is. The only thing that saves it is the fact that there really isn't any close competition. The staff is slow and about everything BUT their job. The manager walks around like someone handed him a raw deal. He doesn't greet the customers and is slow to respond to problems. There are never enough lines open. The produce is seriously lacking. Awful.

12.description: I pretty much agree with a lot of what has been said.  The good:  The staff is very attentive and ready to assist while shopping, though sometimes too eager.  The bad:  The baggers are on the slow side, in both the task of bagging, and just moving from one spot to the next.  Ex. You're power-walking to make it somewhere quickly and a big blockade of a family exits a store onto the busy sidewalk you're walking on.  They then proceed to walk slowly in front of you in utter disregard and lack of consideration, so you then struggle to get past them but cannot and must bear it until the next cross street you encounter because they pretend not to understand you when you say excuse me...that feeling. Jewel is on the list of 12 worst grocery stores in the US of A for a reason, however.  Their prices are ridic, and they don't usually carry a lot of what I personally like.  At this particular location, although the store layout has undergone a pleasant remodeling, the butcher/food to-go/salad bar section still operates like a DMV utilizing the take a number system.  Is line-cutting really that big of an issue?  Speaking from the neighborhood citizen standpoint, this Jewel has come a long way and I am happy to see the advancements.  Sentimentally monumental

21.description: Others have mainly complained about staff problems, so I'll address those first.  In short, yes.  Their baggers are slow and some don't have common bagging sense.  It sometimes takes longer than necessary to solve problems.  And the lines can get crazy - but that's management's fault.  The employees are nice, especially the guys who do inventory.  They've always been really helpful and polite when I've asked them to check on something.Aside from Hyde Park Produce this is the closest grocery store to me that is half-decent (sorry, Treasure Island on 55th, but your customers are some of the rudest people I've ever encountered, and your prices and selection kinda suck).  Anyway, I've never had a problem with sale prices coming up at checkout, and sometimes their produce sales even beat Hyde Park Produce.  My main peeve about this Jewel is they don't always have the sale meat stocked up.  I'll go in for the cheap chicken and won't find it anywhere, not in their sale cooler or the regular poultry section.  I want to say this is management's fault again, but I don't know who handles the deliveries here.

16.description: This place makes me feel like I am in a movie with someone reviewing it on a DVD player in slow motion. I like how helpful they are but as soon as you get to the front of the store when you think your leaving and about to make it to wherever your going in a timely manner, forget it because you will be super later. I do not know if they train them slow so they feel they have to be slow or what, but it is very discouraging to get through with shopping as cumbersome as it can be and then its like trying to get through airport security, they either need to hire more cashiers, or teach the ones they have to put some pep in their step.

17.description: This Jewel is terrible, but extremely convenient for me to get to.Items frequently are not marked with the sales price, and so I always try to have a copy of the sales ad when I shop and watch the scanner in case I am over charged.I think all of the employees are generally nice and helpful, but every issue takes multiple people and lots of time to solve.

10.description: this is one of the worst Jewel-Osco I have ever shopped in.  They supposedly remodeled a few years ago and still didn't get new shopping carts.  I have been to Jewel stores all over Chicago and every one of them that were "remodeled" got new shopping carts and looked much better.  But, it is the only large grocery store between Roosevelt and 55th Street east of the Dan Ryan so we don't have much of a choice.  Can't wait til the Mariano's opens on Pershing and King Drive (if they ever break ground)

5.description: It's Jewel... what do you expect? This location is clean, and there are some good deals to be found. Some stuff is overpriced, but any store is like that. It's not too busy on Saturday morning.

11.description: The convenience of this place is great, but the quality is sub-par. Place just doesn't have the lust of other Jewels I've been to. The produce section is small and limited and it is not the freshest. The overall look of the place makes me want to shower when I get home. I recommend coming for items that dont need to be fresh... like cereal.

22.description: This is literally the crappiest Jewel I've ever been to.  The only reason I ever go back is that I work 4 blocks away and when I forget my lunch I'd rather buy groceries than Fast Food.  There are never enough check out lines open, and everyone moves incredibly slow.  It can take my entire lunch hour to get through this place.  There are usually at least 4 employees just standing around at the front of the store, nto bagging, or checking, or anything, just standing.

0.description: This is not my favorite grocery store but it is largest grocery store within 5 minutes so I do frequent this place a lot. It is somewhat run down, the produce is usually on the verge of rotting and it is almost always busy (unless you go before close or late Sunday). At least they have all the essentials. The prices are regular, service is regular and the products are regular. I am giving it 3 stars because it is still standing and provides me with emergency groceries. Also, they have a parking lot. I guess this earns them a star as well :)

19.description: Others have mainly complained about staff problems, so I'll address those first.  In short, yes.  Their baggers are slow and some don't have common bagging sense.  It sometimes takes longer than necessary to solve problems.  And the lines can get crazy - but that's management's fault.  The employees are nice, especially the guys who do inventory.  They've always been really helpful and polite when I've asked them to check on something.Aside from Hyde Park Produce this is the closest grocery store to me that is half-decent (sorry, Treasure Island on 55th, but your customers are some of the rudest people I've ever encountered, and your prices and selection kinda suck).  Anyway, I've never had a problem with sale prices coming up at checkout, and sometimes their produce sales even beat Hyde Park Produce.  My main peeve about this Jewel is they don't always have the sale meat stocked up.  I'll go in for the cheap chicken and won't find it anywhere, not in their sale cooler or the regular poultry section.  I want to say this is management's fault again, but I don't know who handles the deliveries here.

2.description: I loathe this Jewel-Osco location. Every time I have enter this store I have to look for a shopping cart or basket. The shopping carts are always filthy with trash in them. The shopping carts are right by the door which normally causes congestion by the door. There is a limited fresh organic produce available. I would go on a limb and say there are more bakery goods than produce available at this location. Sometimes you will find store employees roaming around that will offer help, most of the time they do not. Pretty much you may have to ask a fellow shopper for some assistance. I can never find a manager on the floor assisting the customers. By the way who is the store manager? Let's talk about the lengthy check out. I have never been in this location where the checkout lines were short. The customer service from the cashiers is subpar. On occasion you may have a store employee bagging your grocery's. The prices at this grocery store are a little bit on the pricey side. This location is convenient to members in the community which provides the necessary staples. If you would like a crazy chaotic flea market experience please be my guest. Although this Jewel-Osco location has made some massive changes, it is not enough. Which is exactly the reason why I gave this location 2 stars.

18.description: I had mixed feelings about this Jewel. In terms of selection and prices the store offers almost everything you could expect from a grocery store. That's great because it's the best full service store in the area. The downside was the check out process due to staff not being in a hurry to move people through, but they got automatic check outs in a recent store refresh!  If those are not your style and you are going for a quick trip use the check out at the camera / liquor desk.

13.description: The worst Jewel I've ever shopped in.  Just moved back to the Grand Boulevard area and needed groceries the day before Super Bowl and the day before the start of a huge snow storm.  Stopped by the deli for cold cuts, grilled chicken and chicken wings, unfortunately no chicken was prepared for sale' what was in the warmer looked hours old.  About 10-12 customers were just waiting while the three employees behind the counter were moving like they were in comas.  You would think the store would be prepared for Super Bowl party shoppers and shoppers trying to buy supplies before a big snow.  I finally gave up waiting and headed for the checkout.  There were about 4 checkout lines open in addition to the self help checkouts.  The terrible service and the high prices ensure I'll do my best to never step foot in this Jewel location again.

4.description: Stopped in just for a few things after leaving my relatives house....never again!  I worked for Jewel when I was a teenager and I would have been fired had I given the customer service I received today from this location.  Avoid this place at all costs!!!

24.description: This Jewel is terrible, but extremely convenient for me to get to.Items frequently are not marked with the sales price, and so I always try to have a copy of the sales ad when I shop and watch the scanner in case I am over charged.I think all of the employees are generally nice and helpful, but every issue takes multiple people and lots of time to solve.

6.description: My review of this grocery store is long overdue. I frequent this Jewel Osco at least once a week. Without exaggeration, almost 100% of the time the lines are long and you have to wait at least 20 minutes to check out. They NEVER have enough cashiers on duty!!  For the cost of the items, many of which are overpriced, the long lines and wait times are unacceptable. It is unfortunate that this is my local grocery store. They're building a Mariano's nearby, and once that opens up I will not to go to this Jewel again.

15.description: This Jewel is my closest neighborhood grocery store. While it may be a bit dated, they have ample selection, the lines typically aren't too long, and the service is always friendly.

7.description: OMG, this place is horrible. How Jewel allows their name to be associated w/ this place is beyond me. There is a dollar general in the southside that is classier than this place. Go once and then please call Jewel to complain. It has parking and it .6 miles closer than the Target on Roosevelt. I'm new to Chicago, so like an idiot I went. BIG mistake. The customers are so rude and violent that the staff is scared to ask them to obey basic rules, like getting in line and not yelling at the top of their lungs. There is never a manager when these classless people act up. Security is a person who wears an orange vest, not a person who does the job of a security person. They will watch these people behave this way and actually do nothing - except continue with their own personal conversation. The store acts like making it like other Jewels is a task on par with developing a country. I swear I could do a better job, but I'd rather be a physician than a Jewel Manager. I'm not going to complain about how dirty it is - I would never buy anything fresh from there anyway, so I didn't even look at the produce aisles. But it is on the way to the beach, Lake Shore dr. Running in for some paper towels or ice cream, beer on a holiday weekend is idiotic. Prices were great, but waiting in the express line behind an obese woman with 40 items, who was using these paper food vouchers took more than 10 minutes. The cashier said she was too afraid to tell the woman to get out of the express line and the woman got angry when she heard us discussing this. She told me it was none of my business, even though I never spoke to her, I just asked the cashier if this was an express line. This was my fifth visit, and the least abusive customer I have experienced. I cant post the other experiences because yelp will pull the review bc I cant do it in a PC way.I feel badly for that community. Its like Jewel doesn't think those people deserve any decent kind of store. I will just drive a little further and shop where the less scary customers are and where the poor staff is not afraid to do their jobs.

8.description: This is a small neighborhood grocer. It has been serving with Bronzeville community for many many years and serves a wonderful purpose! This is a very nice community grocer. Sometimes they run out of shopping carts, but it is a nice store!!!  This is my preferred Jewel grocer.

3.description: Worst Jewel grocery store ever. Unprofessional managers + unprofessional employees = horrible service. I will never shop here again. Shame on you Jewel Grocery, you aren't worthy of the one star I gave you.

14.description: Yelp why won't you let me give 0 stars horrible place check in isles are always long  there are only a couple aisles open usually ,foods are not where their supposed to be like candy was on the floor, workers are on their phone this place is dirty. This is the most embarrassing jewels I've ever been to.

3.description: Walked in for a quick bit of neckline cleanup and was taken care of promptly and professionally. My barber -- M. Abdul-Milik -- was efficient and friendly, and the place felt clean and accommodating. The fade was excellent and the price was right, plus they accept credit cards! Will be back.

1.description: This is the only place I'll go. It took me 2 years to find a barbershop that felt "right" after moving here from NYC. I traveled 40 minutes to go to Hyde Park Barber Studio based on a recommendation from a friend. Worth every minute. The service is attentive. The barbers are friendly. The decor is very nice and the cut was spectacular! I now live 90 minutes away and would rather go without a haircut than have anyone other than Daryl cut my hair!  Love you cats! See you soon!

2.description: This Shop is in SSChicago on 51st 1/2mi from the SSDrive. Its black owned, Muslims shop, in a friend of mine hood. So I wanted to leave downtown Chicago where I live and get a haircut in the hood and support black owned business. However, like the other black spot I found on Orleans & Oak Street, its a rip off, I paid $27usd for a hair cut and I did not come out looking like Shamar Moore! We I probably look better then Shamar anyway.CONCLUSION: I AM NEVER GOING BACK; I WILL NOT EVER MENTION THIS PLACE TO ANYONE NEEDING A HAIRCUT;  AND IT DESERVE "ZERO" STARS FOR BEING A RIPOFF AND CONSHOP.YOU GUYS MAKE MUSLIMS BUSINESS LOOK HORRIBLE! I Will Stay a Christian, Thank You Jesus and Praise GOD!IDIOTS!

5.description: Whenever I am in the HP, this is where I stop to get a cut. My HP barber Naseem does a great job on my head and I never leave out disappointed.I have been going off and on for two years and there has never been a dull moment. Last night I walked in and they were showing the Blogojevich impeachment coverage and it sparked great conversation as well as debates. Usually when  I walk in there is a big debate or discussion in progress. This is one of those shops where they know everyone's name and are always welcoming to newcomers. If you are ever in the area or just happened to move to HP, this is a great place to go. Also, this is the first barber shop that I have seen accept debit/credit cards.Disclaimer: Sorry, this is not the place Obama gets his haircut

6.description: Very Professional Barbers Excellent services!!!

7.description: This HP gem is professional, welcoming and attentive to their clients.  The barbers are long standing top notch pros, any of them could do live "stand-up" comedy to keep things lively.  I've tried other shops and know this is the place to go.

8.description: Mr. Leaks gave me a great haircut. I took a few pictures the day he cut my hair and I can't stop getting attention from it! atmosphere was great and Mr. Leaks is a down to earth cool guy that makes you forget you are getting a haircut while he is at his craft that he has mastered!

9.description: There are a lot of different places where I could get my haircut in hyde park.  I could do it in Reynold's Club, or 57th street salon, or University Barbershop, and the list goes on.  There are 2 reasons I go with Hyde Park Barber studio.1) its the closest barber shop next to my apartment.  Location is key, and I'm lazy2) unlike other places I've been in hyde park, there are always 4 or 5 guys there to cut your hair, so your wait is never very long.This is a barbershop, so their main focus is on the men, but every now and then I see a female stylist in there doing a lady's hair, so they also cater to the females.  What I love most about this place is that its classy: from the cool mirrors, to the hanging afro-inspired artwork, to the multiple flat-screen tv's playing ESPN, Hyde Park Barber Studio is head and shoulders (pun intended) above the rest in Hyde Park.  My only issue with this place (and every other place in Chicago) is how expensive it is to get your haircut!  Its not difficult to buzz-cut my hair, and I'm used to paying 5 dollars for that back home (if possible I wait for when I go back to Tx to get it cut), but if I'm going to be paying $19 for a 5 minute buzz around my hair, then Hyde Park Barber Studio is where I want to be paying it at.

0.description: Classic barbershop- very professional, nice decor and great atmosphere- the barbers joked, chatted and made you feel at home. ESPN on the two television screen- a great place to go for a man like me who is tired of all of the girly salons.ALSO- UofC students and faculty get a significant discount! Takes it from like $20 to $16. Great deal, great service and a good-looking haircut!

4.description: Terrible! They cut my hair evenly everywhere. I've never had a haircut this bad. I've also  never been to a barber before, but im never going back.

3.description: Considering there is a Subway 3 blocks down the road you would think that they would have better service with the competition but they didn't have coffee or spinich and when I asked for a little ranch sauce the server put more than usual on the sandwich. Disappointed for **

1.description: I ordered a sandwich and only requested the clerk to make my sandwich look like the advertised sandwich in the pictureHe played stupid refused to make the sandwich informing me that he can only put a few slices of meat on the sandwichThat's not advertised and I only requested what was advertised other than that it is false advertisement the sandwich he made should have cost under a $1The management person acted like he had no clue as to customer service I am quite disappointed

2.description: This subway was nice and clean I had to get a sandwich for my lunch. And the young lady fixed it just like I wonted it and cut it in half. She also took the time to ask me is that enough for everything that she put on the sandwich. This was my 1st time at this subway so as for me I'm happy with my service on this morning and will be going back again ..

0.description: Very nice staff,efficient and friendly. Subway is in a convenient location and parking right out front. This is also 24 hours! Problems are there is no seating and sometimes gets crowded.

1.description: Less expensive than Einstein's Bagel that used to take this spot previously. Create your own sandwich for only $4.59 - Woohoo! They have a good variety in the breads to choose from - bagels, croissants, baguette etc.

0.description: Quick and easy place to grab a sandwich or bagel for breakfast or lunch. Prices are retry reasonable too! I recommend their pizza sub on Italian bread.

56.description: I visited the new location; it's been open for two days. They are still decorating, but the new location has so much potential and the neighborhood feels safer. The food was very tasty also.  I ate the Yassa Shrimp with Djollof rice, cabbage and carrots.  I enjoyed it all; it was my first time experiencing Senegalese cuisine. The owners and other occupants were warm and friendly; I felt as though I was among family. Lastly, its BYOB!!  I look forward to going again.

29.description: You feel like family here. Midiieye (the owner) and his wife Awe greet everyone with such genuine joy, it is impossible not to be happy here. The food is Senegalese and has a wonderful array of spices that are nicely balanced but not too hot (unless you request it). The lamb is a hit. Try the baobab juice. The portions are very generous. Come in, enjoy the energy and get stuffed on great African food!

42.description: Love this place. Me and my fiance are the in here all the time. We never have a dull plate. Try the nem it is the best. The wait staff is great and always friendly. The best place to eat Senegelese food on the southside.

23.description: Yassa is authentic and reasonably priced and very tasty!!!! - With a nice variety of dishes.  The service and staff are very friendly and it's great see a different cuisine being offered on the south side of Chicago.

47.description: Welcome to the neighborhood Yassa! Munchies will be missed, yet this is a nice replacement. The food is delicious and there are great options for fans of spicy food and not so spicy. The juices are a nice twist with unique options you can try out ahead of time. Most dishes are meat based but there are some good veg options. The decor reminds me of places I've been in Africa while traveling and living which is a trip down memory lane. The owners and staff are quite friendly and it's a welcoming place. Plus it's BYOB! There's a Walgreens close by and liquor store down the street in case you forget ahead of time. There is free parking in the back. Enter through the alley on 35th, park in the lot, and walk through the the building to get to Yassa.

8.description: I had a really great Sunday lunch here with two other friends, and this was their introduction to West African/Senegalese food so I was excited to bring them here- we all left really full (with boxed leftovers) and pleased with our food. If you have never had West African or Senegalese before, you should definitely check this place out!In undergrad I studied abroad in Senegal and now once in a while, I would really want some fried plantains, Yassa chicken and jollof rice. This place was spot on and they had kind, attentive service. So I was glad I stumbled upon this place during one of my Yelp searches.When our server first came I said a Wolof greeting, "Nnanga def?" Like, how's it going? The response is: "Maangi fi" = "I am here" and there was another greeting/exchange about peace. I was getting nostalgic about those sweltering hot days in Dakar (the capital), and the server told me he is actually from Togo, but had studied at the Cheikh Anta Diop in Dakar. Cool.Two of us ordered the Yassa Chicken [$12.00/order] (I got a half:half side of white rice and jollof rice. My friend got a side of half:half jollof rice and plantains). My friend's boyfriend got the Yassa Lamb [$14.00] which was tender and delicious and also had the half:half jollof rice and white rice sides.I also ordered a Bissap drink (which is a hibiscus drink, tangy and sweet at the same time, served cold). For the Yassa Chicken, it was a huge portion (1/2 chicken) with those amazing stir-fried mustard-y/caramelized minced onions and your sides. For the Yassa Lamb, you get a large portion of tender, marinated meat. My friends loved the strong/spiced flavors of the meat, the rice, the sweetness of the plantains. They loved the variety of tastes from a single dish that you can get in one bite.Since we all did the half:half sides, each side was an additional 50 cents. I'd have to say, the plantains and the jollof rice was the best combination of sides. The plantains were served piping hot, and next time I'd get an additional side of this on its own. If you dine here, be sure to also ask for a side of spicy chili sauce - it gives everything a nice fiery kick.Come here for big portions of Senegalese food and you won't be disappointed! The chicken was charred and a little dry, but nothing that took away from the flavor. Next time I'd get the Yassa Lamb or try the House Tiebu Djeun, which is whole tilapia with cabbage, carrot and yucca, served over jollof rice - I had Tiebu Djeun almost daily when I was with my host family in Dakar.  Their lunch menu is definitely well-priced based on the heaping amount of food that you get. Whether it's your first time eating Senegalese food or you're nostalgically craving it, Yassa African won't let you down.

31.description: The food was delicious and the serving size is decent. I ordered the Thiou Curry with chicken. The owners were very patient with our party of 50. I enjoyed experiencing Senegalese food for the first time.

34.description: Excellent food and generous portions! The Yassa lamb and chicken were especially tasty as was the plantain. Give it a try.

16.description: My original introduction to this place was seeing some friends eat it in my face as they got the grub from the African Festival 2014 in Washington Park...Yassa happened to be a vendor. I then went and got some very good chicken dish that was amazing (I don't say that often). I was in my old stomping ground of Bronzeville recently and decided it would be good to stop by the actual location finally. I walked in before the after work dinner crowd made it in so there were only a few tables occupied as the TV ran the local news. Jackie was my server and was very helpful with helping me choose the perfect dish. I decided on the Maffe which is cubes of lamb cooked in creamy peanut butter and tomato sauce with potatoes, yams and carrots; served over white rice. I also got a side of carrots and cabbage. This dish was amazing as the lamb with the sauce was out of this world! There was so much sauce left over I ate it by the spoonful...couldnt help myself or let it go to waste. I can actually say I did the damn thang on that meal! A patron at another table said he was wondering when my eyes would roll to the back of my head and he saw the moment it happened. He even told me other dishes I should try when I return. Yes, there will be multiple returns!

13.description: Searched all over for cassava leaf for my boyfriend who lived in Sierra Leone for peace corps and we finally found it here! He said he really enjoyed it- I thought it tasted pretty delicious even though I had no idea what it was supposed to taste like. I had the snapper, it was pretty pricey considering, but was very delicious and they do have other kinds of fish for cheaper options. I also highly recommend either the sorrel or ginger drink.

39.description: I came for lunch special and was waiting 30 minutes for food which is a typical African restaurant  experience. All of that aside food was delicious. I had dibi chicken. Grilled to perfection. Jollof rice was delish. Beautifully decorated restaurant and clean environment.

0.description: The Yassa fish, the Yassa fish, my goodness the Yassa fish! I got the red snapper which was wonderfully seasoned and prepared to perfection --crispy skin on the outside and moist and flaky on the inside! The djollof rice, plantain, and salmon patties were great accompaniments.With service this great and food this tasty -- I'll be back soon!

38.description: I love the food at this restaurant. The grilled fish and lamb are my favorites. The food is perfectly seasoned and not dry. The service is a little on the slow side, especially if you pre-order. I wish they offered smaller portions like tapas in the future. A whole fish is a little too much for one person to eat. Whatever you order plan on having leftovers.

51.description: Excellent! The food was delicious and the ginger juice was TASTY!! I live close to this location and I am excited they are near. The service was great but a tad bit slow. It wasn't that busy so I hope that when they are slammed (as I'm sure they will be) there will be more workers.I will be back!!

27.description: Mmmmm... Dinner with friends and Yassa fish!  You definitely have to appreciate the spice found in African food. Pairing the fish with sweet plantains and succulent cabbage can only create the perfect meal!  The managers are very friendly and check to make sure you are happy! Definitely worth it!  Plus, reasonable prices!

32.description: Our waiter was a bit rude, otherwise this would be 5 stars. The food was amazing. I had dibi lamb and my lil one had the grilled fish. The jolof rice was great and the lamb was grilled and seasoned to perfection. The portions were big enough to share and save for lunch the next day. My 9 year old loved the fish, though her eyes were bigger than her stomach.

54.description: The entire experience was amazing considering they were only open less than a week in the new location.Food - I had the Yassa Whole Fish dinner with rice. My friend had the Yassa lamb. We shared a plate of cabbage. Everything was well seasoned and large portions - enough for leftovers to take home.Drink - The owner let us try each of the popular juices before choosing. All were amazing but we both settled on the Bissap and it did not disappoint.Service - Great. Very hospitable, explained everything. Overall a great meal for a great price. Will be back.

48.description: What a great addition to our Bronzeville neighborhood! We had dinner last Sunday and really enjoyed our meals! We started with the battered salmon patties; I had the Yassa chicken with djaloff rice and plantain and my BF had the Sauce Grain. Both meals had amazing flavor and they are not overly spicy which sometimes takes away from the herbs and flavor (in my opinion). The portions are large especially given the reasonable prices. The space even has some beautiful artwork on display that is also available for sale. The owner came over to speak to us and was very friendly. He allowed us to sample his delicious ginger drink, which he claims is very popular and available for sale by the gallon.We will definitely be back, Yassa.

44.description: I absolutely LOVE the family and customer service at Yassa.  Sunday was my third visit at the Bronzeville location.  We had dinner with 30 of our friends from church.  They were extremely accommodating and gracious!  The food was spectacular!  PLEASE add them to one of your "must try" list!

24.description: If I rated Yassa after the first time I went, I would easily give it 5 stars. The food is amazing and service was great. I went back again and the food was excellent but service was garbage. Try to get the young woman as a server because she knows what she is doing. The two young men are clowns. They didnt know what they were doing and they were very unprofessional. They took about 20 minutes to simply take our order. The order wasn't written down so he forgot a part of it. One person was served much later than the others. The only time the guys were quick was when it came to getting the bill. We paid but before we could leave a tip, the guy took the envelope with didn't have any sort of tip. But I guess that is what happens when service is just miserable. I would totally go back for the food but I stay away from the two stooges.

7.description: Came here on a Sunday around 4pm and wasn't packed at all but got kinda busy as time went on. We Ordered the salmon patty which was great but I don't like onions so I had to pass (onions were inside the patty). I ordered the chopped chicken with jollof rice. Friend ordered the fish with plantains. Food seemed like it took forever to get to us but I guess they made everything from stretch. The jollof rice was great. Tasted like nigerian jollof to me so I didn't see a difference. The chicken was to fatty for my liking but that's just me. They had an onion bases "sauce" on the side which was surprising good due to the fact that I hate onions. Food was good overall but I'm nigerian so I have a bias for my own food being better. Decent price and good for groups I would say. Just wish they had a way to keep the cold from getting in or at least had some type of heater. I want to give this place 3 stars but my date really loved the food. Service was okay. A little bit lacking

49.description: I am so glad to welcome Yassa to my neighborhood to share a piece of African American history.  Entering the restaurant is like walking into big mamas kitchen on Sunday.  Everybody on the staff greets you, even other patrons looked up to wave during their meal lol.  I've tried the Yassa fish which is outstanding. I had that with the djolof rice which tastes identical to an African american soul food dish that we simply call "red rice".  Then, me and my husband ordered fataya and its real good too. I can't wait to go try everything else.

40.description: Great vibe great food and great customer service ! Also what a beautiful view of the city from the corner of king drive I love historic bronzeville

53.description: Love this place! The food and service are always the best. The new location on 35th & King Drive makes it even better. A little piece of Senegal is just what Bronzeville needs.

30.description: "Well it was ok." That's my response whenever someone asks me about my food from Yassa. My boyfriend and I decided to try them out last Saturday and me being me I said cool. Walked in, sat right down because the place was half full. It's a family friendly restaurant where the servers were very friendly and responsive. We never had to ask for more water( that's being attentive and ice cold by the way) and the restaurant was very clean. He ordered the Yassa fish...Tilapia fillet with djolof  rice. I ordered the brochette chicken with cabbage. My chicken was perfectly cooked and seasoned. My cabbage needed more salt or herbs but it was cooked well. I didn't eat the onion relish they serve with it because I don't like olives. His fish dish was very well seasoned and tasty but the fish seemed dry. Kinda like frozen fish fillets which are always a no no. His fish had a vegetable mixture on top of the rice which was good but the same olive onion relish that my dish came with too. Oh we also ordered the Fataya patties which were salmon, spices, onion and tomato paste stuffed in a sweet pastry dough and fried. It was ok. I'm willing to try Yassa again because the lamb looked amazing. Everyone raves about the Yassa fish which I can't do because of the fish head. Try them out and see what you think.

46.description: This is hands down, thee BEST restaurant I've eaten at in Chicago! They're like Family to my sister & me! We love the atmosphere!

1.description: Searched Yelp for a (preferably) local (definitely) healthy (ish) African Restaurant to dine at for dinner,- post Dr. Martin Luther King Jr celebration event at the DuSable Museum of African American History in Chicago.  Overwhelmingly decided on this little gem (I envisioned).- called ahead to ensure they were open (due to the holiday), and that Vegan / Vegetarian fare was available, as it appeared in the online menu.  7 min away, but plus 14 min to find parking, and actually get into the restaurant due to the locked shut front door - later we arrived.  60 min of waiting for our (rather simple) food later, .. with the home made ginger and exotic fruit mouth watering special drinks totally forgotten -- our food arrived. Wow, it was tremendous.- I mean magnificent.  Vegan sampler plate (in my featured pic - the center is some sort of cabbage, not meat), .. and hot spicy red sauce shrimp dish w salad later -- I was so wowed by the taste.Side note : As an Integrative Nutritionista, who is also an environmentalist and an animal advocate - I have recently merged from a many year Pescatarian / Vegetarian to Vegan.  The second plate of food, for whom I was dining with, did include shrimp.  I inquired about whether it was Wild Caught, .. or Farm Raised.  The sweet gentleman preferred to defer to the sweet woman,- who had no idea.  So, likely farm raised everything.  Fyi.- for people who may know or feel enough to care.Bless these sweetheart people.- who accidentally put my dine-in order as a take out, so I ended waiting over an hour.  And forgot my drinks (but had it on my tab, despite me sweetly mentioning to remember I never received them, I didn't want them to-go, and to please remember to not charge), and negated to check on me for hot water refill or more napkins (although happily brought when I stopped them to ask).I typically never get poor service.- but this wasn't actually poor (the personality / disposition of the man and woman who may possibly have been the owners (?) - was nice enough and polite).- just super - um forgetful.?.  And not due to the place being busy or anything. - kinda strange.And I even more so don't typically talk / write / review about poor experiences.  But the food was so so good, and delicious, - and I loved to be able to eat African (Senegalese) while remaining Vegan -- I feel a Yelp Review is warranted.  Wish I could do another half star to make a 3.5 out of 5.Good luck.And enjoy.

55.description: I went here with my girlfriend this past weekend. I am grateful I did. The new location is perfect. Free parking! What more can you ask for? On to the food. I had the yassa shrimp with plantains and jollof rice and my girl had the Yassa fish. Let me just say, my shrimp, for real, it was so good. I was so full. And, I had two more meals of it left over! For real y'all, I had shrimp for breakfast and for lunch the next day. I felt like I got buy 1 meal get 2 free! Furthermore, it was just as good as it was at the restaurant. My girl kept digging in my plate. I highly recommend you check this place out. If you are hesitant on trying new things, don't worry. They will guide you in the right direction. The best part is that at the end of the meal, I still had money in my pocket. So, stop reading. Just go!

9.description: Super friendly service~ we got free samples of all the drinks of their own volition! The ginger drink was POTENT, the hibiscus one was predictably flowery sweet, the baobab one tasted... healthy? But the best by far was the pineapple melon. While selecting an eponymous item is usually a good idea, I would say the best item on the menu was the curry. :) We had a decent sized group and everyone tried something different, which was cool~ the plantains were also good! There were two desserts on the menu, one of which was caramel cake. We did not try the caramel cake, but we did try the other one... and I wouldn't again. As Sarah S. put it, "This tastes like sweetened creme fraiche soaked grape nuts." So unless that's your jam...

26.description: Incredibly good food, and awesome service! My mouth is still watering whenever I think of the Yassa chicken and djaloff rice. The owner was incredibly personable, and I will definitely be coming back soon!

25.description: We loved our chicken on skewers and grilled tilapia with djolof rice and plantains. Great place to practice your French, too! Very warm staff.

12.description: "Well it was ok." That's my response whenever someone asks me about my food from Yassa. My boyfriend and I decided to try them out last Saturday and me being me I said cool. Walked in, sat right down because the place was half full. It's a family friendly restaurant where the servers were very friendly and responsive. We never had to ask for more water( that's being attentive and ice cold by the way) and the restaurant was very clean. He ordered the Yassa fish...Tilapia fillet with djolof  rice. I ordered the brochette chicken with cabbage. My chicken was perfectly cooked and seasoned. My cabbage needed more salt or herbs but it was cooked well.
