Kinda like frozen fish fillets which are always a no no. His fish had a vegetable mixture on top of the rice which was good but the same olive onion relish that my dish came with too. Oh we also ordered the Fataya patties which were salmon, spices, onion and tomato paste stuffed in a sweet pastry dough and fried. It was ok. I'm willing to try Yassa again because the lamb looked amazing. Everyone raves about the Yassa fish which I can't do because of the fish head. Try them out and see what you think.

21.description: Hands down, Yassa is everything! The food is made with love and you can tell--plus, it's amazing! Order 30-45 minutes in advance (they're slow), but simply because it's made to order. It's also byob, so if you want to dine in, grab a bottle on your way in. Tip: If you're not a fan of bones-in fish, ask for it filleted. I've had the chicken, lamb and fish, always w/ jollof rice w/ a side of cabbage and plantains. Just thank me later...

17.description: Honest to God the best food Ive had in a LONG time. I got the djulof rice with fish. WOO! So much flavour and their portions are generous. The people I were with had the chicken and the shrimp and said both were phenomenal as well. Theyre super nice too. Most definitely coming back.

10.description: After numerous reviews for Yassa over the years from Check-Please to The Reader, I finally had a chance to come here.  We organized a dinner for a birthday with 15 people ( all of whom arrived at various times!)  The service was very friendly and accommodating.   Being with a large group, I had an opportunity to try a taste of numerous menu offerings.  Many things are cooked to order, while others are braised stews which must be cooked in advance to tenderize the protein.  Like other Yelpers mentioned, it might take a minute to get your food.  For those who are new to African cuisine, be ready for some different flavor combinations .  And yes, some of the meat dishes and the whole fish have bones. (Anybody know of a whole fish that ain't got bones?)  So don't be hating Senegalese cuisine cause some of the dishes area served with meat on the bones!  Just use your knife to cut it off, OK?  And in the case of a whole fish, I bet both your moms and your granny would let you use your fingers to get some of the little morsels of flesh from between the bones! I ordered the whole grilled red snapper with djolof rice.  My fish was a little overcooked, but 3 other folks in our group ordered it, and theirs were tender and flaky. The rice was really delicious, as were the plantains and yucca that I tasted ( off other people's plates).  They were out of dibi lamb, so I gangstered a taste of one of my friend's Maffe. (Delicious stew of lamb cooked in a peanut sauce.)  Yassa is a "ma & pops" kind of place.  It gave off the same kind of vibe I experienced while traveling in Cote d'Ivoire, Ghana, & Nigeria. Nothing fancy.  Just good home cooking.  It's a keeper. Oh yeh....it's a BYO.

5.description: Mush have: yassa lamb with djolof rice.  Big cut of lamb accompanied by a sauce of raisins, onions, and olives. Spicy and tart and savory and sweet in one bite.  Djolof rice are a must have- tasty, but i think flavored with red palm oil (and pretty oily).The food here was very tasty, and good value for the dollar ($14 entree and I brought home leftovers enough for next day lunch.)But the SERVICE! Our party of 6 was one of two occupied tables and it took us two hours to get through dinner.  I think the server had pity on us, because he came over with drink samples (if you get a drink, go with the honeydew pineapple). The entrees also came out at different times, so the first person's entree had been sitting for 10 minutes before everyone at the table got their food.  Made for an awkward birthday dinner. The server didn't write down any of our orders, and my entree came with the incorrect side.Do not recommend the thiakry. This dessert has the taste of a sweetened creme fraiche, but the steamed millet inside was a strange textural element for me- it reminded me of grape nuts in a good vanilla yogurt. (caveat- I don't have an experience palate for African dessert dishes.)Bottom line- with the experience to try a Senegalese food and support a Bronzeville institution, but not a great dining experience overall.

3.description: Good was nice. Disappointed with the fact that is ordered lamb and got chicken instead. But the friendly customer service made up for that..they were very greatly apologetic.

35.description: I've had my share of horrible service from restaurants but this place far exceeded what I thought bad service was like.DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS PLACE. My roommates and I ordered a couple of dishes over the phone and they told us that the delivery fee would be $10 dollars. We had ordered from them before so we told them that last time we ordered, it was about $4. They wanted to negotiate to $8 and we told them no, it was $4. (It's $4 on grubhub). That should have been the point when we stopped trying to order. IT ONLY GOT WORSE from then.We were told our food would be at our place in 30 minutes. Great. Reasonable time. An hour passed. No food. We called and they told us that the driver left 30 minutes ago. My roommates and I live 10 blocks away from this place. IT DOES NOT TAKE 30 MINUTES BY CAR. Okay so we waited again for 30 minutes. NO FOOD. We called again. The guy on the phone doesn't know where our driver is. WE HAD TO WAIT 2 HOURS FOR OUR FOOD. That was ridiculous. Especially when we were told we would only have to wait 30 minutes. The main frustration was that whenever we called to check, THEY KEPT LYING TO US. They kept saying that the delivery guy had left or just left. And we just had to keep waiting. We ordered our food at 6:30pm and got it at 9pm. Oh but it was about to get worse.When we opened our food, we realized that our orders were not complete. The rice that was supposed to be with all four of our orders wasn't there. The missing rice was not a big deal but granted that we had to wait so long for our food to arrive and discovering that our orders were incomplete, we were pretty angry at this point. We called them again and when we inquired for the rice, they told us that there was no rice with the dishes. We told them that the online menu said it would be included and we've gotten rice with our dish last time we ordered (not too long ago). They told us that the menu was a decade year old.  We told them that it's not our fault they haven't updated the menu and they told us that they will deliver the rice for us. WE WAITED FOR 2 HOURS AGAIN and guess what? NO RICE! They never showed up. My roommates and I finished an entire movie while waiting (and we probably could have watched another movie while waiting for our food).So. We are never ordering from this place again. DO NOT EXPECT GOOD SERVICE. Also they will try to RIP YOU OFF with the delivery fee. They also lie to you and tell you that the driver has left and then later saying the driver has just left again. Oh, at one point they told us that the driver was right by our place and we called and canceled the order so the driver turned right back around. THAT WAS A BLATANT LIE. We never canceled anything. So yeah. IF YOU WANT TO WAIT 4 HOURS FOR YOUR FOOD, go ahead. But I've warned you.

19.description: Illinois Tech employees take heart. There's finally a delicious family-run and -owned, homey restaurant within walking distance of campus.  In a neighborhood full of the same-ole chain restaurants, Yassa is a very welcome addition. The host/co-owner Madieye Gueye and his staff make you feel like you're one of the family.  I didn't get to meet Chef Gueye this time, but I felt like I did after eating her  amazing food. I had the Yassa tilapia and my friend had the Yassa chicken. I kind of assumed that both dishes would taste the same--you know, kind of like when you get a red or a green at a Thai restaurant?  Doesn't really matter if you pick tofu, pork, shrimp or chicken...they all pretty much taste like the green or red curry they're served in.Well, I was pleasantly surprised to find the fried fish had a deliciously distinct taste that was very different from that of the chicken, which was grilled.  Perfectly spiced.  The djolof rice and the cabbage and carrots side dishes were perfect accompaniments. I sampled my friend's Ginger juice.  Yum.  I've never been to Africa, but like Ben G., dining at Yassa was a trip down memory lane for me too.  I felt like I was right back in any one of the many delicious family-run restaurants where I've had the fortune of eating a home-cooked meal while traveling in Peru or Mexico.  Tip -- if you're going for lunch and you only have an hour, call in your order so they can get it started because it takes time to prepare food this delicious!!

28.description: We had a fantastic time at Yassa!!  Everyone was extremely welcoming and the food was outstanding!  I had the Lamb Maffe and it was out of very savory: cubes of meat in a strange (...or strange to me) peanut/tomato cream sauce.  It has some starchy vegetables -- similar to a Thai mussaman curry, but not exactly.   For an appetizer, we had Fataya.  The highlight of the dinner, however, was visiting with the owner who came over and chatted with us.  We learned a great deal about how the food was prepared and he shared with us information about the health benefits of the Bouye Baobab juice, which I highly recommend.

45.description: Illinois Tech employees take heart. There's finally a delicious family-run and -owned, homey restaurant within walking distance of campus.  In a neighborhood full of the same-ole chain restaurants, Yassa is a very welcome addition. The host/co-owner Madieye Gueye and his staff make you feel like you're one of the family.  I didn't get to meet Chef Gueye this time, but I felt like I did after eating her  amazing food. I had the Yassa tilapia and my friend had the Yassa chicken. I kind of assumed that both dishes would taste the same--you know, kind of like when you get a red or a green at a Thai restaurant?  Doesn't really matter if you pick tofu, pork, shrimp or chicken...they all pretty much taste like the green or red curry they're served in.Well, I was pleasantly surprised to find the fried fish had a deliciously distinct taste that was very different from that of the chicken, which was grilled.  Perfectly spiced.  The djolof rice and the cabbage and carrots side dishes were perfect accompaniments. I sampled my friend's Ginger juice.  Yum.  I've never been to Africa, but like Ben G., dining at Yassa was a trip down memory lane for me too.  I felt like I was right back in any one of the many delicious family-run restaurants where I've had the fortune of eating a home-cooked meal while traveling in Peru or Mexico.  Tip -- if you're going for lunch and you only have an hour, call in your order so they can get it started because it takes time to prepare food this delicious!!

33.description: I  just totally LOOOVE the new location.I had already visited their previous spot on the southeast side.Food is still fantastic.One of my top picks for African cuisine in Chicago.This new location is so much nicer and way more accessible to me.Means I'll have the opportunity to dine here more often since I go hang out at the lakefront so often.Service is really good.Always has been.They really did a great job with the decor.I just love it.Im so glad they relocated.Hopefully I can convince friends and family to try West African/Senegalese cuisine and point them here.Im sure they'll become fans as well!!! I will return!!!

43.description: Just ate here. This place is family-owned; the nephew was our server and the chef was the aunt. We got samples of the sorrel, ginger, and baobab. The fataya was savory and sweet with a hint of spice.  Had the Yassa snapper. OMG it was delicious! I had leftovers only because I wanted to have the experience again. I will be back.

2.description: I'm hoping future visits work out better because, not only is this place a quick walk from my house, it does have a lot going for it. They're friendly, however the service is a little slow, prices are good and portions aren't bad. A bit heavy on the carbs and the meat on the lighter side. Speaking of meat, their online menu has beef brochette on it, but the menu we got didn't have it on there. One of the great things about the internet is being able to look at menus and decide ahead of time, so I had it planned out before I walked in the door, this is what I want! I did opt for the chicken, and will say maybe they were slow because they were cooking the moisture out of the bird, good but chewy. The combination of spices on everything else wasoutstanding. We'll definitely go back, and I hope to be adding stars.

18.description: First time.Service is okay but slow so order ahead of arrival. They take FOR-EVA to cook your order. Food? Abso-f**kin-lutely delish!!' Lawd it was good. Atmosphere? Good. Bottom line. Go. And fast!!

41.description: Great food....friendly customer service...warm atmosphere....glad it's in nearby Bronzeville now!!!!

52.description: Always a pleasure to visit this place with my family. My wife and I love the taste of the food. Can't stop thinking about my *dibi lamb* with cooked onions, fataya and dibi chicken...hmm tasty. Highly recommend!!! You won't be disappointed. Enjoy

50.description: Wow, this food was absolutely delicious. I got Tiebu Djeun - whole fish over jollof rice. I was in heaven. Can't wait to go back here.

4.description: I ordered the Red Snapper/cabbage and salmon patties.   OMG, IT WAS WORTH the wait.

6.description: Good sauces but such overcooked meat! Our favorite by far was the maffa (peanut butter stew with lamb), with sides of djolof rice and plantains. We also had the yassa chicken and the curry lamb. The curry lamb came with a steak knife and we still struggled to cut it. The chicken was cooked similar to tandoori chicken but I still found it on the dry side. All meats are bone-in and have large chunks of fat on the lamb, which made it difficult to share. As other reviews have said, the wait time for the food is quite long even if you're the only person in the restaurant. I would consider returning for the maffa, but sort of doubt I'll actually wind up making a return trip.

22.description: DELICIOUS!  The food was freshly cooked and soooo good, as well as very generous servings.  The fiah,and Joloff Rice was so tasty. Will be back, next trip to Chicago

15.description: I  just totally LOOOVE the new location.I had already visited their previous spot on the southeast side.Food is still fantastic.One of my top picks for African cuisine in Chicago.This new location is so much nicer and way more accessible to me.Means I'll have the opportunity to dine here more often since I go hang out at the lakefront so often.Service is really good.Always has been.They really did a great job with the decor.I just love it.Im so glad they relocated.Hopefully I can convince friends and family to try West African/Senegalese cuisine and point them here.Im sure they'll become fans as well!!! I will return!!!

20.description: Tried their food at the African Festival in Washington Park. It was my first time eating African Food. I opted for the Grilled Lamp Chops, white rice, and this red onion side that I have no clue the name of. The kind women serving the food were very generous with the portions. I was not disappointed! The lamb was cooked perfectly and the rice and onion dish was so tasty together. The flavors were on point and I couldn't stop eating even after I was full LOL. I was so greatful to have tried this food and I will take a trip to the resturant when I return to Chicago.

36.description: The food here was horrible. I am Nigerian so I was excited to see this restaurant come to Bronzeville but I am no pleased with the food. The jolif rice was hard and undercooked, the lamb was horrible. I also tried their stew and that was not pleasing either. I will not return nor will I recommend this place to a friend or family member.

14.description: Today is a full house. Only 1 table left. Good aromas fill my nostrils as I walked in and was seated. Nice staff, super friendly, and busy. The window seats are filled with one birthday party group,  and the long tables pushed together near the back hold the second birthday party of 7. A baby's first birthday being celebrated by her parents and their friends. 8 other groups fill the tables, plus my table. The staff is bringing orders as fast as they can, and everyone is happy, smiling, and eating good food. This is a BYOB restaurant. Yet the main thing I see being poured is the house juices, Ginger, and the purple color Bissop herb. Both are excellent drinks, made fresh on site daily, and they are good.Today I ordered the Lamb dinner.Charbroiled,  tender, seasoned just right. With veggies and rice, and a big glass of fresh Ginger juice.Man it's gonna take me some time to eat all this food. I might have to get a take out tray, AGAIN. I just love how I am never disappointed with what ever I order. I really cannot eat all that is on my plate. I need a takeout tray. I started writing after I sat down and had placed my order. Now I have been eating and I am stuffed. My order arrived quickly, was correct, and delicious, and PLENTIFUL.I need to go home now and take a nap.I am done. Bring on the game.Oh thats tomorrow,  but I will probably still be full from this meal.

0.description: Nice place. So far I've got my hair lined up a few times. Now I'm bringing my son. Its always somewhere to park and you can relax and look at a movie playing and buy your self a snack until it's your turn. Its clean and no hair all over the floor the washroom is very nice and clean. And if you need a Mani & pedi the nail technician can take care of that

1.description: The absolute WORST mani-pedi I have EVER had!  THE WORST!  First, the nail tech was very nice.  But the service was so incredibly awful.  When I was told to bring my own flip flops when making the appt, I should have known how low-level the service would be.  The "spa-pedicure" was soaking my feel in a Dr. Scholl's foot bath (yes, like the one you buy for your grandmother at Wal-Mart!).  The she pulled my feet in HER LAP to cut my nails, pumice my feet, and give me a foot massage.  I wanted to just walk out so many times but I always thought it would get better.  It only continued to get worse.  Then the limited selection of polish on both the toenails and fingernails was thick and actually had bubbles!  And no fan to dry them.  Just too terrible to even include all of the terrible details.  I paid for two through lifebooker not knowing how bad it would be.  I can't go back nor can I give this to someone.  I guess I'm just out of $25 but gladly so if I don't have to go back there!  PLEASE DON'T EVEN CONSIDER GOING HERE!

0.description: I bought a groupon for a mani-pedi at Hair Haven since it is in the neighborhood. However, I have called three times and have yet to make an appointment. Every time I call, they tell me that they will have to check if the nail tech has availability and will call me back. However, they still haven't. I even tried to book an appointment for the following week & was still told I would receive a call and never did. If I didn't already pay for the service, I would take my business elsewhere. I hope if I do go in the service is better than they're scheduling issues.

3.description: I don't shop at places with glass windows between customer and order taker. Can barely hear the staff.

1.description: Went to get a pot pie yesterday and noticed the cashiers were using a block(c.c swiper) on a cell phone to swipe customers credit cards. My question "Why are you using this" was  ignored..but because I really wanted that pot pie badly I walked across the street to chase atm and got cash. No ma'am you will not be swiping my card on a personal phone..Thanks but No Thanks...

2.description: Very unprofessional staff. I walked in for lunch a few days ago when it was slow. They were using foul language and kept calling each other "niggers." Service was slow. The chicken was so greasy, it actually didn't taste very good. The biscuit was stale.   And when I got home with my food, I didn't get the sides I asked for, but rather something different. But I had a taste for it because last time I tried to go in there, they wanted to swipe my card on one of those credit card readers on a cell phone. Not happening. There was a gadget on the counter to swipe my card but they said not to use it because it didn't work. I didn't have cash on me so I left. This time I brought cash. I'm thinking the next time I want chicken I'll either go next door to Popeye's or a different KFC location.

5.description: That restaurant is a great place.

0.description: Tasty, fresh and right on time chicken. Its my first time in here, usually im going to another restaurant but this one is on my way. Recognisable taste and atmosphere, smiling staff. Thanks for making my day.

4.description: I picked up food here for lunch the other day and was pleasantly surprised. I really don't like KFC, but it was close drive thru to work and I was in a hurry. I ordered a 5 piece spicey meal with cole slaw. The chicken was great! I usually hate their flavoring, but this was really good. The cole slaw was also excellent. My friend got the chicken bowl and she said it was really good as well. For cheap and easy, this place fits the bill.

3.description: LT is great with the kids!! He takes time and talks and laughs with them. His hair cutting skills are the best I've ever experienced for my boys!! I give 2 thumbs up!! The salon is centrally located and prices are reasonable!!

1.description: Best place to get a lopsided line up. If it's straight, make sure you remind them to get the back of your head. They seem to forget

2.description: Dropped in from San Francisco. Asked if anyone was free to give me a haircut. Eddie stepped up and said he got me. Lined me up, gave me a bald fade, razored me up and even a shave. His work was on point. I highly recommend this guy to cut anyone up. Very happy with his work

0.description: Amazing barbershop highlighted by Andre who provides high quality appointment only device that is the best in the city. Every picture you see is from his clientele, don't pay the rest when my barber is the best. Just don't try to take my appointment time on Fridays morning haha.

1.description: This is not a family-friendly location. There's ALWAYS a crowd of undesirables hanging outside, and even inside. The police are always circling around, sometimes 2-3 police cars at once. I also witnessed an older gentleman pick up who I believe to have been a prostitute. He pulled up shortly after I did. I sat in the car for a while handling business on the phone. He stayed in his car. After a while, a young man exited with a woman dressed "differently" and watched her walk over to his car. They drove away together. I decided it was time to go...

9.description: I ordered the Premium Crispy Chicken Club Sandwich however, when I arrived home to eat my meal it was not the Premium Crispy Chicken Club Sandwich. There was no bacon or cheese , they put way to much mayo on the sandwich. The sandwich did not look eatable, it actually looked disgusting.  The fries were cold and thrown in the bag. I'm shocked they would send something of the sort out to a customer.  I usually do not eat fast food however I will not be visiting this location ever again.

23.description: The people are mostly nice at this location, but the service is the slowest I have ever seen at a Golden Arches. The drive thru is always packed, but that has less to do with them being busy than it taking forever to get your food. When you do finally get your food it is the usual McDonald's fare, so no issues there. They are also often out of ice cream, which is a drag on a hot summer day when that's all you crave. They also cut down the trees on their property that were on the 35th side which made the place look uglier.

5.description: The reason I gave this McDonald's 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the young lady that was behind the counter.She had great customer service skills and although there were a lot of people in line she seemed to have a system and got the line down pretty quickly!I was also charged 2.99 for a sausage egg McMuffin that was listed at 2.79 and I was given my difference back even though they said the sandwich was suppose to be 2.99.I would have went back to that McDonald's if I wasn't at a volunteering event for seniors that day so I had no choice but to choke down my hard crisp eggs, burnt muffin and dried out sausage.I don't understand where Quality Control is going for many of these fast food restaurants, its like because we have a value menu or a dollar menu we don't have to serve food that is fresh and hot!Even if I was in the area unless I was just getting a coffee I wouldn't go back to this McDonald's!Just so sad!

25.description: I hate this McDonald's.  It's always sooooooo crowded, the drive-thru is a mess, and they always fill the glass 3/4 full, with no ice!  it also feels like the prices are higher than other Mickey D's.  I dunno...maybe not?I only stop here when in a pinch after a ball game when I'm starving, and tired of ball park food.

12.description: Was solicited by panhandler four times while waiting to pay cashier for food after placing order. Person stood uncomfortably close when I pulled out money to pay for meal. Cashier observed this happening and said nothing, nor did the manager. I watched this person ask everyone in line for money. Was also solicited as I entered the restaurant - also from inside the restaurant. The clerk did not get the order correct - required a revisit to the line. The crew seemed indifferent and very untrained. The place was also not very clean. McDonald's corporate should investigate this place - it gives McDonald's a bad name. I would avoid this McDonalds.

21.description: Let me say this. I have never had a bad experience at a Mcdonalds before. But this Mcdonalds is the worst. I walked in during a slow time and it was horrible. I said good morning to the girl at the register and got a confused and almost upset look. As I start to order she tells me to hold on and decided to take care of another person and forgot about me. They all have attitudes and seems miserable. I would be happy having a job and there they seem bothered. They swore at each other and acted vulgar. Do not come here.

16.description: This place is a mess! If I could give it zero stars I would. Every time I go in there I have to wait in line - morning, mid-day, lunch, night....doesn't matter. The floors are always filthy and there usually is a weird and funky smell. However, its close to work, and sometimes I get desperate. Two weeks ago I went through the drive through with a co-worker for iced coffees. We ordered and paid and when we pulled up to the last window we were informed there was no ice. At that point they also did not understand why we did not want our coffees.A week later I waited in line forever for an icecream. Only to be told they have no shakes or icecream.I am not even a big McDonalds person, but I would think ice, shakes and icecream would be things they could manage to not screw up. Guess not.

17.description: I hate this McDonald's.  It's always sooooooo crowded, the drive-thru is a mess, and they always fill the glass 3/4 full, with no ice!  it also feels like the prices are higher than other Mickey D's.  I dunno...maybe not?I only stop here when in a pinch after a ball game when I'm starving, and tired of ball park food.

10.description: Good coffee.TERRIBLE AWFUL, RUDE STAFF.I was given a roll of pennies as change because the girl was too busy visiting with her friends to try to get other coins in exchange for my dollar bill.

11.description: This Mcdonald I rarely go to. Food is dry, service is slow. I got the oatmeal and sausage buscuit and they both were not good and dry  This the type of place you forget to ask for jelly, butter or ketup because you're trying to hurry and get out of there. Its too crowded too many people hang in there like peddlers, drunks and crack heads. Dont ever lose anything like a wallet or phone bc its long gone in a matter of seconds.

26.description: This McDonalds' gets 3 stars for being open all night. Sometimes i just have a craving for chicknuggets or I just need to grab some double cheeseburgers at 3am and Maxwell St Depot Polish isn't what I'm craving. So Kudos for being the closest open 24 hour McDs to me.However, if you do come, take notice of the giant CPD HQ building that is just a few blocks west of this place. IF ANYTHING was to go down, hurry to this refuge of safety.This following rant is not on this specific location but on McDs in general. What the hell is a friggin' McDouble and why is it replacing the double cheeseburger for 99c? A McDouble is a fancy way of saying "we jacked yo cheeze, foo!" It is a double cheeseburger with only 1 slice of cheese. 1 tiny slice of cheese is not enough to satisfy my cheeseburger craving!!!! I guess I'm too poor to be more than a Dolla Menunaire cuz I can no longer afford a double cheeseburger at $1.29 and I can only get the 99c McDouble.

22.description: This place is a mess! If I could give it zero stars I would. Every time I go in there I have to wait in line - morning, mid-day, lunch, night....doesn't matter. The floors are always filthy and there usually is a weird and funky smell. However, its close to work, and sometimes I get desperate. Two weeks ago I went through the drive through with a co-worker for iced coffees. We ordered and paid and when we pulled up to the last window we were informed there was no ice. At that point they also did not understand why we did not want our coffees.A week later I waited in line forever for an icecream. Only to be told they have no shakes or icecream.I am not even a big McDonalds person, but I would think ice, shakes and icecream would be things they could manage to not screw up. Guess not.

0.description: Unfortunately this McDonald's is conveniently located in my neighborhood. I have ordered from this establishment several times. Therefore I think I am justified in doing this review. Yesterday like any other trip to this fast food chain I placed an order through the drive-thru. I ordered a South-west salad with medium fry. Naturally your suppose to receive salad dressing of your choosing. Well that of course did not work out for me. Instead of receiving ranch dressing I end up with  french dressing. The salad did not have all of the ingredients evenly distributed. I had the beans and corn on one side and tortilla strips on the other. My grilled chicken was not properly cut. Now I am going to dig into the lack of customer service. The cashier/food preparer usually have no personality when accepting orders. On top of that the car in front of me had some issues with their order after pulling off. The customer randomly parked their car and walked back to the window where I was waiting to pay for my order. I had to move my car because the guy was unable to squeeze through to the window. Once we caught the cashier attention he addressed his issue. The cashier did not redirect the previous customer back to his car. He told the customer "one minute", them left him standing in the cold weather. On any given day I will have any number of issues with this location primarily the service. You can't always blame the employees, management has something to do with the service. Finally, I do not venture inside this establishment EVER! There is usually an armed security guard present and for good reasons. The last time I went inside I notice an ambulance outside with lights flashing. After several inquires I found out the guard sprayed an individual while they were in the bathroom. Please do not ask me what happened I left right after the explanation.Can somebody tell me when a Panera or Chipotle will be moving into the area?

20.description: Avoid this place!  It's just not worth it.  I live a few blocks away but I will no longer be tempted to go here for a french-fry fix.  The place smells like sewer, the workers are clueless and rude, and the food tastes off.  Last time I went here I ordered and stood at the counter, off to the side waiting for my simple McDouble and fries.  I waited a long time and watched about 10 people behind me get their food before me.  Yes, they had forgotten my simple order even though I was standing right there.  Everyone decided it was someone else's problem.  While waiting I had time to fully appreciate the workers' incompetence as customer after customer would ask for a certain type of soda and be informed that they were out.  What did they have? No one seemed to know.  Go to the McDonalds north on MLK until this neighborhood cleans itself up.

19.description: It really needs ZERO stars! Terrible customer service! Terrible Cooks! And Ghetto ass Managers! Need I Say more?!

2.description: I've had no problems with the service, my problem is the shady characters that hang around. The hate for this place is probably because of that. I'm gonna give it 3 stars because of the service I've received especially from the manager himself, but some of the people who come in to sell stuff and hang around yelling to one another are more than annoying.

18.description: Worst service ever avoid this place.

13.description: I've read the reviews, so I know that this place has been less than popular over the years. However, I think they've made some improvements. I've never been inside, but the drive-thru is always quick and accurate. The service has been friendly and attentive on all of my visits as well.

4.description: The service is kind of slow here. And I don't like the shady people that hang out in the dining area and outside the restaurant. And every once in a while they have that old "The ice cream/shake machine is broke." Sometimes with these Black neighborhoods I think they just don't feel like making shakes or ice cream.

24.description: I'm not a huge fan of McDonalds in general, but I do eat at a McDonalds about once a month or so.  This McDonalds is one of the worst that I've been to.  The service inside was very slow.  The manager, who was helping run the cash register with another employee, kept allowing other people to jump in line and then looked at the rest of us with this look of..."You don't mind, do you?"  We decided to go through drive through instead hoping for faster service.  We got to the speaker and the employee asks "What do you want?"  Not a "How can I help you" or anything semi-customer service oriented.  We decided to order anyway because my daughter was really excited for some fries.  Otherwise we would have left at this point.  We placed our order and then pulled up to pay.  She told us one amount and then ended up giving me change for another amount.  However, I didn't happen to check it until I had pulled up to the next window.  We pulled up to get our order at the 2nd window and the employee asked us what we had ordered.  Not just an item or two so she could make sure we were the next order, but she wanted to know everything we had ordered.  I'm not sure why there was an issue in relaying the information from the 1st window to the 2nd (especially with computers).  The 2nd window employee was nice and even wished us a good day.  The order was right and the fries were hot.  Upon looking at the receipt, the cashier did give me the correct change she just said the wrong amount.  When it comes to ordering, it really bothers me when you walk into a restaurant that has their breakfast menu up even though they say they are not serving breakfast anymore.  Inside the breakfast menu was up, but they told others they were not serving it anymore.  In the drive thru, we asked (just in case because I really wanted a sausage biscuit) but they said again they weren't serving breakfast.  The biggest problem with this was that because the breakfast menus were up the lunch menus were not and you would have had to know exactly what you wanted to get.  We ended up getting the basics: fries, hamburger, drink.  (I don't have the number meals memorized, and I swear they are different at each McDonalds.)Overall the service was slow and the employees were rude.  It was not busy during our visit.  It was 11am right before the lunch rush.  I would avoid this McDonalds if you can.

6.description: I won't be critical because it was only a Mcdonalds but it wasn't in a very good neighborhood, and I especially know that because I used to live there (Bronzeville). The people didn't seem so smart either and they were also pretty lazy. But my real problem was the service. It was horrible, the person who gave us our food ate half of our fries right in front of us!  And later, me and my dad called that Mcdonalds and found out that it was the manager who was eating our food.    I'll never go back!

15.description: This McDonald's is one of the most disgusting I've ever been to. I don't know why I keep going back through the drive-thru (I guess deep down I want it to get better), but I keep getting disappointed. I got a McRib a few days ago and that made my decision to never return to this location. The bread tasted old and the meat had a vile aftertaste. Dis-gus-ting!!!!

7.description: NEVER, EVER GO HERE.I went here around 11pm, desperate for Dinner Two, and I was willing to look past the stares I got driving up to this place by the people who loitered outside. Shady as fuhhhhhhh. But hey, it's Chicago, I don't mind. But this was my experience.Girl over the speaker: Can I help you?Me: YEP I need one McDouble, one McChicken, and one large Diet Coke.Girl over the speaker: ..................*60 seconds pass*Me; So uh, did you get my order?Girl: Yeah, a double, a chicken, and a coke.Me: A DIET coke.Girl: Yeah, pull around.Sigh. I pull around. I get my food, I get my drink, I pull out quickly without checking anything. Because at this point I feared for my life, having sat there for 5 minutes while being stared down in the dark of night, so to me any food/drink was fine. Well, so I thought. Let's review my order, item by item.McChicken - the top and bottom of the bun, somehow, had gotten completely stuck to the wrapper.  So I was left with a ripped bun resembling white bread on my sandwich. I dunno how this happens to a bun, but it was steamed or microwaved when it was too wet, so it stuck to the wrapper.McDouble - this bun, somehow, was hard as a hockey puck. Keep in mind the McChicken and McDouble use identical buns, so once again, I don't even know how this happened. The beef also didn't taste right, but that's splitting hairs considering the next one.Diet Coke - Ah, you're thinking, okay, she didn't give you a diet Coke, she gave you a regular coke. And you're right! But the icing on the cake is that my Coke tasted like it had an extra ingredient. An extra ingredient made by the good people at Bacardi. I can't say it was rum for sure, but I've had plenty of drinks in my day, and there was something very odd in my Coke, and it wasn't just the corn syrup.SO YEAH, NEVER GO HERE EVER

8.description: By far the worst McDonalds I have ever been to. Since I live close by I wanted to give them a chance but no more. The service is extremely slow and the last time we went, my son had hairs on his burger. Disgusting. Do not go here. You will only regret it.

3.description: I don't eat McDonalds often but when I do I expect that my food is fresh, hot and accurate. The soda was literally colored water and they didn't give me the sauce I requested with my nuggets. I got no sauce at all. It's a real inconvenience having to drive back and head into the store just to complain. Moreover it costs you more in gas as well as time. I'd rather part ways and give my business to the number of other establishments in the area.

14.description: This McDonald's is improving because they changed management and how they have people who actually work. It's a shame they had to get a Hispanic crew to change this place!!!!!

1.description: Worst flower shop ever!!!!!!!!!!! Flowers were never received and no one answer the phone call!!!!!!!!

0.description: Ordered a corsage here, the price is very reasonable.I left with a small bouquet of tropical flowers for myself too.Needs better signage, it is embedded down a hallway of a hotel. Basically, best in area and the only place to get a florist experience around here.

3.description: First of All, I love Chinese food. Who doesn't?The food is excellent.  They give you mounds of food for a great price. You can get a lot of tasty good Chinese food without emptying your wallet. Mongolian beef is my favorite.Everything is made fresh. The focus is flavor. This place satisfies the Chinese food craving that you might have. The place itself is super tiny.  Don't expect the place or the service to get super fancy. But if you are looking for good Chinese food you can find it here.

1.description: DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS ESTABLISHMENT.  Residents of the Bronzeville community, and several elected officials of the community who are making efforts to get acquainted with business owners, and improve community relations were told by Hong Kong Delight staff "We do not want or need your business. We don't want anything to do with YOU PEOPLE. " I would not trust eating at a restaurant where the owners don't want anything to do with the residents or the elected officials of the community. I plan to encourage ALL residents to boycott this location. I gave a one star rating,  because it I didn't have a choice to give a no star rating.

2.description: The worse customer service in the history of customer service. The man had the nerve to say "you people" to my elderly mother. It's 2015. We're still saying "you people "?  This place will never receive my "you people" money. Customer service in Chicago is suspect enough, but this place was horrible. NO STARS!!! NEGATIVE STARS IF I COULD! !!

5.description: I love the bbq pork fried rice and crab cheese rangoon.

6.description: Please don't ever ever come here!!!  The service is horrible!!!  The way they talk to people I can't believe anyone ever even spends money here!!!  Basically Chinese is Chinese spend your cash somewhere else please!!!   Also to say that the place is filthy is a understatement, the floors and walls disgusting!

7.description: Good food for the price, combo meals & lunch specials are worth it.

8.description: On Saturday, Feb. 5Th 2011, I decide to try Hong Kong Delight Chinese take out on 35Th st which is close to my home. I normally would travel to the Canal St location where the food is always good  . But, I opted for this location because they deliver to my Zip code.  Now lets get to the review. The food was Horrible I ordered Shrimp fried rice, Shrimp Egg-Foo Young and Chinese style chicken wings. The rice had no flavor, the Egg Foo Young was OK, the chicken was dried out and burnt. I will NEVER patronize this place again. I think the one star was too many. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY :-(      p.s. The Delivery man was Nice.

9.description: This is a great American style Chinese take out place (have to say that with Chinatown so close by). The quality of the food is good and the prices are very reasonable. The only bad thing I can say is that they amazingly do not have chopsticks!

0.description: This was a great deal!  I had the combo meal with Mongolian chicken, fried rice, an egg roll (I actually got 2, but I don't know if that was them being nice to me, or that was what it came with), and a can of pop and it was only $6.35.  (You can choose your 3 sides).  I also had 2 big Crab rangon for an extra $1.50.  It was not a very healthy dinner and leftover lunch, but it was tasty and lots of food!This place is mostly carryout.  They have a couple of tables, but I think that's just to sit while you wait.Right after I ordered, the guy cooked my food right in front of me.  I appreciate this a lot, because I can see how clean everything is!I don't know why it's taken me so long to go here before.  But I'm not sure it's good for my figure that I have found a good cheap Chinese place so close to me.

4.description: I used to frequent this restaurant a lot only because it was the only Chinese restaurant near my home. The food was decent however the owner is extremely rude and ignorant. He has an attitude all of the time. Not only have I personally been treated badly on several occasions but I have seen him treat others terribly. The only reason we continued to go there is because the man that used to regularly work there was very nice and always tried to apologize for his bosses horrible behavior. Then when he started working at the other location the owner started working at this location everyday. I have came to the restaurant during regular business hours on several occasions and he was not even open. He said "he opens when he wants to". Really? What kind of professionalism is that? The final straw was when I ordered some crab rangoon and 2 lunch specials and he gave me 2 sweet and sour sauces. And that was after I waited for him to open the restaurant late! When I went back to ask for more sweet and sour sauce he began arguing with me stating that he gave me more than that and told me to get out! Now mind you he knows I spend a lot of money there and I am a regular customer. I have NEVER met a business owner as unprofessional and rude as this man. I am surprised he stays in business. I guess because there are no other Chinese restaurants around as an alternative. Hmm, business idea! Seriously, do not go here!

3.description: I have been seeing the loctician, Kerry, for about 4 weeks now.  I am easily able to make my appointments online and have never had an issue. The Salon is clean and has a very relaxing atmosphere.  I have never had a long wait -in, worked on . and out.  AND I get lots of complements on my babylocs...lol.

1.description: Where do I start? By shaking my head.....I scheduled an appoinment via style seat with 'NicolbyBriana' for today. Unfortunately I can't give a review of my hair because I never got my hair done. 2 hours before my scheduled appoinment at 11am she asks to reschedule for 4pm. *Please note that her policy on style seat puts the burden on the client that if you cancel or reschedule less than 24 hours notice you will be charged 50-100%.Okay....but what if the stylist cancels for reschedules at the last minute?I was on my way to Chicago from 2 hours away, so to text me at that short notice is a problem. It shows a lack of professionalism that unfortunate is prevalent in this industry for African Americans.She tells me in her last message that she is not in Chicago , but ATL.WHA???? I took as reel shot of her profile on style seat that clearly states she is at Anu Salon in Chicago. This was really sad.The worst part......Not ONE apology was sent......no offer of accommodations or anything. Please can our businesses learn to adopt better customer service relations, but also learn that professionalism goes a long way with becoming successful? From her profile it seems as though she is  very talented. Unfortunately her customer service and professional etiquette don't' match--at least not for me.Too bad,

2.description: I have been a client of Lalitha for almost 10 years! She is a very talented and gifted stylist. I joke with her and call her a hair surgeon. I currently live in Houston, TX but I do not trust anyone except Lalitha to take care of my hair so I am often back in town for an appointment. She is skilled to take care of a variety of different hair types. When I hear ANYONE mention a need for a stylist I always recommend Lalitha. But if I ever get established enough to cover her full time salary, I will be stealing her from you all! Lol! So book now while you can!

5.description: I came to this salon for an ombre hair coloring from hairstylist Roxanne Dunigan. I waited an hour and half to be seen and when I was finally waited on Roxanne's assistant while she talked on the phone. Once my color was done, it was not what I asked for.....it was done incorrectly. My color is not ombre style, its a simple color. So once Roxanne blew out my hair....I let them know the color was done wrong. Roxanne immediately got an attitude with me and I asked for my hair to be curled, she curled my hair in little tight curls like Shirley Temple.....which i clearly didn't ask for. So I tell Roxanne I don't like the style so she starts raising her voice at me saying "What you want me to do?" Clearly she didn't want to do my hair in the first place. She agreed to curl me hair over once I told her I was not satisfied, which was a rush job because she was upset with me not liking the style. So then she starts talking about me while i'm there to her assistant and friend that was just hanging in the salon. I asked to speak to manager for her unprofessionalism and she starts cursing me out saying I'm on some bullshit and instead calling her manager she's calls the police on me as if i was the irate customer when it was her the whole time yelling and cursing at me.

6.description: Sharon (salon owner) has been my stylist for close to 7 years and I love her. Not only can she style hair, but my hair is healthy! She has been responsive to any questions I have and truly knows how to cater to her clients. If you want a cut, that will have people stopping you in the street to ask who does your hair... visit Sharon!

7.description: Went based on a referral from a friend because I have short nappy hair.  I called the stylist a few days before and she said she could not talk to me but I could make an appointment online.  I reviewed their website which states they blow out natural hair which is what I wanted.  After sitting in the shop for 30 minutes, the stylist came over looked at my hair and said "I don;t blow out short hair".  You say you handle natural hair but you can't do short nappy hair?!?!??!  I think she was about three people behind and just did not want to spend the time working on my hair and I was a first time customer.  What a waste of time and another reason why I don;t like going to beauty salons for services.

0.description: Lalitha (Lala) is an amaing stylist. She offers $225 sew ins (i always make it $240 with the tip) and she can blow out natural hair like no other! She is extremely professional and has never cancelled an appointment. I have been going to her for 6 years now! She does not overbook her clients so you will be in and out. I typically go during the week and in the mornings. There is free street parking available. The salon is clean and relaxing. There are 3 levels and they offer other services such as waxing and nails. You can reach Lala at (773) 540-1772!

4.description: I visited A'nu Salon for the first time last month.  I was seen by stylist Getaun (not sure if I spelled that correctly) and she was fabulous! The salon is in a townhome style building so the setting is comfortable & cute, like you're in someone's home. I usually dread going to salon's because it seems you never get seen at your actual appt. time, but I was greeted promptly and attended to even as she finished with the previous client.  I told her the look I was going for and she executed it perfectly.  Getaun was friendly and professional and I will definitely be going back!

29.description: I love this place!! The pizza is amazing... it gets a little hectic when it's busy but the food is great and the staff is pretty cool... only thing I didn't like was when I ordered Texas toast I paid like $5 and it was only two slices. But other than that, great food, great service!! : )

42.description: Great GREAT food, but the customer service, mainly the guy who answered the phone on Friday, 5 November @ 15:30'ish was incompetent.

23.description: Stopped in the other day and ordered 2 slices of the "deep dish" sausage & pepperoni.  Although they call it deep dish, it's more like the middle weight pizza sold at Connie's.  Deep dish usually means a lot of cheese.  This has the same amount of cheese you'd expect on a thin crust pizza, but the crust is thicker.  Kinda doughy, but not bad by any means. $5 for 2 slices, I'm not complaining.  They have a few tables and chairs, but I'd suggest taking your food to-go because it's not a big place. Service is fast and the cashier is polite.  Customer service is a big plus, especially in the hood.

8.description: I like eating here. The pizza slices are always fresh because the business is booming so chances are if there arent slices out its because someone just took the last; youll be getting it right out the oven. Prices are reasonable and customer service is normal. I eat here on my lunch breaks occasionally. I would recommend to others.

31.description: I love this place!  Great dough.  Gooey deep dish.

34.description: Inexpensive, sold by the slice ($2.50 for pepperoni).  Nothing special, but decent if you'd like a quick lunch.

16.description: Food took a while for delivery but its Saturday night and snowy out so that was expected. I'm really sad about the fact that the pizza was horrible though. I've been fighting with my boyfriend about trying out this place and how we should give it a chance. Now...I hate admitting that he was right! We just wasted $30. We ordered the deep dish and its not cooked all the way thru! Crust is still doughy. It's inedible. Garlic bread is cold and hard. Salad was fine. I don't think I'll order from here again.

13.description: I can't comment on the speed of their service because I only ever order pizza they have in the display. But their pizza really does hit the spot and it's definitely filling--though admittedly really greasy and salty. haha, a guilty pleasure. The place always looks a little crumby, unfortunately. But maybe that's part of their charm?

11.description: Would not recommend. Food quality is not great (think frozen heat-up style), it takes forever to be served (if you don't call ahead, consider going somewhere else), and the chicken wings have feathers still attached to the meat. Gross. Not to mention most menu items are overpriced, probably due to the vicinity of Sox park.

39.description: Great pizza at an even greater price. The staff is awesome and really friendly, which makes this place even better. The interior is a little small and bland, but eh.

37.description: This place is so unexpectedly wonderful! First of all, I don't eat animal products because I am vegan. Every day, I go to Jimmy Johns and pay $7 for what is essentially lettuce, mustard and bread, and get questionable customer service from college kids who really could care less about me or my order. The weather turned cold, and I wanted to eat something hot, even if it was only french fries, so I walked over to Miller Pizza Company. Not only was the owner and the rest of the staff extremely conversational and friendly (which is rare in these parts...), but when I told them I was vegan, they offered to create me a vegan Philly sandwich. I didn't ask, they offered. I can't tell you how rare this is. The sandwich is stuffed with mushrooms, spinach, onions and jalapenos, and comes with fries and a drink...and it costs me two dollars less than Jimmy John's paltry sandwich, which does NOT come with anything! The owners are great guys. Stop in and see what it's all about; I can't say enough good things about them.

0.description: We live in their building and love their by the slice pizza, it's a good medium between deep dish and normal crust. It's 2.49 a slice which is pretty reasonable. The crust is nice and thick and they seem to have slices available almost all the time. However, if they don't have any, it could be a long wait...Can't comment on delivery and anything else as all I ever get is a slice of pizza and possibly a drink. They also don't have a bathroom so you'll have to go to Starbucks next door.

38.description: This place knows customer service. Not to mention the great food they have. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to try good pizza comparable to giordanos and ginos.

27.description: Had fam in town and needed something tasty to win them over on chicago eats. Millers' did it! Now the customer service might be less than disearable, the girl who answered could give me no info on the pizza except the inches. I asked how many a family size would feed... get a cheat sheet. It was fresh  and HOTn and ontime. Great seasoning and best of all it was PIPING HOT! Pizza shouldn't be served any othr way! Great Job! We will be back!

32.description: Well, I chose them for the Groupon Deal! The pizza was delicious! The customer service was warm & friendly! Due to an issue with the use of Groupon, I had to "wait" a little bit longer but it was a pleasant wait. The owner (?) and manager were very apologetic, but a free soda would have made the wait a little more settling! I would definitely go again!

44.description: Miller Pizza Company was a much needed addition to the Bronzeville area. It's nice to see it being revitalized by new business.  I didn't expect to love the pizza, but I did! This place definitely has some of the best pizza crust that I have ever had. It's fluffy but crispy and well seasoned on the outside. The fried raviolis were recommended to me and they were really good as well. It's not the type of place that foodies are gonna go crazy over: there's no fusion, there's no hype from a famous chef, there's nothing trendy about it. It's just really good pizza and a great place to go if you need a fix.

24.description: Went into the restaurant to pick up dinner.  The service was very slow; the man at the cashier told me my order would take about 8 minutes to make but actually took 18 mins.  Went I went to the counter to pick  up my order after patiently waiting, the man at the cash register SCOULDED me for "making faces".

7.description: Pizza is very good but their service is pretty awful. A few times going in they didn't have any pizza ready at opening. Another time they couldn't get the pilot light on the oven, grill, etc working. I once talked to  a guy who said  he was waiting for over a half hour for a sandwich, people working there seemed like they could care less. Like I said, good pizza but bad service.

40.description: This is a great addition to the Bronzeville area and a good spot to hit up before a White Sox game.  The owners know what they are doing by setting up shop next to a University (IIT), within sight of US Cellular, and in a growing neighborhood.  I can only speak to the pizza but it is excellent and one of my favorites in Chicago.  The crust is excellent and the cheese and sauce has a nice flavor to it. Their basic pizza is fairly doughy, but definitely not to the point of overwhelming the sauce and cheese.  It's got a fresh taste, wholesome flavor, and gives a unique spin on an old staple.There are a few tables to eat on location, but it's more of a take out and delivery type of place.  The staff are generally friendly and helpful but sometimes they are disorganized and slow.

30.description: We've only ordered the thin crust and it is delicious (my friends insist on ordering it during gatherings ie. Bears/Sox games). We've always had fast delivery with no problems and great product quality. I've rarely had better pizza, however, it is somewhat expensive for the quantity. The cost doesn't merit a star deduction though - it's that good.

1.description: The service is not only bad (as other say below) but dishonest. I ordered two pizzas online, but when I got to the store they were closed (sign said there were electrical issues). No problem, these kinds of things happen. But when I called a few days later to get my credit card refunded for the charge, I got the complete runaround. I got a number of excuses whenever I called: either the manager was busy (but when I would call back hours later he was still busy) or they would just put me on hold and never pick up. One time, I asked to speak to the manager and the guy on the line told me there was no manager for the shift. I finally enlisted my credit card company to help me get this resolved. When I called back minutes later with my credit card company on the line, the guy said HE was the manager and it turns out that he had lied to me earlier because he didn't want to deal with my problem. My credit card company helped me get the refund. But, it shouldn't have gotten to that point. This business is clearly not interested in taking care of customers and if you run into a problem, do not expect it be handled honestly.

9.description: I love coming here for their pizza by the slice. Their pizza slices are $2.49 per slice. Great deal. They're cheaper than Reggio's Pizza as far as pizza by the slice. I especially love the pepperoni slices and the cheese slices.

26.description: How in the H-E-L-L does this place have so many 4 & 5 star reviews?? Seriously, people?? Based on (the obviously) untrustworthy reviews I decided to give Miller Pizza Co. a try. BIG mistake!! First, let me mention the positive stuff. The interior of the restaurant is cute. It's clean, modern and cozy. The staff seemed friendly enough even if they were too busy talking to each other to initially acknowledge me. The restaurant was completely empty so I kinda felt like there was no excuse for that behavior.Anyway, the lack of customers should've been my cue to go elsewhere. The pizza was gross. I'd like to say it tasted like store bought oven pizza but that'd be an insult to Tostino's or Mama Celeste!!!  I'd take pizza from either of them any day before eating from Miller Pizza Co. again.The pizza tasted like burnt cardboard with chunks of tomatoes thrown on top. It was hot & fresh but that made absolutely no difference because it was nasty. I don't think that I've ever had pizza that taste so bad. I might go back and order something that isn't pizza but I will NEVER, EVER order pizza from this place again. If you're smart you won't either.

25.description: Miller's is pretty great. I love their mozzarella sticks.  Their pizza is usually really good as well when its thoroughly cooked. There's been one or two times the crust seemed a little doughy, but otherwise thus place is really good.  The people who work here are very nice fun to talk to while you wait for your food.

12.description: i ordered a chicken salad and paid almost 7 dollars for it. after she gave me the receipt she said it would take 12 minutes. I thought to myself, "hmmmm that would have been nice to know before i bought it but its fine... i'll wait." i waited 30 minutes for a chicken salad. oh and they didn't have any forks so i had to see if anyone had one at my job when i went back to work.i sit at my desk, open the container and guess what the chicken breast i waited 30 minutes for was not on my salad. never again NEVER again will i go there. i dont care how good their pizza is and really though the pizza is okay at best... the crust is thick and dry... ugh.

21.description: Clearly the people here have a lot of love for the local business and I do too.  But we've got to be honest.  They have some OK pizza with some OK service.  They are trying to get it together and I love them for it!  I will keep ordering the pizza when I'm hungry and haven't planned otherwise.  But Chicago is KNOWN for it's pizza and this is just a cool spot when you are hungry and in the area.

17.description: The pizza slices are good but a little expensive for that location. Don't skip this just based off the name because they carry a variety of food stuff and not just pizzas. I personally love their Philly Chicken. The downside is the service/food preparation can sometimes be slow so make sure you call in ahead of time if you are doing a pick-up. Also during peak hours there is not enough room or tables to sit down and eat so you might have to resort to just doing a pick-up. Come down and say Hi to their friendly staff if you are down there for a Sox game, at IIT or in the Bronzeville/Bridgeport area.

10.description: I was attending a conference at the Illinois Institute of Technology, which is only a short walk away, when I decided to get some classic Chicago pizza. While the employees are nice, their service is ridiculously slow. As long as I was not in a hurry, I was very pleased with the service.As for the pizza, I fell in love! I had their pizza for both lunch and dinner, two days in a row, and I never got tired of it. I know that sounds kind of like over-kill, but I do not know when I'm going to be back in Chicago, so I figured I should take advantage of it while I was there.

5.description: Being one of the few restaurants that is around the IIT campus, it is the best option for me. It offers deep dish pizza by the slice, chicken tenders, etc. The pizza is okay- nothing special. However, like the saying goes, "Beggars can't be choosers."

35.description: I wanted to wash away my sorrow with food, so we called up Miller Pizza on a Thursday afternoon for pick up.  I ordered a large pizza, half sausage and half green peppers and onions.  The person manning the counter was very nice and handed me my pizza twenty minutes after my call.  The location itself was nice, but it lent itself more as a take out/delivery place due to size and the type of seating.  I immediately rushed home to try out their pizza.  The pizza was extremely thin crust, relatively light (compared with home run inn, rosati's, etc.)  The sausage pizza itself was very good.  My only criticisms are that it was a little salty and a little expensive for the thinness of the pizza ($16).  But, one of the more decent thin crust pizzas I've had, especially in the area. We will definitely return, expecially if we desire a pizza that won't over stuff.

19.description: Stopped in the other day and ordered 2 slices of the "deep dish" sausage & pepperoni.  Although they call it deep dish, it's more like the middle weight pizza sold at Connie's.  Deep dish usually means a lot of cheese.  This has the same amount of cheese you'd expect on a thin crust pizza, but the crust is thicker.  Kinda doughy, but not bad by any means. $5 for 2 slices, I'm not complaining.  They have a few tables and chairs, but I'd suggest taking your food to-go because it's not a big place. Service is fast and the cashier is polite.  Customer service is a big plus, especially in the hood.

28.description: Well i decided not to cook today and ordered some pizza, the deep dish is not the same as Edwardos but its good. the deep dish is like pizza hut with a much much much better crust. i got the thin crust for my kids and they ate the whole thing in an hour. they always have excellent service when i order delivery. the drivers are always different but have such great customer service skills that i get a thank  you for the tip all the time. i am definitely ordering my pizzas from here for my next party!

3.description: Although my pizza arrived about 40 mins before I was told (a BIG plus), I was very displeased with the taste and even the look of the pizza. I ordered a very simple sausage pizza, they put minimal amounts of sausage on the pie. The cheese had hardly any flavor. The sauce was about and inch and a half to two inches from the crust to where the cheese began. The tomato sauce tasted like tomato paste. I had to wipe off some of the sauce just to prevent it from dripping off my pizza. I usually order from places I am familiar with and I am guaranties a delicious pie. But, in this case I ran across a few coupons in the mail and decided to give another place a chance. Big mistake! Needless to say, I would never order from them again. I'll stick to their competitors.

33.description: I love supporting smaller businesses around the Bronzeville area because I lived here for about 6 years but I have to say that I'm not satisfied with their delivery service.We ordered a medium pizza, fries, and two cheesecake online and it was scheduled to deliver in 40 minutes. 50 minutes into our wait, we get a phone call saying that they didn't get our order earlier and that they'll be 10 minutes late. To make up, they'll throw in complimentary fries. We agreed and waited. 1hr and 15 minutes into our wait, we call them to ask the status of our food and they state that it's going to be another 15 minutes or so. At that point, we didn't want to wait any longer so we tried to cancel our order but then they quickly stated that our pizza is out of the oven and will be out for delivery. To make up, they'll also throw in complimentary drinks. We agreed and got our orders 10 minutes later. (A total wait time of 1hr 25min)I would've given them 1 or 2 more stars except our fries (the one we ordered and the complimentary fries) were not warm, our pizza was undercooked, we ordered half mushroom and half spinach (a valid option on their website) but got our pizza with both toppings mixed and they gave us the wrong cheesecake (we ordered chocolate chip, but they gave us original). I also asked the delivery girl to tell her manager to give me a call so I can talk with him/her and she said she will. It's been an hour and still no phone call :(Sorry Miller's, but I have to give you a 1 star.

43.description: Pizza delivery was late. The pizza was room temperature. The sauce tasted like ketchup. The pepperoni was burnt. I really wanted to support the neighborhood pizza joint but no can do. Disappointed Bronzeville Resident. :(

2.description: Ordered right before delivery stopped for the night. Got a call 5 minutes later that the kitchen was closing & they couldn't make anything AND that they were sending their delivery guy home for the night AND there was 'no alfredo sauce anyway.'So 3 excuses for why they didn't feel like taking my order. If you're not open you're not open, but at least get the hours right. Guy on the phone was unapologetic & annoyed that I even tried to order. Would've been my first order from them, but that's just not going to happen. Then Seamless calls to ask why I called and cancelled my order, guy said it was because they were out of sauce & I just didn't want the food. So he lied, as if no one would figure that one out. Told customer service & she was surprised & offered to refund my order. I would hope I'd at the very least get a refund... Will not be attempting to order from this place again.

18.description: The only reason I am giving this restaurant a 3-star review is because of the staff. They tend to be really rude and sometimes will sit on the phone while they should be working talking to their friends. However, I keep seeing reviews on how horrible the food is and how horrible delivery is. I cannot speak for those as I have only tried the Pizza and have never gotten anything delivered. I always get pizza slices in the store and they are quite delicious and fresh. However, make sure you bring hand sanitizer if you want to wash your hands as they don't offer their restroom to the public.

41.description: just finished their chicken philly it was great! Also had a slice of cheese pizza last week  n it was good ...Glad to have more options in bronzville!

4.description: If I could give this place less than 1 star I would because they lied to me on the phone.  I ordered online, and after waiting 40 minutes, I got concerned. Just to be sure they got my order, I followed up by phone.  The guy said "Oh yes, it's in the oven now." Then someone called me a few minutes later to say that they were out of mushrooms and it would take even longer for them to go to the store and buy some.  So what happened to it being in the oven now?  I was annoyed that they had lied to me, but agreed to wait.  When the pizza finally arrived, the guy was apologetic and gave me a free liter of Pepsi in an attempt to make up for the problems.  We don't drink soda pop, but it was a nice gesture anyway.  The pizza was OK. Too many other places to choose from than to deal with bad service and liars.

6.description: One of the best places in the city to get a slice of pizza!!! That is not paper thin and greasy!! Ughhhh, I so love this place, you can NEVER go wrong. Unless they ran out of slices lol I've only actually ordered a pizza twice; its was pretty good too.

22.description: This place of business has the worst customer service when answering the phone. The females who answers the phone "mostly",  has the worst attitudes and diction, they sound unfriendly and un-consuming, most of the time i hang up when they answer the phone,  hoping someone with more professionalism would pick up the phone. I usually ask for a manager, which they tell be one is not available. This would be a okay place if it wasn't for the pathetic phone etiquette.

15.description: Oh my. They are unbelievably slow. They once told me it would take and hour and a half to cook pasta! Another time it took fifty minutes to get pasta. I don't know how this is physically possible.The only thing that is available is the pizza that really isn't very good.

20.description: Exactly on-time for online delivery order. Delicious. Friendly and professional customer service. Perfect and simple for busy people!

36.description: I am glad to have this place in Bronzeville!  I called for a pizza Friday night, and they delivered it within about 40 minutes.  They even called when they were outside, so that I could grab cash by the time they got to the door.The people were friendly, and the pizza was good.  I will definitely order from them again, but next time I'll probably pick it up myself to save on delivery.Oh, and I want to try their huge pizza next time :)

14.description: Delicious pizza at an affordable price! I love their thick crust pizza, but the thin crust is good too. Quick service. Great place for lunch.
